“If she's amazing, she won't be easy. If she's easy, she won't be amazing. If she's worth it, you wont give up. If you give up, you're not worthy. ... Truth is, everybody is going to hurt you; you just gotta find the ones worth suffering for.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “分离之所以如此痛苦，是因为我们的灵魂是相连的。”
quote_en:
“The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “人比机器更难相处。当你伤害一个人时，他就无法修复。”
quote_en:
“People are more difficult to work with than machines. And when you break a person, he can't be fixed.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “教育是一件令人钦佩的事情，但最好不时地记住，没有什么值得知道的东西可以教。”
quote_en:
“Education is an admirable thing, but it is well to remember from time to time that nothing that is worth knowing can be taught.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “祈祷的功能不是影响上帝，而是改变祈祷者的性质。”
quote_en:
“The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.”
    
  ―

“If you obey all of the rules, you miss all of the fun.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “除非你有时不快乐，否则你不可能快乐。”
quote_en:
“You can't be happy unless you're unhappy sometimes".”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “还有比独处更糟糕的事情，但往往需要几十年的时间才能意识到这一点，而且最常见的情况是，你做得太晚了，没有什么比太晚更糟糕的了”
quote_en:
“there are worse thingsthan being alonebut it often takesdecades to realize thisand most often when you doit's too lateand there's nothing worsethan too late”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你被打开时跳舞。当你撕下绷带时跳舞。在战斗中跳舞。在你的血液中舞蹈。当你完全自由时跳舞。”
quote_en:
“Dance, when you're broken open. Dance, if you've torn the bandage off. Dance in the middle of the fighting. Dance in your blood. Dance when you're perfectly free.”
    
  ―

“War must be, while we defend our lives against a destroyer who would devour all; but I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory. I love only that which they defend.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “爱与分离是不可能的。你会希望如此。你可以改变爱，忽略它，混淆它，但你永远无法把它从你身上拔出来。我从经验中知道诗人是对的：爱是永恒的。”
quote_en:
“It isn't possible to love and part. You will wish that it was. You can transmute love, ignore it, muddle it, but you can never pull it out of you. I know by experience that the poets are right: love is eternal.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “仅仅因为你称电鳗为橡皮鸭，并不意味着它就是橡皮鸭，对吧？上帝保佑那个决定和鸭子一起洗澡的可怜的混蛋。（Jace Wayland）”
quote_en:
“Just because you call an electric eel a rubber duck doesn't make it a rubber duck, does it? And God help the poor bastard who decides they want to take a bath with the duckie. (Jace Wayland)”
    
  ―

“Now, you two – this year, you behave yourselves. If I get one more owl telling me you've – you've blown up a toilet or –""Blown up a toilet? We've never blown up a toilet.""Great idea though, thanks, Mum.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “跟随你的内心，倾听你内心的声音，停止关心别人的想法。”
quote_en:
“Follow your heart, listen to your inner voice, stop caring about what others think.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “啊，”门口有个声音说，“你每年都要开一次‘大家都认为威尔是个疯子’的会议，是吗？”杰姆说，“一年两次。”。“不，这不是那次会议。”
quote_en:
“Ah,” said a voice from the doorway, “having your annual ‘everyone thinks Will is a lunatic’ meeting, are you? “It’s biannual,” said Jem. “And no, this is not that meeting.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们失去的东西最终会以我们期望的方式回来。”
quote_en:
“Things we lose have a way of coming back to us in the end, if not always in the way we expect.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “所以，随着阳光和树上树叶的绽放，就像快速电影中的东西一样，我有一种熟悉的信念，那就是随着夏天的到来，生活又重新开始了。”
quote_en:
“And so with the sunshine and the great bursts of leaves growing on the trees, just as things grow in fast movies, I had that familiar conviction that life was beginning over again with the summer.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你知道自己正在失去灵魂，那么你还有一个灵魂可以失去”
quote_en:
“If you're losing your soul and you know it, then you've still got a soul left to lose”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我闭上眼睛，整个世界都死了；我抬起眼睑，一切都重生了。（我想我是在脑海里编造了你。）”
quote_en:
“I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead;I lift my lids and all is born again.(I think I made you up inside my head.)”
    
  ―

“Finally, from so little sleeping and so much reading, his brain dried up and he went completely out of his mind.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这是你的生命，一刻一刻地结束。”
quote_en:
“This is your life and its ending one moment at a time.”
    
  ―

“I'm so glad I live in a world where there are Octobers.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “树木是大地写在天空上的诗，我们把它们砍倒，变成纸，这样我们就可以记录我们的空虚。”
quote_en:
“Trees are poems the earth writes upon the sky, We fell them down and turn them into paper,That we may record our emptiness.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果他没有伤害我的自尊心，我很容易原谅他的骄傲。”
quote_en:
“I could easily forgive his pride, if he had not mortified mine.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在隆冬之际，我发现我内心有一个不可战胜的夏天。这让我很高兴。因为它告诉我，无论世界对我施加多大的压力，在我内心，都有更强大的东西——更好的东西，正在反击。”
quote_en:
“In the midst of winter, I found there was, within me, an invincible summer.And that makes me happy. For it says that no matter how hard the world pushes against me, within me, there’s something stronger – something better, pushing right back.”
    
  ―

“Maybe who we are isn't so much about what we do, but rather what we're capable of when we least expect it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你真的想伤害你的父母，而且你没有勇气成为同性恋，你至少可以从事艺术。我不是在开玩笑。艺术不是谋生的方式。它们是一种让生活更容易忍受的非常人性化的方式。练习一门艺术，无论好坏，都是让你的灵魂成长的一种方式，看在上帝的份上。在淋浴时唱歌。对着收音机跳舞。讲故事。给朋友写一首诗，即使是一首糟糕的诗。尽你所能。你会得到巨大的回报。你会创造一些东西。”
quote_en:
“If you want to really hurt you parents, and you don't have the nerve to be gay, the least you can do is go into the arts. I'm not kidding. The arts are not a way to make a living. They are a very human way of making life more bearable. Practicing an art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow, for heaven's sake. Sing in the shower. Dance to the radio. Tell stories. Write a poem to a friend, even a lousy poem. Do it as well as you possible can. You will get an enormous reward. You will have created something.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个人拒绝崇拜上帝不会削弱上帝的荣耀，就像一个疯子在牢房的墙上涂鸦‘黑暗’一词不会熄灭太阳一样。”
quote_en:
“A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell.”
    
  ―

“Mom. I have something to tell you. I’m undead. Now, I know you may have some preconceived notions about the undead. I know you may not be comfortable with the idea of me being undead. But I’m here to tell you that undead are just like you and me … well, okay. Possibly more like me than you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “关于焚书的问题：我要祝贺图书馆员，他们并不以体力、强大的政治关系或巨大的财富而闻名，他们在全国各地都坚决抵制反民主的霸凌者，这些霸凌者试图从书架上撤下某些书籍，并拒绝向思想警察透露查看这些书籍的人的名字。因此，我所热爱的美国仍然存在，如果不是在白宫、最高法院、参议院、众议院或媒体的话。我所喜爱的美国仍然在我们公共图书馆的前台。”
quote_en:
“And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.So the America I loved still exists, if not in the White House or the Supreme Court or the Senate or the House of Representatives or the media. The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “许多人为了追求大幸福而失去了小快乐。”
quote_en:
“Many people lose the small joys in the hope for the big happiness.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我们累了，我们就会被我们很久以前征服的想法所攻击。”
quote_en:
“When we are tired, we are attacked by ideas we conquered long ago.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “再多的遗憾也改变不了过去，再多的担忧也改变不了未来。”
quote_en:
“No amount of regretting can change the past, and no amount of worrying can change the future.”
    
  ―

“We are all alone, born alone, die alone, and—in spite of True Romance magazines—we shall all someday look back on our lives and see that, in spite of our company, we were alone the whole way. I do not say lonely—at least, not all the time—but essentially, and finally, alone. This is what makes your self-respect so important, and I don't see how you can respect yourself if you must look in the hearts and minds of others for your happiness.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我曾经爱过的人给了我一个装满黑暗的盒子。我花了很多年才明白，这也是一份礼物。”
quote_en:
“Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understand that this too, was a gift.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一旦你尝过飞行的滋味，你将永远仰望天空，在地球上行走，因为你一直在那里，你永远渴望回到那里。”
quote_en:
“Once you have tasted flight, you will forever walk the earth with your eyes turned skyward, for there you have been, and there you will always long to return.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “生活就是接受一路上的挑战，选择继续前进，享受这段旅程。”
quote_en:
“Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果一个人没有好好吃饭，就无法好好思考、好好爱、好好睡。”
quote_en:
“One cannot think well, love well, sleep well, if one has not dined well.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这条路从它开始的那扇门一直走下去。现在，这条路已经走了很远，如果可以的话，我必须追随它，用热切的脚步追寻它，直到它与一条更大的路汇合，那里有许多小径和差事。那么，去哪里呢？我说不清。”
quote_en:
“The Road goes ever on and onDown from the door where it began.Now far ahead the Road has gone,And I must follow, if I can,Pursuing it with eager feet,Until it joins some larger wayWhere many paths and errands meet.And whither then? I cannot say”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “金钱买不到的15件事时间、幸福、内心平静、正直、爱、品格、礼仪、健康、尊重、道德、信任、耐心、阶级、常识、尊严。”
quote_en:
“Top 15 Things Money Can’t BuyTime. Happiness. Inner Peace. Integrity. Love. Character. Manners. Health. Respect. Morals. Trust. Patience. Class. Common sense. Dignity.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们必须不断地从悬崖上跳下来，在下降的过程中发展我们的翅膀。”
quote_en:
“We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你把你的心给了别人，他们死了，他们会带走吗？你会永远在内心一个无法填补的洞里度过余生吗？”
quote_en:
“If you gave someone your heart and they died, did they take it with them? Did you spend the rest of forever with a hole inside you that couldn't be filled?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我们不再能够改变一种情况时，我们就面临着改变自己的挑战。”
quote_en:
“When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “衡量智力的标准是改变的能力。”
quote_en:
“The measure of intelligence is the ability to change.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “事情就是这样。你永远不会习惯有人离开的想法。就在你认为已经和解、被接受的时候，有人向你指出了这一点，它又一次击中了你，太令人震惊了。”
quote_en:
“That was the thing. You never got used to it, the idea of someone being gone. Just when you think it's reconciled, accepted, someone points it out to you, and it just hits you all over again, that shocking.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我是个文盲，但我读了很多书。”
quote_en:
“I'm quite illiterate, but I read a lot. ”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要说你没有足够的时间。你每天的时间与海伦·凯勒、巴斯德、米开朗基罗、特蕾莎修女、达·芬奇、托马斯·杰斐逊和阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦的时间完全相同。”
quote_en:
“Don't say you don't have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Pasteur, Michelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson, and Albert Einstein.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “书籍有一种独特的方式，可以在特定的时刻停止时间，并说：让我们不要忘记这一点。”
quote_en:
“Books have a unique way of stopping time in a particular moment and saying: Let’s not forget this.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你看，杜鹃是寄生虫。它们在其他鸟巢里下蛋。当蛋孵化时，小杜鹃会把其他小鸟赶出巢穴。可怜的父母鸟会拼命工作，试图找到足够的食物来喂养那个杀害了它们的孩子并取代它们的位置的巨大的杜鹃孩子。”“巨大的？”Jace说。“你刚才叫我胖吗？”“这是一个类比。”“我不胖。”
quote_en:
“You see, cuckoos are parasites. They lay their eggs in other birds' nests. When the egg hatches, the baby cuckoo pushes the other baby birds out of the nest. The poor parent birds work themselves to death trying to find enough food to feed the enormous cuckoo child who has murdered their babies and taken their places.""Enormous?" said Jace. "Did you just call me fat?""It was an analogy.""I am not fat.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个人至少应该每天听一首小歌，读一首好诗，看一幅精美的画，如果可能的话，说几句合理的话。”
quote_en:
“One ought, every day at least, to hear a little song, read a good poem, see a fine picture, and, if it were possible, to speak a few reasonable words.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “从眼角的余光，她以为她看到杰斯愤怒地朝她看了一眼，但当她瞥了他一眼时，他看起来和往常一样：轻松、自信、有点无聊。”他说，“以后，克拉丽莎，为了避免这种乏味的情况，提一提你已经有个男人在床上可能是明智的。”“你邀请他进来了。”西蒙问，看起来很震惊。“荒谬，不是吗？”杰斯说。“我们永远不会完全合得来。”“我没有邀请他上床，”克拉里厉声说道。“我们只是在接吻。”“只是接吻？”杰西的语气用虚假的伤害嘲笑她。“你多么迅速地抛弃了我们的爱。”
quote_en:
“Out of the corner of her eye she thought she saw Jace shoot her a look of white rage - but when she glanced at him, he looked as he always did: easy, confident, slightly bored."In future, Clarissa," he said, "it might be wise to mention that you already have a man in your bed, to avoid such tedious situations.""You invited him into " Simon demanded, looking shaken."Ridiculous, isn't it?" said Jace. "We would never have all fit.""I didn't invite him into bed," Clary snapped. "We were just kissing.""Just kissing?" Jace's tone mocked her with its false hurt. "How swiftly you dismiss our love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当然，当有人哭泣时，高尚的做法是安慰他们。但如果有人试图掩饰他们的眼泪，假装你没有注意到他们也可能是高尚的。”
quote_en:
“When someone is crying, of course, the noble thing to do is to comfort them. But if someone is trying to hide their tears, it may also be noble to pretend you do not notice them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “现实就是当你不再相信它时，它不会消失。”
quote_en:
“Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你对某种东西过敏，最好不要把它放进嘴里，尤其是如果它是猫。”
quote_en:
“If you are allergic to a thing, it is best not to put that thing in your mouth, particularly if the thing is cats.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “要有足够的勇气再相信一次爱，而且永远再信任一次。”
quote_en:
“Have enough courage to trust love one more time and always one more time.”
    
  ―

“The only way to deal with an unfree world is to become so absolutely free that your very existence is an act of rebellion.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “霍利？你面前有全世界与耳朵有关的幽默，你喜欢霍利吗？”
quote_en:
“Holey? You have the the whole world of ear-related humor before you, you go for holey?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “除了你自己，你不知道任何人的生活中发生了什么。当你弄乱一个人生活的一部分时，你不仅仅是弄乱了那一部分。不幸的是，你不能那么精确和有选择性。当你搅乱一个人生活中的一部分时，你就是在弄乱他们的整个生活。一切……都会影响一切。”
quote_en:
“You don’t know what goes on in anyone’s life but your own. And when you mess with one part of a person’s life, you’re not messing with just that part. Unfortunately, you can’t be that precise and selective. When you mess with one part of a person’s life, you’re messing with their entire life. Everything. . . affects everything.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要把生活看得太严肃。当它需要好好打击的时候，打它一拳。嘲笑它。”
quote_en:
“Don't take life too seriously. Punch it in the face when it needs a good hit. Laugh at it.”
    
  ―

“Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “人们认为亲密是关于性的。但亲密是关于真相的。当你意识到你可以告诉别人你的真相，当你可以向他们展示自己，当你光着身子站在他们面前，他们的反应是‘你和我在一起很安全’时，这就是亲密。”
quote_en:
“People think that intimacy is about sex. But intimacy is about truth. When you realize you can tell someone your truth, when you can show yourself to them, when you stand in front of them bare and their response is 'you're safe with me'- that's intimacy.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个爱，一颗心，一个命运。”
quote_en:
“One love, one heart, one destiny.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “世界上最美丽的东西是看不见也摸不着的，它们是用心感受的。”
quote_en:
“The most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or touched, they are felt with the heart.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “最好的书……是那些告诉你你已经知道的东西的书。”
quote_en:
“The best books... are those that tell you what you know already.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你一生中有两个朋友，你是幸运的。如果你有一个好朋友，你就非常幸运了。”
quote_en:
“If you have two friends in your lifetime, you're lucky. If you have one good friend, you're more than lucky.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当一个人被剥夺了过他所信仰的生活的权利时，他别无选择，只能成为一名歹徒。”
quote_en:
“When a man is denied the right to live the life he believes in, he has no choice but to become an outlaw.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你对每一次揉搓都很恼火，你的镜子怎么擦？”
quote_en:
“If you are irritated by every rub, how will your mirror be polished?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不会让任何人用肮脏的脚走过我的脑海。”
quote_en:
“I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet.”
    
  ―

“I'm a grenade and at some point I'm going to blow up and I would like to minimize the casualties, okay?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果我死了，上帝保佑，让这成为我的墓志铭：他需要GODWAS音乐存在的唯一证据”
quote_en:
“If I should ever die, God forbid, let this be my epitaph:THE ONLY PROOF HE NEEDEDFOR THE EXISTENCE OF GODWAS MUSIC”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “每一代人都认为自己比前一代人更聪明，比后一代人更有智慧。”
quote_en:
“Every generation imagines itself to be more intelligent than the one that went before it, and wiser than the one that comes after it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当有人离开时，是因为其他人即将到来。”
quote_en:
“When someone leaves, it's because someone else is about to arrive.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “故事很可能是谎言，但它们是说真话的好谎言，有时可以支付租金。”
quote_en:
“Stories may well be lies, but they are good lies that say true things, and which can sometimes pay the rent.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想和你做春天对樱桃树做的事。”
quote_en:
“I wantTo do with you what spring does with the cherry trees.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “永远和我在一起——以任何形式——让我发疯！只是不要把我留在这个深渊里，在那里我找不到你！哦，天哪！这是无法形容的！我不能没有我的生活！我不能失去我的灵魂！”
quote_en:
“Be with me always - take any form - drive me mad! only do not leave me in this abyss, where I cannot find you! Oh, God! it is unutterable! I can not live without my life! I can not live without my soul!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “任何傻瓜都可以快乐。只有一个真正有爱心的人才能把让我们哭泣的东西变成美。”
quote_en:
“Any fool can be happy. It takes a man with real heart to make beauty out of the stuff that makes us weep.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “爱越深，悲剧结束时就越大。”
quote_en:
“The greater the love, the greater the tragedy when it's over.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “但我不想要安慰。我想要上帝，我想要诗歌，我想要真正的危险，我想要自由，我想要善良。我想要罪恶。”
quote_en:
“But I don't want comfort. I want God, I want poetry, I want real danger, I want freedom, I want goodness. I want sin.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “通常我脾气很好。试试看哪天不会以y结束。”
quote_en:
“Usually I'm remarkably good natured. Try me on a day that doesn't end in y.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “蛇怪的毒牙从赫敏的怀里掉了出来，发出一声哗啦的响声。她冲向罗恩，把毒牙扔到他的脖子上，吻了他的嘴。罗恩扔掉手里的毒牙和扫帚，热情地回答，把赫敏抬了起来。”哈利虚弱地问，除了罗恩和赫敏更紧紧地抓住对方，当场摇晃外，什么也没发生，他提高了嗓门。“喂！这里正在打仗！”罗恩和赫敏分手了，他们的手臂仍然搂着对方。“我知道，伙计，”罗恩说，他看起来好像最近被击中了后背。拿着钝器的脑袋，“机不可失，时不再来，不是吗？”“没关系，魂器怎么办？”哈利喊道。“你觉得你能不能——把它藏起来，直到我们拿到王冠？”“是的——对了——抱歉——”罗恩说，他和赫敏开始竖起脸上都是粉红色的尖牙。”
quote_en:
“There was a clatter as the basilisk fangs cascaded out of Hermione's arms. Running at Ron, she flung them around his neck and kissed him full on the mouth. Ron threw away the fangs and broomstick he was holding and responded with such enthusiasm that he lifted Hermione off her feet. "Is this the moment?" Harry asked weakly, and when nothing happened except that Ron and Hermione gripped each other still more firmly and swayed on the spot, he raised his voice. "OI! There's a war going on here!" Ron and Hermione broke apart, their arms still around each other. "I know, mate," said Ron, who looked as though he had recently been hit on the back of the head with a Bludger, "so it's now or never, isn't it?" "Never mind that, what about the Horcrux?" Harry shouted. "D'you think you could just --- just hold it in, until we've got the diadem?" "Yeah --- right --- sorry ---" said Ron, and he and Hermione set about gathering up fangs, both pink in the face.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我发现，人是层层的秘密。你相信你了解他们，你理解他们，但他们的动机总是对你隐瞒，埋在他们自己的心里。你永远不会了解他们，但有时你决定相信他们。”
quote_en:
“People, I have discovered, are layers and layers of secrets. You believe you know them, that you understand them, but their motives are always hidden from you, buried in their own hearts. You will never know them, but sometimes you decide to trust them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “时间是一种毒品。太多的时间会害死你。”
quote_en:
“Time is a drug. Too much of it kills you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在古代，猫被当作神来崇拜；他们没有忘记这一点。”
quote_en:
“In ancient times cats were worshipped as gods; they have not forgotten this.”
    
  ―

“We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “善举：一个随机的善举，无论多小，都会对别人的生活产生巨大的影响。”
quote_en:
“Acts of Kindness:A random act of kindness, no matter how small, can make a tremendous impact on someone else's life.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “天空下的精灵国王有三枚戒指，石头大厅里的矮人领主有七枚戒指，注定要死的凡人有九枚戒指，阴影所在的魔多之地黑暗王座上的黑魔王有一枚戒指。一枚戒指统治他们，一枚戒指找到他们，一只戒指把他们全部带到黑暗中捆绑起来。在阴影所在的摩尔多之地。”
quote_en:
“Three Rings for the Elven-kings under the sky, Seven for the Dwarf-lords in their halls of stone,Nine for Mortal Men, doomed to die, One for the Dark Lord on his dark throneIn the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie. One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them, One Ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them.In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “爱不是深情的感觉，而是对所爱之人的终极利益的坚定愿望。”
quote_en:
“Love is not affectionate feeling, but a steady wish for the loved person's ultimate good as far as it can be obtained.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你不能对爱国主义如此盲目，以至于无法面对现实。错就是错，无论谁做或说。”
quote_en:
“You're not to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who does it or says it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “死亡也有一颗心。”
quote_en:
“Even death has a heart.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你从灵魂中做事时，你会感觉到一条河流在你体内流动，一种快乐。”
quote_en:
“When you do things from your soul, you feel a river moving in you, a joy.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我，我自己，完全是由缺陷组成的，用善意缝合在一起。”
quote_en:
“I, myself, am made entirely of flaws, stitched together with good intentions.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “和弗雷德和乔治一起长大的事情，”金妮若有所思地说，“就是如果你有足够的勇气，你会开始觉得一切皆有可能。”
quote_en:
“The thing about growing up with Fred and George," said Ginny thoughtfully, "is that you sort of start thinking anything's possible if you've got enough nerve.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “为和平而战就像为贞操而搞砸。”
quote_en:
“Fighting for peace is like screwing for virginity.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “除了诱惑，我什么都能抗拒。”
quote_en:
“I can resist anything except temptation.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “身心健康的秘诀不是哀悼过去，也不是担心未来，而是明智而认真地活在当下。”
quote_en:
“The secret of health for both mind and body is not to mourn for the past, nor to worry about the future, but to live the present moment wisely and earnestly.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你生来就有翅膀，为什么宁愿在生命中爬行？”
quote_en:
“You were born with wings, why prefer to crawl through life?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “孤独很好，但你需要有人告诉你孤独很好。”
quote_en:
“Solitude is fine but you need someone to tell that solitude is fine.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “也许有些事你不敢说，或者有些人你不敢爱，或者有些地方你不敢去。这会很痛。这会因为它很重要而很痛。”
quote_en:
“Maybe there's something you're afraid to say, or someone you're afraid to love, or somewhere you're afraid to go. It's gonna hurt. It's gonna hurt because it matters.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 尽管如此，经过这么长时间，太阳从未对地球说：“你欠我。”看看这样的爱会发生什么，它照亮了整个天空
quote_en:
“And still, after all this time,The sun never says to the earth,"You owe Me."Look what happens withA love like that,It lights the Whole Sky.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “因为你很漂亮。我喜欢看漂亮的人，不久前我决定不剥夺自己生存的简单乐趣”
quote_en:
“Because you are beautiful. I enjoy looking at beautiful people, and I decided a while ago not to deny myself the simpler pleasures of existence”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有比爱同一本书的人之间形成的友谊更快、更牢固的了。”
quote_en:
“There are no faster or firmer friendships than those formed between people who love the same books.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “忘记安全。住在你害怕住的地方。毁掉你的声誉。臭名昭著。”
quote_en:
“Forget safety.Live where you fear to live.Destroy your reputation.Be notorious.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “即使你独自一人，也要勇敢地坚持你的信仰。”
quote_en:
“Be brave to stand for what you believe in even if you stand alone.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我闭上眼睛，整个世界都死了；我抬起眼睛，一切都重生了。”
quote_en:
“I shut my eyes and all the world drops dead; I lift my eyes and all is born again.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “生命的缩小或扩大与一个人的勇气成正比。”
quote_en:
“Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “所以，当你迈出第一步时，一定要小心和机智。记住，生活是一个伟大的平衡行为。你会成功吗？是的！你会的，真的！（98%和¾%保证）孩子，你会移山填海。”
quote_en:
“So be sure when you step, Step with care and great tact. And remember that life's A Great Balancing Act. And will you succeed? Yes! You will, indeed! (98 and ¾ percent guaranteed) Kid, you'll move mountains.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “也许全世界的每个人都害怕对方。”
quote_en:
“Maybe ever’body in the whole damn world is scared of each other.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “但是美人鱼没有眼泪，所以她受的苦更多。”
quote_en:
“But a mermaid has no tears, and therefore she suffers so much more.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一定要像你说的喝醉酒时那样清醒。这会教会你闭嘴。”
quote_en:
“Always do sober what you said you'd do drunk. That will teach you to keep your mouth shut.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你的所作所为，你的思维方式，让你变得美丽。”
quote_en:
“What you do, the way you think, makes you beautiful.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “直面自己的黑暗部分，努力用光明和宽恕来驱逐它们。你愿意与恶魔搏斗，这会让你的天使们歌唱。”
quote_en:
“Confront the dark parts of yourself, and work to banish them with illumination and forgiveness. Your willingness to wrestle with your demons will cause your angels to sing.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你怀疑自己是否能飞的时候，你就永远无法飞了。”
quote_en:
“The moment you doubt whether you can fly, you cease for ever to be able to do it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 我会做一些事情，比如坐上出租车，说：“去图书馆，踩上去。”
quote_en:
“I do things like get in a taxi and say, "The library, and step on it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想告诉偷书贼很多事情，关于美丽和残忍。但是，对于那些她不知道的事情，我能告诉她什么呢？我想解释的是，我一直在高估和低估人类，我很少简单地估计它。我想问她，同样的事情怎么会如此丑陋和光荣，它的文字和故事怎么会如此诅咒和精彩。”
quote_en:
“I wanted to tell the book thief many things, about beauty and brutality. But what could I tell her about those things that she didn't already know? I wanted to explain that I am constantly overestimating and underestimating the human race-that rarely do I ever simply estimate it. I wanted to ask her how the same thing could be so ugly and so glorious, and its words and stories so damning and brilliant.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “的确，我们遇到的人可以改变我们，有时是如此深刻，以至于我们后来甚至在我们的名字上都不一样。”
quote_en:
“It is true that those we meet can change us, sometimes so profoundly that we are not the same afterwards, even unto our names.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “沉默之后，最接近表达无法表达的是音乐。”
quote_en:
“After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “就像你内心着火一样。月亮就在你的皮肤里。”
quote_en:
“As if you were on fire from within.The moon lives in the lining of your skin.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “任何东西的初稿都是狗屎。”
quote_en:
“The first draft of anything is shit.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我14岁的时候，我父亲太无知了，我几乎无法忍受有老人在身边。但当我21岁的时候。我惊讶地发现，老人在七年里学到了很多东西。”
quote_en:
“When I was a boy of 14, my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be 21, I was astonished at how much the old man had learned in seven years.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “因为去年的话语属于去年的语言，明年的话语等待着另一个声音。”
quote_en:
“For last year's words belong to last year's language And next year's words await another voice.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你知道什么是魅力：一种在没有提出任何明确问题的情况下得到肯定答案的方法。”
quote_en:
“You know what charm is: a way of getting the answer yes without having asked any clear question.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你什么都不说。”
quote_en:
“You speak an infinite deal of nothing.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “生活的目的不是为了快乐。而是为了有用，为了可敬，为了富有同情心，为了让你生活得更好而有所不同。”
quote_en:
“The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate, to have it make some difference that you have lived and lived well.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “他对我做了什么，那个男孩。每次都是。这是他唯一的伤害。他踩到了我的心。他让我哭了。”
quote_en:
“He does something to me, that boy. Every time. It’s his only detriment. He steps on my heart. He makes me cry.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “怎么这么快就这么晚了？”
quote_en:
“How did it get so late so soon?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我是一个容易激动的人，只会抒情地、音乐地理解生活，在这种人身上，感觉就像理性一样强烈。我非常渴望奇迹，只有奇迹才能控制我。任何我无法转化为奇迹的东西，我都会放手。现实并没有给我留下深刻印象。我只相信陶醉、狂喜，当普通生活束缚我时，我会以某种方式逃离。没有更多的墙壁。”
quote_en:
“I am an excitable person who only understands life lyrically, musically, in whom feelings are much stronger as reason. I am so thirsty for the marvelous that only the marvelous has power over me. Anything I can not transform into something marvelous, I let go. Reality doesn't impress me. I only believe in intoxication, in ecstasy, and when ordinary life shackles me, I escape, one way or another. No more walls.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这些猛烈的快乐有猛烈的结局，在胜利中死亡，就像火和粉末一样，当它们亲吻时会吞噬。最甜的蜂蜜因其自身的美味而令人厌恶，其味道会扰乱食欲。因此，适度的爱；长久的爱就是这样；来得太快和来得太慢一样慢。”
quote_en:
“These violent delights have violent endsAnd in their triumph die, like fire and powder,Which as they kiss consume. The sweetest honeyIs loathsome in his own deliciousnessAnd in the taste confounds the appetite.Therefore love moderately; long love doth so;Too swift arrives as tardy as too slow.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “أحيانًا يساعدنا الآخرون بأن يكونوا فى حياتنا فحسب”
quote_en:
“أحيانًا يساعدنا الآخرون بأن يكونوا فى حياتنا فحسب”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “沙漠之所以美丽，”小王子说，“是因为它藏着一口井……”
quote_en:
“What makes the desert beautiful,' said the little prince, 'is that somewhere it hides a well...”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你所要做的就是写一个真实的句子。写你所知道的最真实的句子
quote_en:
“All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不，我只是个很淘气的男孩。我做各种坏事。我踢小猫。我对修女做粗鲁的手势。”
quote_en:
“No, I'm just a very naughty boy. I do all sorts of bad things. I kick kittens. I make rude gestures at nuns.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “从少数真正属于你自己的好书开始生活是一件好事。”
quote_en:
“It is a great thing to start life with a small number of really good books which are your very own.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我只想成为你心中片刻的空气。我想成为那种不被注意和必要的人。”
quote_en:
“I would like to be the air that inhabits you for a moment only. I would like to be that unnoticed and that necessary.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “罗琳和迈耶都在直接与年轻人交谈……真正的区别在于，乔·罗琳是一位了不起的作家，斯蒂芬妮·迈耶写得一文不值。她不是很好。”
quote_en:
“Both Rowling and Meyer, they’re speaking directly to young people. … The real difference is that Jo Rowling is a terrific writer and Stephenie Meyer can’t write worth a darn. She’s not very good.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “对我来说，无所畏惧不是没有恐惧。它不是完全不害怕。对我而言，无所畏惧是有恐惧。无所畏惧是有怀疑。有很多怀疑。对我来说。无所畏惧是在那些把你吓死的事情中生活。”
quote_en:
“To me, Fearless is not the absense of fear. It's not being completely unafraid. To me, Fearless is having fears. Fearless is having doubts. Lots of them. To me, Fearless is living in spite of those things that scare you to death.”
    
  ―

“An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “别难过，我通常都快死了。”
quote_en:
“Don't feel bad, I'm usually about to die.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个女人期望男人建立她想要的世界，而不是自己创造世界，这有多错？”
quote_en:
“How wrong is it for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “做你的事，不在乎他们是否喜欢。”
quote_en:
“Do your thing and don't care if they like it.”
    
  ―

“The world was hers for the reading.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “世界让每个人都心碎，之后，许多人在破碎的地方变得坚强。”
quote_en:
“The world breaks everyone, and afterward, many are strong at the broken places.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们都有伤疤，……我的只是碰巧比大多数人更明显。”
quote_en:
“We all bear scars,... Mine just happen to be more visible than most.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “理解是接受的第一步，只有接受才能恢复。”
quote_en:
“Understanding is the first step to acceptance, and only with acceptance can there be recovery.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “他们说，当你想念一个人时，他们可能也有同样的感觉，但我认为你不可能像我现在想念你那样想念我。”
quote_en:
“They say when you are missing someone that they are probably feeling the same, but I don't think it's possible for you to miss me as much as I'm missing you right now”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “想象一下，一记耳光后微笑。然后想想一天24小时都这样做。”
quote_en:
“Imagine smiling after a slap in the face. Then think of doing it twenty-four hours a day.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有些年份会提出问题，有些年份会给出答案。”
quote_en:
“There are years that ask questions and years that answer.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “文学是忽视生活的最令人愉快的方式。”
quote_en:
“Literature is the most agreeable way of ignoring life.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 莫说：“一本书读了好几遍，会胖得多，这难道不奇怪吗？”“就好像你每次读这本书的时候，书页之间都会留下一些东西。感觉、思想、声音、气味……然后，多年后当你再次看这本书时，你会发现自己也在那里，一个稍微年轻的自己，稍微不同，就好像这本书把你像一朵压过的花一样保存了下来……既陌生又熟悉。”
quote_en:
“Isn't it odd how much fatter a book gets when you've read it several times?" Mo had said..."As if something were left between the pages every time you read it. Feelings, thoughts, sounds, smells...and then, when you look at the book again many years later, you find yourself there, too, a slightly younger self, slightly different, as if the book had preserved you like a pressed flower...both strange and familiar.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “人们要求言论自由，作为对他们很少使用的思想自由的补偿。”
quote_en:
“People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不是脸，而是脸上的表情。不是声音，而是你说的话。不是你在身体里的样子，而是你用它做的事情。你很漂亮。”
quote_en:
“It's not the face, but the expressions on it. It's not the voice, but what you say. It's not how you look in that body, but the thing you do with it. You are beautiful.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你很善良。你很聪明。你很重要。”
quote_en:
“You is kind. You is smart. You is important.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “再见，”狐狸说，“这是我的秘密，一个非常简单的秘密：只有用心才能看得清楚；本质的东西是肉眼看不见的。”
quote_en:
“Goodbye," said the fox. "And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我做梦。有时候我觉得这是唯一正确的做法。”
quote_en:
“I dream. Sometimes I think that's the only right thing to do.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “放手意味着意识到有些人是你历史的一部分，但不是你命运的一部分。”
quote_en:
“Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你不说出自己的真相，你就不能说出别人的真相。”
quote_en:
“If you do not tell the truth about yourself you cannot tell it about other people.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在我看来，生命太短了，不能花在培养敌意或记录错误上。”
quote_en:
“Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity or registering wrongs.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “阿提克斯让我删除形容词，我就知道事实了。”
quote_en:
“Atticus told me to delete the adjectives and I'd have the facts.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你发现自己陷入了错误的故事，那就离开。”
quote_en:
“If you ever find yourself in the wrong story, leave.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们应该考虑每一天的损失，我们至少没有跳过一次舞。”
quote_en:
“We should consider every day lost on which we have not danced at least once.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这并不是说我很聪明。但我回答问题的时间要长得多。”
quote_en:
“It is not that I'm so smart. But I stay with the questions much longer.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “许多书就像一把钥匙，可以打开自己城堡里未知的房间。”
quote_en:
“Many a book is like a key to unknown chambers within the castle of one’s own self.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “所有伟大而珍贵的东西都是孤独的。”
quote_en:
“All great and precious things are lonely.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不关心你以什么为生。我想知道你为什么而痛苦，你是否敢于梦想满足内心的渴望。我不在乎你多大了。我不想知道你是否会为了爱、为了梦想、为了活着的冒险而冒着看起来像个傻瓜的风险。我不关心是什么行星使你的月亮变方。或者修复它。我想知道你是否能快乐，无论是我的还是你自己的，你是否能狂野地跳舞，让狂喜充满你的指尖和脚趾，而不提醒我们要小心，要现实，要记住人类的局限性。我不关心你告诉我的故事是否属实。我想了解你是否能为了忠于自己而让别人失望；如果你能忍受背叛的指控，而不背叛自己的灵魂；如果你能失信，因此值得信赖。我想知道你是否能每天看到美丽，即使它并不美丽，你是否能从它的存在中汲取自己的生命。我想知道你是否能忍受失败，你的和我的，仍然站在湖边，对着满月的银色大喊：“是的！”我不想知道你住在哪里，你有多少钱。我想知道，在悲伤和绝望的夜晚之后，你是否能站起来，疲惫不堪，遍体鳞伤，做些什么来养活孩子们。我不关心你认识谁，也不关心你是怎么来的。我想知道你是否愿意和我一起站在火焰的中心，毫不退缩。我对你在哪里、学了什么或和谁一起学习不感兴趣。我想知道，当其他一切都消失时，是什么从内心支撑着你。我想知道你是否可以独自一人，你是否真的喜欢在空虚的时刻陪伴你。”
quote_en:
“It doesn't interest me what you do for a living. I want to know what you ache for, and if you dare to dream of meeting your heart's longing.It doesn't interest me how old you are. I want to know if you will risk looking like a fool for love, for your dream, for the adventure of being alive. It doesn't interest me what planets are squaring your moon. I want to know if you have touched the center of your own sorrow, if you have been opened by life's betrayals or have become shriveled and closed from fear of further pain!I want to know if you can sit with pain, mine or your own, without moving to hide it or fade it, or fix it. I want to know if you can be with joy, mine or your own, if you can dance with wildness and let the ecstasy fill you to the tips of your fingers and toes without cautioning us to be careful, to be realistic, to remember the limitations of being human. It doesn't interest me if the story you are telling me is true. I want to know if you can disappoint another to be true to yourself; if you can bear the accusation of betrayal and not betray your own soul; if you can be faithlessand therefore trustworthy. I want to know if you can see beauty even when it's not pretty, every day,and if you can source your own life from its presence. I want to know if you can live with failure, yours and mine, and still stand on the edge of the lake and shout to the silver of the full moon, “Yes!”It doesn't interest me to know where you live or how much money you have. I want to know if you can get up, after the night of grief and despair, weary and bruised to the bone, and do what needs to be done to feed the children. It doesn't interest me who you know or how you came to be here. I want to know if you will stand in the center of the fire with me and not shrink back. It doesn't interest me where or what or with whom you have studied. I want to know what sustains you, from the inside, when all else falls away. I want to know if you can be alone with yourself and if you truly like the company you keep in the empty moments.”
    
  ―

“We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我从不改变，我只是变得更像我自己。”
quote_en:
“I never change, I simply become more myself.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这不是因为我想和她亲热。”等一下。“他抓起一支铅笔，兴奋地在纸上乱涂乱画，好像他刚刚在数学上取得了突破，然后回头看着我。”我只是做了一些计算，我已经能够确定你是个混蛋。”
quote_en:
“It's not because I want to make out with her."Hold on." He grabbed a pencil and scrawled excitedly at the paper as if he'd just made a mathematical breakthrough and then looked back up at me. "I just did some calculations, and I've been able to determine that you're full of shit”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我在想我第一次见到你的时候，”他说，“在那之后，我怎么也忘不了你。我想忘记你，但我无法阻止自己。我强迫霍奇让我成为那个来找你并把你带回学院的人。即使在那时，在那间愚蠢的咖啡馆里，当我看到你和西蒙坐在沙发上时，即使那样我也觉得不对——我应该是那个和你坐在一起的人。那个让你笑的人。我无法摆脱那种感觉。应该是我。我越了解你，就越觉得——从来没有像现在这样过。我以前一直想要一个女孩，然后了解了她，不再想要她了，但和你在一起的感觉越来越强烈，直到那天晚上你出现在伦威克，我才知道。”
quote_en:
“I was thinking about the first time I ever saw you," he said, "and how after that I couldn't forget you. I wanted to, but I couldn't stop myself. I forced Hodge to let me be the one who came to find you and bring you back to the Institue. And even back then, in that stupid coffee shop, when I saw you sitting on that couch with Simon, even then that felt wrong to me-- I should have been the one sitting with you. The one who made you laugh like that. I couldn't get rid of that feeling. That it should have been me. And the more I knew you, the more I felt it--it had never been like that for me before. I'd always wanted a girl and then gotten to know her and not wanted her anymore, but with you the feeling just got stronger and stronger until that night when you showed up at Renwick's and I knew.”
    
  ―

“Suffering has been stronger than all other teaching, and has taught me to understand what your heart used to be. I have been bent and broken, but - I hope - into a better shape.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不总是有好人。也不总是有坏人。大多数人介于两者之间。”
quote_en:
“There is not always a good guy. Nor is there always a bad one. Most people are somewhere in between.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “最勇敢的人是那些不介意看起来像懦夫的人。”
quote_en:
“The bravest people are the ones who don’t mind looking like cowards.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “杰斯珀把头撞到船体上，眼睛朝天望去。”好吧。但如果佩卡·罗林斯把我们都杀了，我就要让怀兰的鬼魂教我的鬼魂吹长笛，这样我就可以惹恼你的鬼魂了。”布雷克的嘴唇翘起。“我就雇马蒂亚斯的鬼魂来踢你的鬼魂屁股。”“我的鬼魂不会和你的鬼魂交往，”马蒂亚斯一本正经地说，然后想知道海风是否在腐蚀他的大脑。”
quote_en:
“Jesper knocked his head against the hull and cast his eyes heavenward. “Fine. But if Pekka Rollins kills us all, I’m going to get Wylan’s ghost to teach my ghost how to play the flute just so that I can annoy the hell out of your ghost.”Brekker’s lips quirked. “I’ll just hire Matthias’ ghost to kick your ghost’s ass.”“My ghost won’t associate with your ghost,” Matthias said primly, and then wondered if the sea air was rotting his brain.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “今天是读者，明天是领导者。”
quote_en:
“Today a reader, tomorrow a leader.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “愤世嫉俗者是一个知道一切的价格，却不知道任何东西的价值的人。”
quote_en:
“A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “永远不要害怕将未知的未来托付给已知的上帝。”
quote_en:
“Never be afraid to trust an unknown future to a known God.”
    
  ―

“You might be poor, your shoes might be broken, but your mind is a palace.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “爱的开始是让我们所爱的人成为完美自己的意愿，是不扭曲他们以符合我们自己形象的决心。如果在爱他们的过程中，我们不爱他们是什么，而只爱他们与自己的潜在相似之处，那么我们就不爱他们：我们只爱我们在他们身上找到的自己的反映”
quote_en:
“The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image. If in loving them we do not love what they are, but only their potential likeness to ourselves, then we do not love them: we only love the reflection of ourselves we find in them”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “今晚，我可以写下最悲伤的诗句。我爱她，有时她也爱我。”
quote_en:
“Tonight I can write the saddest linesI loved her, and sometimes she loved me too.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “言语容易，如风；忠实的朋友很难找到。”
quote_en:
“Words are easy, like the wind; faithful friends are hard to find.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不能相信一个想要一直被赞美的上帝。”
quote_en:
“I cannot believe in a God who wants to be praised all the time.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “每个人在成长过程中都会遇到这种情况。你会发现自己是谁，想要什么，然后你会意识到你认识的人不会像你那样看待事情。所以你保留了美好的回忆，但发现自己在继续前进。”
quote_en:
“It happens to everyone as they grow up. You find out who you are and what you want, and then you realize that people you've known forever don't see things the way you do. So you keep the wonderful memories, but find yourself moving on.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “幸福是个人努力的结果。你为它而战，为它奋斗，坚持它，有时甚至环游世界寻找它。你必须无情地参与自己祝福的表现。一旦你达到了幸福的状态，你就永远不能放松地维护它。你必须付出巨大的努力，永远向上游到幸福中，在幸福之上漂浮。”
quote_en:
“Happiness is the consequence of personal effort. You fight for it, strive for it, insist upon it, and sometimes even travel around the world looking for it. You have to participate relentlessly in the manifestations of your own blessings. And once you have achieved a state of happiness, you must never become lax about maintaining it. You must make a mighty effort to keep swimming upward into that happiness forever, to stay afloat on top of it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “也许，如果不成为你假装的样子，就不可能穿上身份。”
quote_en:
“Perhaps it's impossible to wear an identity without becoming what you pretend to be.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “根据我的经验，如果你下定决心，你几乎总是可以享受事物。”
quote_en:
“It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你不能选择爱她的哪一部分。”
quote_en:
“You cannot pick and choose what parts of her to love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “生活在阳光下，在海里游泳，喝着狂野的空气。”
quote_en:
“Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 西蒙问：“站在窗边嘟囔着血，这是他一直在做的事吗？”杰斯说：“不是的。有时他会坐在沙发上这样做。”
quote_en:
“Is standing by the window muttering about blood something he does all the time?" asked Simon."No," Jace said. "Sometimes he sits on the couch and does it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “永远不要失去希望。风暴会让人变得更强大，也不会永远持续下去。”
quote_en:
“Never lose hope. Storms make people stronger and never last forever.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在某个时候，你只要摘下创可贴，就会感到疼痛，但之后一切都结束了，你就放心了。”
quote_en:
“At some point, you just pull off the Band-Aid, and it hurts, but then it's over and you're relieved.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你生活的幸福取决于你思想的质量。”
quote_en:
“The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “引力不是人们坠入爱河的原因。”
quote_en:
“Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候，把一切都放在心里似乎更安全，因为唯一能判断的人就是你自己。”
quote_en:
“Sometimes it seems safer to hold it all in, where the only person who can judge is yourself.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你不记得发生了什么。你记得的变成了发生的事情。”
quote_en:
“You don't remember what happened. What you remember becomes what happened.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们所要求的只是闪闪发光的权利。”
quote_en:
“All we demanded was our right to twinkle.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要浪费时间解释：人们只会听到他们想听的。”
quote_en:
“Don't waste your time with explanations: people only hear what they want to hear.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要害怕死亡；要害怕没有生命的生活。你不必永远活着，你只需要活着。”
quote_en:
“Don't be afraid of death; be afraid of an unlived life. You don't have to live forever, you just have to live.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “尽管我的名声很可怕，但我真的有一颗小男孩的心。我把它放在桌子上的罐子里。”
quote_en:
“Despite my ghoulish reputation, I really have the heart of a small boy. I keep it in a jar on my desk.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “伊莎贝尔飘了过来，杰斯跟在她身后一步。她穿着一条黑色长裙，配着靴子，还有一件更长的绿色天鹅绒外套，是苔藓的颜色。”“我真不敢相信你做到了！”她喊道。“你是怎么让马格努斯让杰斯离开的？”“用他换了亚历克，”克拉里说。伊莎贝尔看起来有点惊慌。“不是永久性的？”如果他们发现了，爸爸不会高兴的。““你把你的兄弟卖给了一个看起来像同性恋刺猬索尼克、穿着像《奇蒂·奇蒂·邦邦》中的儿童捕手的术士，从而释放了一个可能的罪犯？”西蒙问。“不，可能不是。”
quote_en:
“Isabelle drifted over, Jace a pace behind her. She was wearing a long black dress with boots and an even longer cutaway coat of soft green velvet, the color of moss. "I can't believe you did it!" she exclaimed. "How did you get Magnus to let Jace leave?""Traded him for Alec," Clary said.Isabelle looked mildly alarmed. "Not permanently?""No," said Jace. "Just for a few hours. Unless I don't come back," he added thoughtfully. "In which case, maybe he does get to keep Alec. Think of it as a lease with an option to buy."Isabelle looked dubious. "Mom and Dad won't be pleased if they find out.""That you freed a possible criminal by trading away your brother to a warlock who looks like a gay Sonic the Hedgehog and dresses like the Child Catcher from Chitty Chitty Bang Bang?" Simon inquired. "No, probably not.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果一本关于失败的书卖不出去，那它是成功的吗？”
quote_en:
“If a book about failures doesn't sell, is it a success?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我其实并没有恋爱，但我感到了一种温柔的好奇心。”
quote_en:
“I wasn't actually in love, but I felt a sort of tender curiosity.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “伟大的事情发生在那些不停止相信、尝试、学习和感恩的人身上。”
quote_en:
“Great things happen to those who don't stop believing, trying, learning, and being grateful.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我相信宇宙中充满了智慧生命。它太聪明了，不能来这里。”
quote_en:
“I'm sure the universe is full of intelligent life. It's just been too intelligent to come here.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “他走了下来，尽量不长时间地看着她，仿佛她是太阳，但他看到了她，就像太阳一样，甚至没有看。”
quote_en:
“He stepped down, trying not to look long at her, as if she were the sun, yet he saw her, like the sun, even without looking.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “杀人是被禁止的；因此，所有杀人犯都会受到惩罚，除非他们在号角声中大量杀人。”
quote_en:
“It is forbidden to kill; therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “无论你去哪里，都会以某种方式成为你的一部分。”
quote_en:
“Wherever you go becomes a part of you somehow.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你需要学会如何选择你的想法，就像你每天选择衣服一样。这是一种你可以培养的力量。如果你想如此糟糕地控制生活中的事情，那就锻炼你的头脑。这是你唯一应该努力控制的事情。”
quote_en:
“You need to learn how to select your thoughts just the same way you select your clothes every day. This is a power you can cultivate. If you want to control things in your life so bad, work on the mind. That's the only thing you should be trying to control.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要放弃你的幻想。当幻想消失时，你可能仍然存在，但你已经停止了生活。”
quote_en:
“Don't part with your illusions. When they are gone you may still exist, but you have ceased to live.”
    
  ―

“You here to finish me off, Sweetheart?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你一生中能做的最起码的事情就是弄清楚你的希望是什么。你能做的最多的事情就是活在这个希望中。不要从远处欣赏它，而是活在它的屋檐下。”
quote_en:
“The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof.”
    
  ―

“Maybe you can afford to wait. Maybe for you there's a tomorrow. Maybe for you there's one thousand tomorrows, or three thousand, or ten, so much time you can bathe in it, roll around it, let it slide like coins through you fingers. So much time you can waste it.But for some of us there's only today. And the truth is, you never really know.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “格罗弗在嗅风，看起来很紧张。他掏出橡子，把它们扔进沙子里，然后吹笛子。它们以一种对我来说毫无意义的模式重新排列，但格罗弗看起来很担心。”“那就是我们，”他说。“那五个坚果就在那里。”“哪一个是我？”我问。“那个小畸形的，”佐伊建议。“哦，闭嘴。”
quote_en:
“Grover was sniffing the wind, looking nervous. He fished out his acorns and threw them into the sand, then played his pipes. They rearranged themselves in a pattern that made no sense to me, but Grover looked concerned. "That's us," he said. "Those five nuts right there." "Which one is me?" I asked. "The little deformed one," Zoe suggested. "Oh, shut up.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “时间是一种幻觉。午餐时间更是如此。”
quote_en:
“Time is an illusion. Lunchtime doubly so.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有三种类型的谎言——谎言、该死的谎言和统计数据。”
quote_en:
“There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “总有一天，在某个地方，在任何地方，你都会找到自己，只有这样，才能成为你一生中最快乐或最痛苦的时刻。”
quote_en:
“Someday, somewhere - anywhere, unfailingly, you'll find yourself, and that, and only that, can be the happiest or bitterest hour of your life.”
    
  ―

“He smiled understandingly-much more than understandingly. It was one of those rare smiles with a quality of eternal reassurance in it, that you may come across four or five times in life. It faced--or seemed to face--the whole eternal world for an instant, and then concentrated on you with an irresistible prejudice in your favor. It understood you just as far as you wanted to be understood, believed in you as you would like to believe in yourself, and assured you that it had precisely the impression of you that, at your best, you hoped to convey.”
    
  ―

“Don't feel sorry for yourself. Only assholes do that.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你永远不知道你的坏运气救了你什么。”
quote_en:
“You never know what worse luck your bad luck has saved you from.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我认为我们应该只读那些伤害或刺伤我们的书。如果我们正在读的书没有让我们清醒过来，那我们读什么？这样它就会让我们快乐，就像你写的那样？天哪，如果我们没有书，我们就会快乐，而那些让我们快乐的书是我们可以自己写的，如果我们必须这样做的话。但我们需要那些像灾难一样影响我们的书，让我们深感悲痛的书，比如我们比自己更爱的人的死亡，比如被放逐到远离每个人的森林里，就像自杀。一本书必须是我们内心冰冻大海的斧头。这就是我的信念。”
quote_en:
“I think we ought to read only the kind of books that wound or stab us. If the book we're reading doesn't wake us up with a blow to the head, what are we reading for? So that it will make us happy, as you write? Good Lord, we would be happy precisely if we had no books, and the kind of books that make us happy are the kind we could write ourselves if we had to. But we need books that affect us like a disaster, that grieve us deeply, like the death of someone we loved more than ourselves, like being banished into forests far from everyone, like a suicide. A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us. That is my belief.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “虽然没有人能回去重新开始。。。任何人都可以重新开始，创造一个新的结局。”
quote_en:
“‎Though nobody can go back and make a new beginning... Anyone can start over and make a new ending.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “过去无法控制现在。”
quote_en:
“The past has no power over the present moment.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我渴望你的嘴、你的声音、你的头发。我沉默而饥饿地在街上徘徊。面包不能滋养我，黎明扰乱了我，我整天都在寻找你脚步的液体。我渴望你圆滑的笑声，你的手是野蛮收成的颜色，我渴望你指甲上苍白的石头，我想把你的皮肤吃得像整个杏仁一样。我想吃你可爱的身体里散发的阳光，你傲慢的脸上的主权鼻子，我想吃掉你睫毛的短暂阴影，我饿着肚子走来走去，嗅着暮色，寻找你，寻找你炽热的心，就像基特拉图荒原上的美洲狮。”
quote_en:
“I crave your mouth, your voice, your hair.Silent and starving, I prowl through the streets. Bread does not nourish me, dawn disrupts me, all day I hunt for the liquid measure of your steps. I hunger for your sleek laugh, your hands the color of a savage harvest, hunger for the pale stones of your fingernails, I want to eat your skin like a whole almond. I want to eat the sunbeam flaring in your lovely body, the sovereign nose of your arrogant face, I want to eat the fleeting shade of your lashes, and I pace around hungry, sniffing the twilight, hunting for you, for your hot heart, Like a puma in the barrens of Quitratue.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你会失去一个你离不开的人，你的心会碎得很厉害，坏消息是你永远无法完全克服失去爱人的痛苦。但这也是个好消息。他们永远活在你破碎的心里，不会再密封起来。你会挺过来的。这就像一条永远无法完全愈合的断腿——天气变冷时仍然会疼，但你学会了与跛行者共舞。”
quote_en:
“You will lose someone you can’t live without,and your heart will be badly broken, and the bad news is that you never completely get over the loss of your beloved. But this is also the good news. They live forever in your broken heart that doesn’t seal back up. And you come through. It’s like having a broken leg that never heals perfectly—that still hurts when the weather gets cold, but you learn to dance with the limp.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “无论我们图书馆的成本是多少，与一个无知的国家相比，这个价格都很便宜。”
quote_en:
“Whatever the cost of our libraries, the price is cheap compared to that of an ignorant nation.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你不觉得即使你失去了快乐，也能在短时间内保持极度快乐，而不是一辈子都过得很好吗？”
quote_en:
“Don't you think it's better to be extremely happy for a short while, even if you lose it, than to be just okay for your whole life?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “又摔倒了，贝拉？”“不，埃米特，我打了一个狼人的脸。”
quote_en:
“Fall down again, Bella?'No, Emmett, I punched a werewolf in the face.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要害怕失败，而要害怕不尝试。”
quote_en:
“Do not fear failure but rather fear not trying.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “哦，好吧……我只是在想，如果你死了，欢迎你和我共用厕所。”
quote_en:
“Oh well... I'd just been thinking, if you had died, you'd have been welcome to share my toilet.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你会做愚蠢的事情，但要热情地去做。”
quote_en:
“You will do foolish things, but do them with enthusiasm.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候，你读一本书，它会让你充满这种奇怪的福音派热情，你会相信，除非所有活着的人都读过这本书，否则这个破碎的世界永远不会恢复原状。还有一些书，比如《帝国的苦难》，你不能告诉别人，这些书如此特别和罕见，而你的书，宣传你的感情就像背叛。”
quote_en:
“Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book. And then there are books like An Imperial Affliction, which you can't tell people about, books so special and rare and yours that advertising your affection feels like betrayal”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “敲门，他就会开门，消失，他会让你像太阳一样发光，他会把你提升到天堂，成为虚无，他会将你变成一切。”
quote_en:
“Knock, And He'll open the doorVanish, And He'll make you shine like the sunFall, And He'll raise you to the heavensBecome nothing, And He'll turn you into everything.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你知道，当它奏效时，爱情是非常神奇的。它没有被高估。所有这些歌曲都是有原因的。”
quote_en:
“You know, when it works, love is pretty amazing. It's not overrated. There's a reason for all those songs.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “照顾好我的心——我把它留给你了。”
quote_en:
“Look after my heart - I've left it with you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “言语是被遗忘的名字的苍白阴影。名字有力量，言语也有力量。言语可以在人们的心中点燃火焰。言语可以从最坚硬的心中挤出眼泪。”
quote_en:
“Words are pale shadows of forgotten names. As names have power, words have power. Words can light fires in the minds of men. Words can wring tears from the hardest hearts.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你好，宝贝们。欢迎来到地球。夏天很热，冬天很冷。它又圆又湿又拥挤。从外面看，宝贝们，你们在这里已经有一百年了。据我所知，只有一条规则，宝贝们——“该死的，你们必须善良。”
quote_en:
“Hello babies. Welcome to Earth. It's hot in the summer and cold in the winter. It's round and wet and crowded. On the outside, babies, you've got a hundred years here. There's only one rule that I know of, babies-"God damn it, you've got to be kind.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “再说一遍‘挑衅’。当你这样做的时候，你的嘴看起来很挑衅。”
quote_en:
“Say 'provoking' again. Your mouth looks provocative when you do.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “别止步于此。我想还有吸血鬼、狼人和僵尸吗？”“当然有。虽然你在更南边的地方，也就是你的祭司所在的地方，大多能找到僵尸。”“木乃伊呢？它们只在埃及附近出没吗？”
quote_en:
“Don't stop there. I suppose there are also, what, vampires and werewolves and zombies?""Of course there are. Although you mostly find zombies farther south, where the voudun priests are.""What about mummies? Do they only hang around Egypt?""Don't be ridiculous. No one believes in mummies.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你看到事物；你说，‘为什么？’但我梦到了从未有过的东西；我说，‘怎么不呢？’”
quote_en:
“You see things; you say, 'Why?' But I dream things that never were; and I say 'Why not?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “分开并不能改变我们长期并肩成长的事实；我们的根永远是纠结的。我为此感到高兴。”
quote_en:
“Growing apart doesn't change the fact that for a long time we grew side by side; our roots will always be tangled. I'm glad for that.”
    
  ―

“It’s probably not just by chance that I’m alone. It would be very hard for a man to live with me, unless he’s terribly strong. And if he’s stronger than I, I’m the one who can’t live with him. … I’m neither smart nor stupid, but I don’t think I’m a run-of-the-mill person. I’ve been in business without being a businesswoman, I’ve loved without being a woman made only for love. The two men I’ve loved, I think, will remember me, on earth or in heaven, because men always remember a woman who caused them concern and uneasiness. I’ve done my best, in regard to people and to life, without precepts, but with a taste for justice.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们只是普通恒星小行星上的一种高级猴子。但我们可以理解宇宙。这让我们变得非常特别。”
quote_en:
“We are just an advanced breed of monkeys on a minor planet of a very average star. But we can understand the Universe. That makes us something very special.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你做的事情太大声了，我听不清你在说什么。”
quote_en:
“What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “理智的人使自己适应世界：不理智的人坚持试图使世界适应自己。因此，所有的进步都取决于不合理的人。”
quote_en:
“The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我发现我是谁时，我就自由了。”
quote_en:
“When I discover who I am, I’ll be free.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我醒来时想到了一个非常愉快的想法。世界上还有很多书要读。”
quote_en:
“I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read.”
    
  ―

“Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你遇到的每个人都知道一些你不知道的事情。”
quote_en:
“Everyone you will ever meet knows something you don't.”
    
  ―

“People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “说再见就是死一点点。”
quote_en:
“To say goodbye is to die a little.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “成功就是得到你想要的东西，幸福就是想要你得到的东西”
quote_en:
“Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “活在当下，记住过去，不要害怕未来，因为它不存在，也永远不会存在。只有现在。”
quote_en:
“Live in the present, remember the past, and fear not the future, for it doesn't exist and never shall. There is only now.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你想成为一名作家，你必须做两件事：大量阅读和大量写作。”
quote_en:
“If you want to be a writer, you must do two things above all others: read a lot and write a lot.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我只想做别人期望我做的事，而不是我自己想做的事情，这让我损失了什么，损失了多少？”
quote_en:
“What and how much had I lost by trying to do only what was expected of me instead of what I myself had wished to do?”
    
  ―

“Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “阅读中最好的时刻是当你遇到一些东西时——一种想法、一种感觉、一种看待事物的方式——你曾认为这些东西对你来说很特别。现在，它就在这里，被别人放下，一个你从未见过的人，甚至是一个早已死去的人。就好像有一只手伸出来握住了你的手。”
quote_en:
“The best moments in reading are when you come across something – a thought, a feeling, a way of looking at things – which you had thought special and particular to you. Now here it is, set down by someone else, a person you have never met, someone even who is long dead. And it is as if a hand has come out and taken yours.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我写作时，我可以摆脱一切；我的悲伤消失了，我的勇气重生了。”
quote_en:
“I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我爱你，就像胖孩子爱蛋糕一样！”
quote_en:
“I love you like a fat kid loves cake!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “它再也不会来了，这就是生活如此甜蜜的原因。”
quote_en:
“That it will never come again is what makes life so sweet.”
    
  ―

“Maybe...you'll fall in love with me all over again.""Hell," I said, "I love you enough now. What do you want to do? Ruin me?""Yes. I want to ruin you.""Good," I said. "That's what I want too.”
    
  ―

“Is 'fat' really the worst thing a human being can be? Is 'fat' worse than 'vindictive', 'jealous', 'shallow', 'vain', 'boring' or 'cruel'? Not to me.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当她的嘴唇碰到我的嘴唇时，我知道我可以活到一百岁，访问世界上的每个国家，但没有什么能比得上我第一次亲吻我梦想中的女孩，知道我的爱会永远持续下去的那一刻。”
quote_en:
“And when her lips met mine, I knew that I could live to be a hundred and visit every country in the world, but nothing would ever compare to that single moment when I first kissed the girl of my dreams and knew that my love would last forever.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你想告诉别人真相，就让他们笑，否则他们会杀了你。”
quote_en:
“If you want to tell people the truth, make them laugh, otherwise they'll kill you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我所需要的不是完整的感觉，而是不空虚的感觉。”
quote_en:
“It was not the feeling of completeness I so needed, but the feeling of not being empty.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 我点点头，带着敬意看着瑞秋。“你用蓝色塑料梳子打了泰坦之王的眼睛。”
quote_en:
“I nodded, looking at Rachel with respect. "You hit the Lord of the Titans in the eye with a blue plastic hairbrush.”
    
  ―

“Let us learn to show our friendship for a man when he is alive and not after he is dead.”
    
  ―

“Welcome to the wonderful world of jealousy, he thought. For the price of admission, you get a splitting headache, a nearly irresistable urge to commit murder, and an inferiority complex. Yippee.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “幸福只有在分享时才是真实的”
quote_en:
“Happiness [is] only real when shared”
    
  ―

“We must be willing to let go of the life we planned so as to have the life that is waiting for us.”
    
  ―

“If you treat an individual as he is, he will remain how he is. But if you treat him as if he were what he ought to be and could be, he will become what he ought to be and could be.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你有没有注意到，任何比你开得慢的人都是白痴，而任何比你跑得快的人是疯子？”
quote_en:
“Have you ever noticed that anybody driving slower than you is an idiot, and anyone going faster than you is a maniac?”
    
  ―

“You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange.”
    
  ―

“I cannot teach anybody anything. I can only make them think”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “教育是一种倾听几乎任何事情而不发脾气或失去自信的能力。”
quote_en:
“Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你必须决定继续前进。这不会自动发生。你必须站起来说，‘我不在乎这有多难，我不在乎我有多失望，我不会让这件事影响到我。我要继续我的生活。”
quote_en:
“You must make a decision that you are going to move on. It wont happen automatically. You will have to rise up and say, ‘I don’t care how hard this is, I don’t care how disappointed I am, I’m not going to let this get the best of me. I’m moving on with my life.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当它足够黑的时候，你可以看到星星。”
quote_en:
“When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “虽然她很小，但她很凶猛！”
quote_en:
“Though she be but little, she is fierce!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你终于找到一个你觉得可以倾诉灵魂的人时，你会对你说的话感到震惊——它们如此生疏，如此丑陋，如此无意义和无力，因为它们被困在你内心狭小狭窄的黑暗中这么久。”
quote_en:
“And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter— they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你怎么拼写‘爱’？”-小猪“你不拼写它……你能感觉到它。”-维尼
quote_en:
“How do you spell 'love'?" - Piglet"You don't spell it...you feel it." - Pooh”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “阅读只为心灵提供知识材料；正是思考使我们所读的成为我们的。”
quote_en:
“Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “爱是一种无法驯服的力量。当我们试图控制它时，它会摧毁我们。当我们想禁锢它时，爱会奴役我们。当你试图理解它时，会让我们感到迷失和困惑。”
quote_en:
“Love is an untamed force. When we try to control it, it destroys us. When we try to imprison it, it enslaves us. When we try to understand it, it leaves us feeling lost and confused.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你认为你的痛苦和心碎是世界历史上前所未有的，但后来你读了。”
quote_en:
“You think your pain and your heartbreak are unprecedented in the history of the world, but then you read.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你可以，你应该，如果你有足够的勇气开始，你会的。”
quote_en:
“you can, you should, and if you’re brave enough to start, you will.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “生存，还是毁灭：这是一个问题：在心灵中，忍受暴富的弹弓和箭，还是拿起武器对抗无尽的麻烦，并通过反对来结束它们，这是否更高尚？死亡：睡觉；不再；通过睡觉来说我们结束了心痛和千种自然冲击，肉体是继承人，这是一种完美的渴望。死亡，睡觉；睡觉：也许做梦：是的，这就是问题所在；因为在死亡的睡眠中，会有什么梦想？当我们摆脱了这个致命的线圈时，必须让我们停下来：有尊重，这会带来灾难。如此长寿；因为谁会忍受时间的鞭挞和蔑视，压迫者的错误，骄傲的人的轻蔑，被鄙视的爱的痛苦，法律的拖延，办公室的傲慢和唾弃，当他自己光着身子可以安静下来时，不配的人却可以拿下耐心的功绩？谁会忍受在疲惫的生活中呻吟和流汗，但对死后某些事情的恐惧，对没有旅行者从其出生的未被覆盖的国家的恐惧，会动摇我们的意志，让我们宁愿忍受我们所拥有的疾病，也不愿飞到我们不知道的人那里？因此，良知确实让我们所有人都变成了懦夫；因此，决心的本土色彩与苍白的思想交织在一起，而伟大的企业在这方面却出现了偏差，失去了行动的名字--软化你！美丽的欧菲莉亚！Nymph，在你的祈祷中，记住我所有的罪过！”
quote_en:
“To be, or not to be: that is the question:Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to sufferThe slings and arrows of outrageous fortune,Or to take arms against a sea of troubles,And by opposing end them? To die: to sleep;No more; and by a sleep to say we endThe heart-ache and the thousand natural shocksThat flesh is heir to, 'tis a consummationDevoutly to be wish'd. To die, to sleep;To sleep: perchance to dream: ay, there's the rub;For in that sleep of death what dreams may comeWhen we have shuffled off this mortal coil,Must give us pause: there's the respectThat makes calamity of so long life;For who would bear the whips and scorns of time,The oppressor's wrong, the proud man's contumely,The pangs of despised love, the law's delay,The insolence of office and the spurnsThat patient merit of the unworthy takes,When he himself might his quietus makeWith a bare bodkin? who would fardels bear,To grunt and sweat under a weary life,But that the dread of something after death,The undiscover'd country from whose bournNo traveller returns, puzzles the willAnd makes us rather bear those ills we haveThan fly to others that we know not of?Thus conscience does make cowards of us all;And thus the native hue of resolutionIs sicklied o'er with the pale cast of thought,And enterprises of great pith and momentWith this regard their currents turn awry,And lose the name of action.--Soft you now!The fair Ophelia! Nymph, in thy orisonsBe all my sins remember'd!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果我们等待一切，绝对一切准备就绪的那一刻，我们就永远不会开始。”
quote_en:
“If we wait for the moment when everything, absolutely everything is ready, we shall never begin.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “所以是你和注射器对着国会大厦？看，这就是为什么没有人让你制定计划。”
quote_en:
“So it's you and a syringe against the Capitol? See, this is why no one lets you make the plans.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “人生是一艘沉船，但我们不能忘记在救生艇上唱歌。”
quote_en:
“‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果它像特洛伊战争中那样排列……雅典娜与波塞冬？”“我不知道。但我只知道我会在你旁边战斗。”“为什么？”“因为你是我的朋友，海藻大脑。还有愚蠢的问题吗？”
quote_en:
“What if it lines up like it did in the Trojan War ... Athena versus Poseidon?""I don't know. But I just know that I'll be fighting next to you.""Why?""Because you're my friend, Seaweed Brain. Any more stupid questions?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “是啊，奇洛是个很棒的老师。他有一个小缺点，就是伏地魔从他的后脑勺伸出来！”
quote_en:
“Yeah, Quirrell was a great teacher. There was just that minor drawback of him having Lord Voldemort sticking out of the back of his head!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “写小说有三条规则。不幸的是，没有人知道它们是什么。”
quote_en:
“There are three rules for writing a novel. Unfortunately, no one knows what they are.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “为你的痛苦感到自豪；你比那些没有痛苦的人更强大。”
quote_en:
“Take pride in your pain; you are stronger than those who have none”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “永远不要对冒险说‘不’。永远要说‘是’，否则你的生活会很无聊。”
quote_en:
“Never say 'no' to adventures. Always say 'yes,' otherwise you'll lead a very dull life.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “每一件存在的精致事物背后，都有一些悲剧。”
quote_en:
“Behind every exquisite thing that existed, there was something tragic.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你眼中表达的是什么？在我看来，这比我一生中读过的所有印刷品都要多。”
quote_en:
“What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有精致的美……就没有比例上的奇特。”
quote_en:
“There is no exquisite beauty… without some strangeness in the proportion.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 懦夫死前会死很多次；勇士只尝过一次死亡的滋味。在我所听过的所有奇迹中，最奇怪的是人们会害怕；看到死亡，一个必然的结局，会在它到来的时候到来
quote_en:
“Cowards die many times before their deaths; The valiant never taste of death but once. Of all the wonders that I yet have heard, It seems to me most strange that men should fear; Seeing that death, a necessary end, Will come when it will come.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “生活是一系列自然和自发的变化。不要抗拒它们；那只会带来悲伤。让现实成为现实。让事情以他们喜欢的方式自然地向前发展。”
quote_en:
“Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them; that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们听到的一切都是意见，而不是事实。我们看到的一切都只是观点，而不是真相。”
quote_en:
“Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “金钱买不到幸福，但在你痛苦的时候，它可以让你非常舒服。”
quote_en:
“Money can't buy happiness, but it can make you awfully comfortable while you're being miserable.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “每一段伟大的爱情都始于一个伟大的故事……”
quote_en:
“Every great love starts with a great story...”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你坚强时，表现得软弱；当你软弱时，表现出坚强。”
quote_en:
“Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “任何以‘更高的东西’为目标的人都必须预料到有一天会患上眩晕。什么是眩晕？害怕跌倒？不，眩晕不是害怕跌倒。是我们下面空虚的声音引诱我们，是跌倒的欲望，我们害怕地自卫。”
quote_en:
“Anyone whose goal is 'something higher' must expect someday to suffer vertigo. What is vertigo? Fear of falling? No, Vertigo is something other than fear of falling. It is the voice of the emptiness below us which tempts and lures us, it is the desire to fall, against which, terrified, we defend ourselves.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “所以你总是很诚实，”我说。“不是吗？”“不，”我告诉他。“我不是。”“好吧，我想知道这一点很好。”“我不是说我是个骗子，”我对他说。他扬起眉毛。“不管怎样，我不是这个意思。”“那你是什么意思？”“我只是……我并不总是说出我的感受。”“为什么不呢？”“因为真相有时会伤人，”我说道。“是的，”他说。“不过，谎言也是如此。”
quote_en:
“So you're always honest," I said."Aren't you?""No," I told him. "I'm not.""Well, that's good to know, I guess.""I'm not saying I'm a liar," I told him. He raised his eyebrows. "That's not how I meant it, anyways.""How'd you mean it, then?""I just...I don't always say what I feel.""Why not?""Because the truth sometimes hurts," I said."Yeah," he said. "So do lies, though.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “所有女人都变得像她们的母亲一样。这是她们的悲剧。没有男人会这样，这是他的。”
quote_en:
“All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “他死后，所有柔软、美丽、明亮的东西都会和他一起埋葬。”
quote_en:
“When he died, all things soft and beautiful and bright would be buried with him.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我无法告诉你，我第一次见到你的时候是爱你，还是第二次、第三次或第四次爱你。但我记得第一次看着你朝我走来的那一刻，我意识到，当我和你在一起时，世界其他地方似乎都消失了。”
quote_en:
“I could not tell you if I loved you the first moment I saw you, or if it was the second or third or fourth. But I remember the first moment I looked at you walking toward me and realized that somehow the rest of the world seemed to vanish when I was with you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “温顺的人可能会继承地球，但目前它属于自负的人。就像我一样。”
quote_en:
“The meek may inherit the earth, but at the moment it belongs to the conceited. Like me.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “它们并不可怕，”泰莎说。威尔对她眨了眨眼。“什么？”“吉迪恩和加布里埃尔，”泰莎说。“他们真的很好看，一点也不难看。”“我说了，”威尔用阴森的口吻说，“他们灵魂深处漆黑一片。”泰莎哼了一声。“你认为你的灵魂深处是什么颜色的，Will Herondale？”“Mauve，”Will说
quote_en:
“They’re not hideous,” said Tessa. Will blinked at her. “What?” “Gideon and Gabriel,” said Tessa. “They’re really quite good-looking, not hideous at all.” “I spoke,” said Will, in sepulchral tones, “of the pitch-black inner depths of their souls.” Tessa snorted. “And what color do you suppose the inner depths of your soul are, Will Herondale?” “Mauve,” said Will.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我遇到的每个男人都想保护我。我不知道是什么。”
quote_en:
“Every man I meet wants to protect me. I can't figure out what from.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “只要持续，哭是可以的。但你迟早要停下来，然后你还得决定该怎么办。”
quote_en:
“Crying is all right in its way while it lasts. But you have to stop sooner or later, and then you still have to decide what to do.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “他意识到，生活就像一首歌。一开始是神秘的，最后是确定的，但在中间是所有的情感所在，让整件事变得有价值。”
quote_en:
“Life, he realize, was much like a song. In the beginning there is mystery, in the end there is confirmation, but it's in the middle where all the emotion resides to make the whole thing worthwhile.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “男人害怕女人会嘲笑他们。女人害怕男人会杀了他们。”
quote_en:
“Men are afraid that women will laugh at them. Women are afraid that men will kill them.”
    
  ―

“The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “很多事情都是可能的，只要你不知道它们是不可能的。”
quote_en:
“So many things are possible just as long as you don't know they're impossible.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “船在港口是安全的，但这不是船的用途。”
quote_en:
“A ship is safe in harbor, but that's not what ships are for.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “Clary，不管怎样，我无法忍受这枚戒指永远丢失的想法，再也无法忍受永远离开你的想法。虽然我别无选择，但至少我可以选择另一个。我把我们的家庭戒指留给你，因为你和我一样有权拥有它。我写这篇文章是看着太阳升起的。你睡着了，梦想在你不安分的眼皮后面移动。我希望我知道你在想什么。我希望能钻进你的脑海，像你一样看待世界。我希望看到你的样子。但也许我不想看到。”。也许这会让我比现在更觉得我在对你撒某种弥天大谎，我无法忍受。我属于你。你可以对我做任何你想做的事，我会让你做的。你可以问我任何问题，我都会努力让你快乐。我的心告诉我，这是我有史以来最好、最伟大的感觉。但我的头脑知道想要你不能拥有的东西和想要你不应该想要的东西之间的区别。我不应该想要你。我整夜看着你睡觉，看着月光来来往往，把它的影子黑白地投射在你的脸上。我从未见过如此美丽的事物。我想到了如果事情不同，我们本可以拥有的生活，一种今晚不是一个单一事件的生活，与其他所有真实的事情分开，而是每天晚上。但事情并没有什么不同，看着你，我总觉得我骗你爱上了我。事实上，没有人愿意大声说出来，除了我，没有人能对抗瓦伦丁。我可以像其他人一样接近他。我可以假装我想加入他，他会相信我，直到我以某种方式结束这一切的最后一刻。我有一些塞巴斯蒂安的东西；我可以追踪他到我父亲藏身的地方，这就是我要做的。所以我昨晚骗了你。我说我只想和你共度一晚。但我希望每晚都和你在一起。这就是为什么我现在必须像个懦夫一样溜出你的窗户。因为如果我不得不当着你的面告诉你这些，我无法强迫自己离开。如果你恨我，我不怪你，我希望你恨我。只要我还能做梦，我就会梦到你_杰斯”
quote_en:
“Clary, Despite everything, I can't bear the thought of this ring being lost forever, any more then I can bear the thought of leaving you forever. And though I have no choice about the one, at least I can choose about the other. I'm leaving you our family ring because you have as much right to it as I do.I'm writing this watching the sun come up. You're asleep, dreams moving behind your restless eyelids. I wish I knew what you were thinking. I wish I could slip into your head and see the world the way you do. I wish I could see  the way you do. But maybe I dont want to see that. Maybe it would make me feel even more than I already do that I'm perpetuating some kind of Great Lie on you, and I couldn't stand that. I belong to you. You could do anything you wanted with me and I would let you. You could ask anything of me and I'd break myself trying to make you happy. My heart tells me this is the best and greatest feeling I have ever had. But my mind knows the difference between wanting what you can't have and wanting what you shouldn't want. And I shouldn't want you.All night I've watched you sleeping, watched the moonlight come and go, casting its shadows across your face in black and white. I've never seen anything more beautiful. I think of the life we could have had if things were different, a life where this night is not a singular event, separate from everything else that's real, but every night. But things aren't different, and I can't look at you without feeling like I've tricked you into loving me.The truth no one is willing to say out loud is that no one has a shot against Valentine but me. I can get close to him like no one else can. I can pretend I want to join him and he'll believe me, up until that last moment where I end it all, one way or another. I have something of Sebastian's; I can track him to where my father's hiding, and that's what I'm going to do. So I lied to you last night. I said I just wanted one night with you. But I want every night with you. And that's why I have to slip out of your window now, like a coward. Because if I had to tell you this to your face, I couldn't make myself go. I don't blame you if you hate me, I wish you would. As long as I can still dream, I will dream of you. _Jace”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “度过人生的唯一方法就是笑着度过。你要么笑，要么哭。我更喜欢笑。哭让我头疼。”
quote_en:
“The only way to get through life is to laugh your way through it. You either have to laugh or cry. I prefer to laugh. Crying gives me a headache.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “爱是一种暂时的疯狂，它像火山一样爆发，然后消退。当它消退时，你必须做出决定。你必须弄清楚你的根是否已经缠绕在一起，以至于你不可能分开。因为这就是爱。爱不是气喘吁吁，不是兴奋，不是永恒激情的承诺的传播，不是一天中每一分钟都渴望交配，也不是晚上睡不着觉想象他亲吻你身体的每一个缝隙。不，不要脸红，我告诉你一些真相。那只是“恋爱”，任何傻瓜都能做到。爱本身就是恋爱中剩下的东西已经烧光了，这既是一种艺术，也是一次幸运的意外。”
quote_en:
“Love is a temporary madness, it erupts like volcanoes and then subsides. And when it subsides, you have to make a decision. You have to work out whether your roots have so entwined together that it is inconceivable that you should ever part. Because this is what love is. Love is not breathlessness, it is not excitement, it is not the promulgation of promises of eternal passion, it is not the desire to mate every second minute of the day, it is not lying awake at night imagining that he is kissing every cranny of your body. No, don't blush, I am telling you some truths. That is just being "in love", which any fool can do. Love itself is what is left over when being in love has burned away, and this is both an art and a fortunate accident.”
    
  ―

“And I thought about how many people have loved those songs. And how many people got through a lot of bad times because of those songs. And how many people enjoyed good times with those songs. And how much those songs really mean. I think it would be great to have written one of those songs. I bet if I wrote one of them, I would be very proud. I hope the people who wrote those songs are happy. I hope they feel it's enough. I really do because they've made me happy. And I'm only one person.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我是由记忆组成的。”
quote_en:
“I am made of memories.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果我摆脱了我的恶魔，我就会失去我的天使。”
quote_en:
“If I got rid of my demons, I’d lose my angels.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “书籍应该放在最受欣赏的地方，而不是坐在未读的地方，在被遗忘的书架上积满灰尘，你不同意吗？”
quote_en:
“Books should go where they will be most appreciated, and not sit unread, gathering dust on a forgotten shelf, don't you agree?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你问我在这个世界上做什么，我，一个艺术家，会回答你：我在这里是为了大声生活。”
quote_en:
“If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有女人真的想让男人把她带走；她只想让他想这么做。”
quote_en:
“No woman really wants a man to carry her off; she only wants him to want to do it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “总是找机会让别人微笑，并在日常生活中提供随机的善举。”
quote_en:
“Always find opportunities to make someone smile, and to offer random acts of kindness in everyday life.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “也许我们的大脑所拥有的最伟大的能力是应对疼痛的能力。经典思维告诉我们大脑的四扇门，每个人都会根据自己的需要穿过。第一扇门是睡眠之门。睡眠为我们提供了远离世界及其所有痛苦的退路。睡眠标志着时间的流逝，让我们与伤害我们的事情保持距离。当一个人受伤时，他们往往会失去意识。同样，听到创伤消息的人也会经常晕倒或昏厥。这是大脑通过第一扇门来保护自己免受疼痛的方式。第二扇门是遗忘之门。有些伤口太深而无法愈合，或者太深而不能迅速愈合。此外，许多记忆只是痛苦的，而且没有治愈的方法。俗话说“时间能治愈一切伤口”是错误的。时间能治愈大多数伤口。其余的都藏在这扇门后面。第三是疯狂之门。有时候，当心灵受到如此沉重的打击时，它会隐藏在疯狂中。虽然这似乎没有好处，但它是有益的。有时候，现实只不过是痛苦，为了逃避这种痛苦，头脑必须把现实抛在脑后。最后是死亡之门。最后的手段。我们死后，没有什么能伤害我们，至少我们被告知如此。”
quote_en:
“Perhaps the greatest faculty our minds possess is the ability to cope with pain. Classic thinking teaches us of the four doors of the mind, which everyone moves through according to their need.First is the door of sleep. Sleep offers us a retreat from the world and all its pain. Sleep marks passing time, giving us distance from the things that have hurt us. When a person is wounded they will often fall unconscious. Similarly, someone who hears traumatic news will often swoon or faint. This is the mind's way of protecting itself from pain by stepping through the first door.Second is the door of forgetting. Some wounds are too deep to heal, or too deep to heal quickly. In addition, many memories are simply painful, and there is no healing to be done. The saying 'time heals all wounds' is false. Time heals most wounds. The rest are hidden behind this door.Third is the door of madness. There are times when the mind is dealt such a blow it hides itself in insanity. While this may not seem beneficial, it is. There are times when reality is nothing but pain, and to escape that pain the mind must leave reality behind. Last is the door of death. The final resort. Nothing can hurt us after we are dead, or so we have been told.”
    
  ―

“If you are a dreamer come inIf you are a dreamer a wisher a liarA hoper a pray-er a magic-bean-buyerIf youre a pretender com sit by my fireFor we have some flax golden tales to spinCome in! Come in!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “要清楚地意识到天上的星星和无限。那么生活似乎终究是被迷住了。”
quote_en:
“Be clearly aware of the stars and infinity on high. Then life seems almost enchanted after all.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “她读书就像呼吸空气、填饱肚子和生活一样。”
quote_en:
“She read books as one would breathe air, to fill up and live.”
    
  ―

“Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我自相矛盾吗？很好，我自相矛盾（我很大，我有很多人。）”
quote_en:
“Do I contradict myself?Very well then I contradict myself,(I am large, I contain multitudes.)”
    
  ―

“I fell in love with you, smartass, because you were one of us—because you weren’t afraid of me, and you decided to end your spectacular victory by throwing that piece of bone at Amarantha like a javelin. I felt Cassian’s spirit beside me in that moment, and could have sworn I heard him say, ‘If you don’t marry her, you stupid prick, I will.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你不能跳过糟糕的部分，重新体验你的生活，而不失去它的价值。你必须接受它作为一个整体——就像这个世界，或者你爱的人。”
quote_en:
“You couldn't relive your life, skipping the awful parts, without losing what made it worthwhile. You had to accept it as a whole--like the world, or the person you loved.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “河流知道这一点：不用着急。总有一天我们会到达那里的。”
quote_en:
“Rivers know this: there is no hurry. We shall get there some day.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有趣的是，人类如何将思维包裹在事物周围，并将其融入他们对现实的看法中。”
quote_en:
“It's funny how humans can wrap their mind around things and fit them into their version of reality.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我还不够年轻，什么都不知道。”
quote_en:
“I'm not young enough to know everything.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你现在不会明白我的意思，但总有一天你会明白的：我认为，友谊的唯一诀窍是找到比你更好的人——不是更聪明，不是更酷，而是更善良，更慷慨，更宽容——然后欣赏他们能教给你的东西，当他们告诉你一些关于你自己的事情时，无论多么糟糕或多么好，都要试着倾听他们的意见，并信任他们，这是最难的事情。但也是最好的。”
quote_en:
