“You won’t understand what I mean now, but someday you will: the only trick of friendship, I think, is to find people who are better than you are—not smarter, not cooler, but kinder, and more generous, and more forgiving—and then to appreciate them for what they can teach you, and to try to listen to them when they tell you something about yourself, no matter how bad—or good—it might be, and to trust them, which is the hardest thing of all. But the best, as well.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在政治上，如果你想说什么，问男人。如果你想做什么，问女人。”
quote_en:
“In politics, If you want anything said, ask a man. If you want anything done, ask a woman.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我现在意识到死亡很容易。生活很难。”
quote_en:
“I realize now that dying is easy. Living is hard.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你想飞，就得放弃那些让你感到沉重的东西。”
quote_en:
“You wanna fly, you got to give up the shit that weighs you down.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “每个人都是月亮，都有他从不向任何人展示的黑暗面。”
quote_en:
“Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “羊毛的真实故事：有宙斯的两个孩子，卡德摩斯和欧罗巴，好吗？他们正要被作为人类祭品献上，这时他们向宙斯祈祷救他们。所以宙斯派了这只金羊毛的神奇飞行公羊，它在希腊把它们捡起来，一路带到小亚细亚的科尔奇斯。好吧，事实上，它带着卡德摩斯。欧罗巴在路上掉了下来，死了，但这并不重要。”“这对她来说可能很重要。”
quote_en:
“The real story of the Fleece: there were these two children of Zeus, Cadmus and Europa, okay? They were about to get offered up as human sacrifices, when they prayed to Zeus to save them. So Zeus sent this magical flying ram with golden wool, which picked them up in Greece and carried them all the way to Colchis in Asia Minor. Well, actually it carried Cadmus. Europa fell off and died along the way, but that's not important.""It was probably important to her.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 梅林开始喘着粗气说：“悲伤的最好办法就是学习一些东西。这是唯一一件永远不会失败的事情。你可能会变老，身体会颤抖，你可能会在夜里躺着听血管紊乱的声音，你可能错过你唯一的爱，你可能看到你周围的世界被邪恶的疯子摧毁，或者知道你的荣誉被践踏在卑鄙的头脑的下水道里。只有一件事——学习。学习为什么世界会摇摆，什么会摇摆。这是头脑永远不会耗尽、永远不会疏远、永远不会被折磨、永远不会害怕或不信任、永远不会后悔的唯一事情。学习是唯一适合你的东西。看看有多少东西要学。”
quote_en:
“The best thing for being sad," replied Merlin, beginning to puff and blow, "is to learn something. That's the only thing that never fails. You may grow old and trembling in your anatomies, you may lie awake at night listening to the disorder of your veins, you may miss your only love, you may see the world about you devastated by evil lunatics, or know your honour trampled in the sewers of baser minds. There is only one thing for it then — to learn. Learn why the world wags and what wags it. That is the only thing which the mind can never exhaust, never alienate, never be tortured by, never fear or distrust, and never dream of regretting. Learning is the only thing for you. Look what a lot of things there are to learn.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “然后他给了我一个微笑，这个微笑似乎真的很甜美，带着一丝羞涩，让我感到意想不到的温暖。”
quote_en:
“And then he gives me a smile that just seems so genuinely sweet with just the right touch of shyness that unexpected warmth rushes through me.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我遇见你时，我就知道一场冒险即将发生。”
quote_en:
“I knew when I met you an adventure was going to happen.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我和你在一起的时候，我们彻夜未眠。当你不在的时候，我睡不着。为这两个失眠症患者赞美上帝！以及他们之间的区别。”
quote_en:
“When I am with you, we stay up all night.When you're not here, I can't go to sleep.Praise God for those two insomnias!And the difference between them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你可以剪下所有的花，但你无法阻止春天的到来。”
quote_en:
“You can cut all the flowers but you cannot keep Spring from coming.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “每个人都在谈论想要改变、帮助和修复，但最终你所能做的就是修复自己。这很多。因为如果你能修复自己，就会产生连锁反应。”
quote_en:
“Everybody talks about wanting to change things and help and fix, but ultimately all you can do is fix yourself. And that's a lot. Because if you can fix yourself, it has a ripple effect.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我太喜欢读书了，根本不想写。”
quote_en:
“I am too fond of reading books to care to write them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你一生都会面临一个选择。你可以选择爱或恨……我选择爱。”
quote_en:
“All your life, you will be faced with a choice. You can choose love or hate…I choose love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “提高你的话语，而不是声音。是雨长出花朵，而不是雷声。”
quote_en:
“Raise your words, not voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要害怕完美——你永远不会达到它。”
quote_en:
“Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当人们不表达自己时，他们会一次一块地死去。”
quote_en:
“When people don't express themselves, they die one piece at a time.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “只是大多数真正好看的人都很愚蠢，所以我超出了预期。”“对，这主要是他的性感，”我说。“这可能有点让人眼花缭乱，”他说。“它实际上让我们的朋友艾萨克失明了，”我说道。“这是一场可怕的悲剧。但我能帮助我自己致命的美丽吗？”“你不能。”这是我的负担，这张美丽的脸。“更不用说你的身体了。”“说真的，甚至不要让我开始穿我火辣的身体。戴夫，你不想看到我裸体。看到我裸体真的让黑兹尔·格雷斯喘不过气来，”他朝氧气罐点头说。”
quote_en:
“It's just that most really good-looking people are stupid, so I exceed expectations.''Right, it's primarily his hotness,' I said.'It can be sort of blinding,' he said.'It actually did blind our friend Isaac,' I said.'Terrible tragedy, that. But can I help my own deadly beauty?''You cannot.''It is my burden, this beautiful face.''Not to mention your body.''Seriously, don't even get me started on my hot bod. You don't want to see me naked, Dave. Seeing me naked actually took Hazel Grace's breath away,' he said, nodding toward the oxygen tank.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “时间对等待的人来说太慢，对恐惧的人来说太短，对悲伤的人来说太长，对快乐的人来说太紧；但对爱的人来说，时间不是。”
quote_en:
“Time is Too Slow for those who Wait, Too Swift for those who Fear, Too Long for those who Grieve, Too Short for those who Rejoice; But for those who Love, Time is not.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “任何让我们对他人感到恼火的事情都可以让我们了解自己。”
quote_en:
“Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有些人失去了所有的头脑，变成了疯狂的灵魂。有些人失去所有的灵魂，变成了理智的头脑。有些人两者都失去了，被接受了。”
quote_en:
“Some lose all mind and become soul,insane.some lose all soul and become mind, intellectual.some lose both and become accepted”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “生物学给你一个大脑。生活把它变成了一个头脑。”
quote_en:
“Biology gives you a brain. Life turns it into a mind.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在你之前，贝拉，我的生活就像一个没有月亮的夜晚。非常黑暗，但有星星、光点和理智……然后你像流星一样划过我的天空。突然间，一切都着火了；有辉煌，有美丽。当你走了，当流星落在地平线上时，一切都变黑了。什么都没有改变，但我的眼睛被光蒙蔽了。我再也看不见星星了。而且没有任何理由。”
quote_en:
“Before you, Bella, my life was like a moonless night. Very dark, but there were stars, points of light and reason. ...And then you shot across my sky like a meteor. Suddenly everything was on fire; there was brilliancy, there was beauty. When you were gone, when the meteor had fallen over the horizon, everything went black. Nothing had changed, but my eyes were blinded by the light. I couldn’t see the stars anymore. And there was no more reason, for anything.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你不知道，要做的不是害怕，而是学习。”
quote_en:
“If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “为别人流下的眼泪不是软弱的表现。它们是纯洁心灵的标志。”
quote_en:
“Tears shed for another person are not a sign of weakness. They are a sign of a pure heart.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你不喜欢别人的故事，那就写你自己的。”
quote_en:
“If you don't like someone's story, write your own.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “任何傻瓜都知道男人和女人有时会有不同的想法，但最大的区别是。男人会忘记，但从不原谅；女人会原谅，但从不忘记。”
quote_en:
“Any fool knows men and women think differently at times, but the biggest difference is this. Men forget, but never forgive; women forgive, but never forget.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我意识到，如果皮塔死了，只有一个人会受到无法修复的伤害。我。”
quote_en:
“I realize only one person will be damaged beyond repair if Peeta dies. Me.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候，”维尼说，“最小的东西在你的心里占据了最大的空间。”
quote_en:
“Sometimes,' said Pooh, 'the smallest things take up the most room in your heart.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我在这里试图阻止任何人说出人们经常说的关于他的真正愚蠢的话：我准备接受耶稣是一位伟大的道德导师，但我不接受他自称是上帝。这是我们不能说的一件事。一个仅仅是一个人并说耶稣所说的那种话的人不会是一位了不起的道德导师。他要么是一个疯子——与说他是一个水煮蛋的人一样——要么是地狱的魔鬼。你必须做出选择。要么这个人过去是，现在也是，上帝的儿子，要么是疯子，或者更糟。你可以把他当作傻瓜关起来，你可以随地吐痰。你可以像恶魔一样杀死他，或者你可以倒在他脚下，称他为主和上帝，但我们不要带着任何傲慢的废话来谈论他是一位伟大的人类老师。他没有向我们敞开大门。他不是故意的。”
quote_en:
“I am trying here to prevent anyone saying the really foolish thing that people often say about Him: I’m ready to accept Jesus as a great moral teacher, but I don’t accept his claim to be God. That is the one thing we must not say. A man who was merely a man and said the sort of things Jesus said would not be a great moral teacher. He would either be a lunatic — on the level with the man who says he is a poached egg — or else he would be the Devil of Hell. You must make your choice. Either this man was, and is, the Son of God, or else a madman or something worse. You can shut him up for a fool, you can spit at him and kill him as a demon or you can fall at his feet and call him Lord and God, but let us not come with any patronizing nonsense about his being a great human teacher. He has not left that open to us. He did not intend to.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个好的旅行者没有固定的计划，也不打算到达。”
quote_en:
“A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “人们在试图设计完全万无一失的东西时犯的一个常见错误是低估了完全愚蠢的人的聪明才智。”
quote_en:
“A common mistake that people make when trying to design something completely foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “丢失比找到容易得多。这就是我们一直在寻找但很少发现的原因——太多的锁没有足够的钥匙。”
quote_en:
“It's a lot easier to be lost than found. It's the reason we're always searching and rarely discovered--so many locks not enough keys.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “她什么也没说，只是抬头凝视着黑暗的天空，用悲伤的眼睛看着无限星星的缓慢舞蹈。”
quote_en:
“She says nothing at all, but simply stares upward into the dark sky and watches, with sad eyes, the slow dance of the infinite stars.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我很遗憾，学会如何生活需要一辈子的时间。”
quote_en:
“I regret that it takes a life to learn how to live.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我绝对不喜欢我有时如此疯狂地沉迷的兴奋剂。我不是在追求快乐的过程中危及生命、名誉和理智。我是在绝望地试图逃离痛苦的记忆、无法忍受的孤独感和对即将到来的奇怪厄运的恐惧。”
quote_en:
“I have absolutely no pleasure in the stimulants in which I sometimes so madly indulge. It has not been in the pursuit of pleasure that I have periled life and reputation and reason. It has been the desperate attempt to escape from torturing memories, from a sense of insupportable loneliness and a dread of some strange impending doom.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “从宇宙的角度来看，我们每个人都是宝贵的。如果一个人不同意你的观点，就让他活下去。在千亿个星系中，你找不到另一个。”
quote_en:
“Every one of us is, in the cosmic perspective, precious. If a human disagrees with you, let him live. In a hundred billion galaxies, you will not find another.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你为什么躲在我们的窗户下？”“是的，是的，说得好，佩妮！你在我们的窗下干什么，孩子？”“听着新闻，”哈利无可奈何地说。他的姑姑和叔叔交换了愤怒的表情。“又听新闻了！”“好吧，你看，每天都在变化，”哈利说
quote_en:
“Why were you lurking under our window?""Yes - yes, good point, Petunia! What were you doing under our windows, boy?""Listening to the news," said Harry in a resigned voice.His aunt and uncle exchanged looks of outrage."Listening to the news! Again?""Well, it changes every day, you see," said Harry.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我来自一个非常艰苦的社区。有一次，一个家伙拿刀指着我。我知道他不是专业人士，刀上沾着黄油。”
quote_en:
“I came from a real tough neighborhood. Once a guy pulled a knife on me. I knew he wasn't a professional, the knife had butter on it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “做能给你带来快乐的事，一刻也不要难过。”
quote_en:
“Don't feel bad for one moment about doing what brings you joy.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这就是为什么他们称之为美国梦，因为你必须睡着才能相信它。”
quote_en:
“That's why they call it the American Dream, because you have to be asleep to believe it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “美国永远不会被外界摧毁。如果我们动摇并失去自由，那将是因为我们摧毁了自己。”
quote_en:
“America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个人永远不会有足够的袜子，”邓布利多说。“又一个圣诞节来了又走了，我一双也没有。人们会坚持给我书。”
quote_en:
“One can never have enough socks," said Dumbledore. "Another Christmas has come and gone and I didn't get a single pair. People will insist on giving me books.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在生活中，与国际象棋不同，棋局会在对弈后继续。”
quote_en:
“In life, unlike chess, the game continues after checkmate.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个梦想比一千个现实更强大。”
quote_en:
“A single dream is more powerful than a thousand realities.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “恶意说出的真相会毁掉你能编造的所有谎言。”
quote_en:
“A truth that's told with bad intentBeats all the lies you can invent.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当一个人遇到一本真正的书时，毫无疑问。这就像坠入爱河。”
quote_en:
“There is no mistaking a real book when one meets it. It is like falling in love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我发现，大自然、阳光、自由和你自己总有一些美；这些都能帮助你。”
quote_en:
“I've found that there is always some beauty left -- in nature, sunshine, freedom, in yourself; these can all help you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一本书真的就像一个情人。它以一种美丽的方式安排在你的生活中。”
quote_en:
“A book is really like a lover. It arranges itself in your life in a way that is beautiful.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “放手并不意味着你不再关心别人。它只是意识到你唯一真正能控制的人就是你自己。”
quote_en:
“Letting go doesn't mean that you don't care about someone anymore. It's just realizing that the only person you really have control over is yourself.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我站着不动，视线模糊，就在那一刻，我听到了心碎的声音。那是一个小而干净的声音，就像一朵花的茎折断。”
quote_en:
“I stood still, vision blurring, and in that moment, I heard my heart break. It was a small, clean sound, like the snapping of a flower's stem.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “必须教孩子们如何思考，而不是思考什么。”
quote_en:
“Children must be taught how to think, not what to think.”
    
  ―

“The snake which cannot cast its skin has to die. As well the minds which are prevented from changing their opinions; they cease to be mind.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “世界上所有的秘密都包含在书中。阅读风险自负。”
quote_en:
“All the secrets of the world are contained in books. Read at your own risk.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “世界上只有一件事比被谈论更糟糕，那就是没有被谈论。”
quote_en:
“There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 有人说，“永远不要让他们看到你哭。”我说，如果你疯了，你可以哭，那就哭吧。这让所有人都感到恐惧。”
quote_en:
“Some people say, “Never let them see you cry.” I say, if you’re so mad you could just cry, then cry. It terrifies everyone.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “词典中找不到的定义：一种信任和爱的行为，经常被孩子们解读”
quote_en:
“A DEFINITION NOT FOUNDIN THE DICTIONARYNot leaving: an act of trust and love,often deciphered by children”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候，当我看着你的时候，我觉得我在凝视一颗遥远的星星。它很耀眼，但光线来自数万年前。也许这颗恒星已经不存在了。然而，有时候，对我来说，那束光似乎比任何东西都更真实。”
quote_en:
“Sometimes when I look at you, I feel I'm gazing at a distant star. It's dazzling, but the light is from tens of thousands of years ago.Maybe the star doesn't even exist any more. Yet sometimes that light seems more real to me than anything.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这很难吗？”我问。放手？“没有抓住不真实的东西那么难。”
quote_en:
“Was it hard?" I ask.Letting go?"Not as hard as holding on to something that wasn't real.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “和某人在一起通常就足够了。我不需要碰他们。甚至不需要说话。你们俩之间有一种感觉。你并不孤单。”
quote_en:
“It's often just enough to be with someone. I don't need to touch them. Not even talk. A feeling passes between you both. You're not alone.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我今天除了微笑什么也没做。”
quote_en:
“I've got nothing to do today but smile.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “从痛苦中出现了最强大的灵魂；最庞大的人物身上留下了伤痕。”
quote_en:
“Out of suffering have emerged the strongest souls; the most massive characters are seared with scars.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “书说：她这样做是因为。生活说：她这么做。书是向你解释事情的地方；生活是没有事情的地方。有些人更喜欢书，我并不感到惊讶。”
quote_en:
“Books say: She did this because. Life says: She did this. Books are where things are explained to you; life is where things aren't. I'm not surprised some people prefer books.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “虚幻比真实更强大。因为没有什么比你想象的那么完美。因为只有无形的想法、概念、信仰、幻想才能持久。石头会碎。木头会腐烂。人，好吧，他们会死。但像思想、梦想、传说这样脆弱的东西，它们可以继续下去。如果你能改变人们的思维方式。他们看待自己的方式。他们看世界的方式。你可以改变人们的生活方式。这是你能创造的唯一持久的东西。”
quote_en:
“The unreal is more powerful than the real. Because nothing is as perfect as you can imagine it. Because its only intangible ideas, concepts, beliefs, fantasies that last. Stone crumbles. Wood rots. People, well, they die. But things as fragile as a thought, a dream, a legend, they can go on and on. If you can change the way people think. The way they see themselves. The way they see the world. You can change the way people live their lives. That's the only lasting thing you can create.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “衣服造就男人。裸体的人对社会几乎没有影响。”
quote_en:
“Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我爱你，就像一个男人爱一个他从不碰的女人，只给她写信，还留着小照片。”
quote_en:
“I loved you like a man loves a woman he never touches, only writes to, keeps little photographs of.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “人类生活的目的，无论谁在控制它，都是爱身边被爱的人。”
quote_en:
“A purpose of human life, no matter who is controlling it, is to love whoever is around to be loved.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “成功是从一个失败到另一个失败的跌跌撞撞，没有失去热情。”
quote_en:
“Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 正如托尔斯泰所言，幸福是一个寓言，不幸是一个
quote_en:
“It's like Tolstoy said. Happiness is an allegory, unhappiness a .”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们是杯子，不断地、静静地被填满。诀窍是，知道如何倾身而出，让美丽的东西散发出来。”
quote_en:
“We are cups, constantly and quietly being filled. The trick is, knowing how to tip ourselves over and let the beautiful stuff out.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “啊！没有什么比呆在家里更舒服的了。”
quote_en:
“Ah! There is nothing like staying at home, for real comfort.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “人们放弃权力的最常见方式是认为自己没有权力。”
quote_en:
“The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don't have any.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “毕竟，有那么多脆弱的东西。人们很容易破碎，梦想和心灵也是如此。”
quote_en:
“There are so many fragile things, after all. People break so easily, and so do dreams and hearts.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “对作家来说，写作比其他人更难。”
quote_en:
“A writer is someone for whom writing is more difficult than it is for other people.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “保持金色，小马。保持金色……”枕头似乎有点沉了，约翰尼死了
quote_en:
“Stay gold, Ponyboy. Stay gold . . .” The pillow seemed to sink a little, and Johnny died.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “悲观主义者抱怨风；乐观主义者期待它改变；现实主义者调整风帆。”
quote_en:
“The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “让你的眼睛充满惊奇，”他说，“活得像在十秒钟内死去一样。看看这个世界。它比工厂里制造或支付的任何梦想都更奇妙。”
quote_en:
“Stuff your eyes with wonder, he said, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “那么，被误解有那么糟糕吗？毕达哥拉斯被误解了，苏格拉底、耶稣、路德、哥白尼、伽利略、牛顿，以及每一个曾经有血有肉的纯洁智慧的灵魂。伟大就是被误解。”
quote_en:
“Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “除非被书包围，否则我睡不着。”
quote_en:
“I cannot sleep unless I am surrounded by books.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “狗从不咬我。只有人类。”
quote_en:
“Dogs never bite me. Just humans.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我认为只有一种人。人。”
quote_en:
“I think there's just one kind of folks. Folks.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “但谁能说什么是最好的呢？这就是为什么你需要抓住你所拥有的幸福的任何机会，不要太担心别人。我的经验告诉我，我们一生中只有不到两到三次这样的机会，如果我们放弃了，我们会后悔一辈子。”
quote_en:
“But who can say what's best? That's why you need to grab whatever chance you have of happiness where you find it, and not worry about other people too much. My experience tells me that we get no more than two or three such chances in a life time, and if we let them go, we regret it for the rest of our lives.”
    
  ―

“We do not grow absolutely, chronologically. We grow sometimes in one dimension, and not in another; unevenly. We grow partially. We are relative. We are mature in one realm, childish in another. The past, present, and future mingle and pull us backward, forward, or fix us in the present. We are made up of layers, cells, constellations.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不管怎样，我一直在想象所有这些小孩子在这片大黑麦地里玩游戏。成千上万的小孩子，周围没有人——我是说，没有大个子——除了我。我站在一个疯狂的悬崖边上。我必须做的是，如果他们开始翻过悬崖，我必须抓住每个人——我的意思是，如果它们在奔跑，不看它们要去哪里，我必须从某个地方出来抓住它们。这就是我整天所做的。我只是黑麦地里的接球手。我知道这很疯狂，但这是我唯一真正想做的事情。”
quote_en:
“Anyway, I keep picturing all these little kids playing some game in this big field of rye and all. Thousands of little kids, and nobody's around - nobody big, I mean - except me. And I'm standing on the edge of some crazy cliff. What I have to do, I have to catch everybody if they start to go over the cliff - I mean if they're running and they don't look where they're going I have to come out from somewhere and catch them. That's all I do all day. I'd just be the catcher in the rye and all. I know it's crazy, but that's the only thing I'd really like to be.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “进入宇宙最清晰的方式是穿过森林荒野。”
quote_en:
“The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “أتمنى أن أبكي و أرتجف , التصق بواحد من الكبار , لكن الحقيقة القاسية هي أنك الكبار! .. أنت من يجب أن يمنح القوة و الأمن للآخرين!”
quote_en:
“أتمنى أن أبكي و أرتجف , التصق بواحد من الكبار , لكن الحقيقة القاسية هي أنك الكبار! .. أنت من يجب أن يمنح القوة و الأمن للآخرين!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我很坚强，我很有野心，我很清楚自己想要什么。如果这让我成为一个婊子，好吧。”
quote_en:
“I'm tough, I'm ambitious, and I know exactly what I want. If that makes me a bitch, okay.”
    
  ―

“When everyone knows you’re a monster, you needn’t waste time doing every monstrous thing.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “友谊的能力是上帝为我们的家人道歉的方式。”
quote_en:
“The capacity for friendship is God's way of apologizing for our families.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你会发现，有必要放手；只是因为它们很重。所以放手，放手。我的脚踝上没有系重物。”
quote_en:
“You will find that it is necessary to let things go; simply for the reason that they are heavy. So let them go, let go of them. I tie no weights to my ankles.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “记住永远做你自己。除非你很糟糕。”
quote_en:
“Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你忍受无法忍受的事情，你忍受它。仅此而已。”
quote_en:
“You endure what is unbearable, and you bear it. That is all.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我很自私。我很勇敢。”
quote_en:
“I am selfish. I am brave.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我相信……真相通常比谎言更可取。”
quote_en:
“It is my belief... that the truth is generally preferable to lies.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “是的，我迷恋你：我现在仍然如此。没有人能提高我如此敏锐的身体感知能力。我把你排除在外，因为我无法忍受一时的幻想。在我放弃我的身体之前，我必须放弃我的思想、头脑和梦想。而你没有这些。”
quote_en:
“Yes, I was infatuated with you: I am still. No one has ever heightened such a keen capacity of physical sensation in me. I cut you out because I couldn't stand being a passing fancy. Before I give my body, I must give my thoughts, my mind, my dreams. And you weren't having any of those.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你捡到一只饥饿的狗，让它富裕起来，它就不会咬你。这是狗和人的主要区别。”
quote_en:
“If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “尊重的发明是为了掩盖爱应该存在的空白。”
quote_en:
“Respect was invented to cover the empty place where love should be.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不怕风暴，因为我正在学习如何驾驶我的船。”
quote_en:
“I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候，当我说话的时候，我的言语跟不上我的想法。我想知道为什么我们思考的速度比说话的速度快。也许这样我们才能三思而后行。”
quote_en:
“Sometimes when I'm talking, my words can't keep up with my thoughts. I wonder why we think faster than we speak. Probably so we can think twice.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “昨天已经过去了。明天还没有到来。我们只有今天。让我们开始吧。”
quote_en:
“Yesterday is gone. Tomorrow has not yet come. We have only today. Let us begin.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “他想，这就是被拖入竞技场面对死亡和昂首挺胸走进竞技场之间的区别。也许有些人会说，这两种方式之间没有什么可选择的，但邓布利多知道——我也知道，哈利带着强烈的自豪感想，我的父母也知道——世界上的一切都是不同的。”
quote_en:
“It was, he thought, the difference between being dragged into the arena to face a battle to the death and walking into the arena with your head held high. Some people, perhaps, would say that there was little to choose between the two ways, but Dumbledore knew - and so do I, thought Harry, with a rush of fierce pride, and so did my parents - that there was all the difference in the world.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “也许每个人都能超越自己的能力。”
quote_en:
“Maybe everyone can live beyond what they're capable of.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你的想象力失去焦点时，你不能依靠你的眼睛。”
quote_en:
“You can't depend on your eyes when your imagination is out of focus.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “真正的孤独不一定局限于你独处的时候。”
quote_en:
“Real loneliness is not necessarily limited to when you are alone.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “她是灰烬和火焰的继承人，她不会向任何人鞠躬。”
quote_en:
“She was the heir of ash and fire, and she would bow to no one.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我是氧气，他快喘不过气来了。”
quote_en:
“I'm oxygen and he's dying to breathe.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “仍然在拐角处，可能会等待一条新路或一扇秘密门，尽管我经常经过它们，但总有一天，我会走上月球以西、太阳以东的隐秘之路。”
quote_en:
“Still round the corner there may wait A new road or a secret gateAnd though I oft have passed them by A day will come at last when IShall take the hidden paths that run West of the Moon, East of the Sun.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “眼泪中有一种神圣……它们是压倒一切的悲伤、深深的悔恨和难以形容的爱的使者。”
quote_en:
“There is a sacredness in tears....They are the messengers of overwhelming grief, of deep contrition and of unspeakable love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要赢得世界而失去灵魂，智慧胜过金银。”
quote_en:
“Don't Gain The World & Lose Your Soul, Wisdom Is Better Than Silver Or Gold.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果我现在放弃并发疯，会为你节省很多时间吗？”
quote_en:
“Would it save you a lot of time if I just gave up and went mad now?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “人们可能会在图书馆失去生命。他们应该得到警告。”
quote_en:
“People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned.”
    
  ―

“Much of my life had been devoted to trying not to cry in front of people who loved me, so I knew what Augustus was doing. You clench your teeth. You look up. You tell yourself that if they see you cry, it will hurt them, and you will be nothing but a Sadness in their lives, and you must not become a mere sadness, so you will not cry, and you say all of this to yourself while looking up at the ceiling, and then you swallow even though your throat does not want to close and you look at the person who loves you and smile.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “与其漂亮无用，不如坚强。”
quote_en:
“Better to be strong than pretty and useless.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你只有一次生命。实际上，尽可能充实地生活是你的责任。”
quote_en:
“You only get one life. It's actually your duty to live it as fully as possible.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不打算穿红色的裙子，”她说。“夫人，那会很好看的，”她喊道。她对着水面上聚集的气泡说。“如果有人我想在晚餐时把他打晕，我会打他的脸。”
quote_en:
“I'm not going to wear a red dress," she said."It would look stunning, My Lady," she called.She spoke to the bubbles gathered on the surface of the water. "If there's anyone I wish to stun at dinner, I'll hit him in the face.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “从我拿起你的书到放下，我笑得前仰后合。总有一天我会读的。”
quote_en:
“From the moment I picked up your book until I put it down, I was convulsed with laughter. Some day I intend reading it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “知识会说话，但智慧会倾听”
quote_en:
“Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有一件事我们永远不会得到足够的，那就是爱。有一件事情我们永远不会给予足够的，就是爱。”
quote_en:
“The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough of is love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果神经质的人同时想要两件互斥的事情，那么我神经质得要命。在剩下的日子里，我会在一件互斥的事和另一件事之间来回奔波。”
quote_en:
“If neurotic is wanting two mutually exclusive things at one and the same time, then I'm neurotic as hell. I'll be flying back and forth between one mutually exclusive thing and another for the rest of my days.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我相信一个坚强的女人可能比一个男人更坚强，尤其是如果她心中恰好有爱。我想一个有爱的女人是坚不可摧的。”
quote_en:
“I believe a strong woman may be stronger than a man, particularly if she happens to have love in her heart. I guess a loving woman is indestructible.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “学习经历就是说，‘你知道你刚刚做的那件事吗？不要那样做。’”
quote_en:
“A learning experience is one of those things that says, 'You know that thing you just did? Don't do that.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你恨一个人，你恨他身上属于你自己的东西。不属于我们自己的东西不会打扰我们。”
quote_en:
“If you hate a person, you hate something in him that is part of yourself. What isn't part of ourselves doesn't disturb us.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “科学和宗教并不矛盾。科学太年轻，无法理解。”
quote_en:
“Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你想知道你是谁吗？不要问。行动起来！行动会描绘和定义你。”
quote_en:
“Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “令人惊讶的是，一个小小的明天可以弥补昨天的很多。”
quote_en:
“It's amazing how a little tomorrow can make up for a whole lot of yesterday.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “世上没有坏人。我们都只是偶尔做坏事的人。”
quote_en:
“There is no such thing as bad people. We’re all just people who sometimes do bad things.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我在找朋友。驯服是什么意思？”“这是一种经常被忽视的行为，”狐狸说。“它意味着建立联系。”……”
quote_en:
“I am looking for friends. What does that mean -- tame?""It is an act too often neglected," said the fox. "It means to establish ties." "To establish ties?" "Just that," said the fox. "To me, you are still nothing more than a little boy who is just like a hundred thousand other little boys. And I have no need of you. And you, on your part, have no need of me. To you I am nothing more than a fox like a hundred thousand other foxes. But if you tame me, then we shall need each other. To me, you will be unique in all the world. To you, I shall be unique in all the world....”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 外面的生物从一只猪看向另一只人，从一只人看向一只猪，又从一头猪看向一个人；但已经无法分辨哪只是哪只了
quote_en:
“The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们内心都有战争。有时它让我们活着。有时它威胁要摧毁我们。”
quote_en:
“We both have war inside us. Sometimes it keeps us alive. Sometimes it threatens to destroy us.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 他把她抱在怀里，在阳光明媚的天空下吻了她，他不在乎他们在许多人的眼前高高地站在墙上
quote_en:
“And he took her in his arms and kissed her under the sunlit sky, and he cared not that they stood high upon the walls in the sight of many.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你意识到，我们对未来的不信任使我们很难放弃过去。”
quote_en:
“You realize that our mistrust of the future makes it hard to give up the past.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们唯一能活下去的方式就是成长。我们唯一能成长的方式就是改变。我们唯一能够改变的方式是学习。我们唯一可以学习的方式是暴露自己。我们唯一可能暴露自己的方式是把自己暴露在外。去做吧。把自己暴露出来。”
quote_en:
“The only way that we can live, is if we grow. The only way that we can grow is if we change. The only way that we can change is if we learn. The only way we can learn is if we are exposed. And the only way that we can become exposed is if we throw ourselves out into the open. Do it. Throw yourself.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我一直在思念那些我从未去过的国家，渴望去那些我无法去的地方。”
quote_en:
“I've been homesick for countries I've never been, and longed to be where I couldn't be.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “热爱你所过的生活。过你所热爱的生活。”
quote_en:
“Love the life you live.Live the life you love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我的意思是，”Ipslore苦涩地说，“这个世界上有什么真正让生活变得有价值？”死神想了想。猫，他最终说。猫很可爱。”
quote_en:
“I meant," said Ipslore bitterly, "what is there in this world that truly makes living worthwhile?"Death thought about it.CATS, he said eventually. CATS ARE NICE.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “即使你走在正确的轨道上，如果你只是坐在那里，你也会被撞倒。”
quote_en:
“Even if you are on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “让我们思考不可想象的事情，让我们做不可撤销的事情。让我们准备好与不可言喻的事情本身作斗争，看看我们是否最终不能做到。”
quote_en:
“Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “独处从来都不觉得是对的。有时感觉很好，但从来都不感觉对。”
quote_en:
“being alone never felt right. sometimes it felt good, but it never felt right.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们的故事有三个部分：开始、中间和结束。尽管这是所有故事的展开方式，但我仍然不敢相信我们的故事没有永远持续下去。”
quote_en:
“Our story has three parts: a beginning, a middle, and an end. And although this is the way all stories unfold, I still can't believe that ours didn't go on forever.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “她看起来很酷，很专注，很安静，但她的眼睛仍然盯着地平线。你以为一见到她，你就知道她所有的事情，但你认为你知道的一切都是错的。激情就像一条血河流过她。她只看了一会儿，面具就滑落了，你摔倒了。你所有的明天都从这里开始。”
quote_en:
“She seems so cool, so focused, so quiet, yet her eyes remain fixed upon the horizon. You think you know all there is to know about her immediately upon meeting her, but everything you think you know is wrong. Passion flows through her like a river of blood. She only looked away for a moment, and the mask slipped, and you fell. All your tomorrows start here.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “伟大的头脑总是被较小的头脑所害怕。”
quote_en:
“Great minds are always feared by lesser minds.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “令人沮丧的是，有多少人对诚实感到震惊，而很少有人对欺骗感到震惊。”
quote_en:
“It's discouraging to think how many people are shocked by honesty and how few by deceit.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “让我活下去，爱你，用漂亮的句子好好地说出来”
quote_en:
“let me live, love, and say it well in good sentences”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我喜欢有意思的好词……”
quote_en:
“I like good strong words that mean something…”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这就是你应该做的：爱地球、太阳和动物，鄙视财富，给每一个有要求的人施舍，为愚蠢和疯狂的人挺身而出，把你的收入和劳动奉献给他人，憎恨暴君，不与上帝争论，对人民有耐心和宽容，对任何已知或未知的事物或任何人或任何数量的人脱帽致敬，与有权势的未受过教育的人、年轻人和家庭母亲自由相处，在你生命的每一年的每个季节在户外阅读这些树叶，重新审视你在学校、教堂或任何书中所听到的一切，摒弃任何侮辱你自己灵魂的东西，你的肉体将成为一首伟大的诗，拥有最丰富的财富。不仅语言流畅，嘴唇和脸上无声的线条、睫毛之间以及身体的每一个动作和关节都流畅。”
quote_en:
“This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat to nothing known or unknown or to any man or number of men, go freely with powerful uneducated persons and with the young and with the mothers of families, read these leaves in the open air every season of every year of your life, re-examine all you have been told at school or church or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your own soul, and your very flesh shall be a great poem and have the richest fluency not only in its words but in the silent lines of its lips and face and between the lashes of your eyes and in every motion and joint of your body.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “书籍很容易被毁掉。但只要人们能记住，文字就会永存。”
quote_en:
“Books are easily destroyed. But words will live as long as people can remember them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你在有限的日子里给了我一个永远，我很感激。”
quote_en:
“You gave me a forever within the numbered days, and I'm grateful.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在我们能击中的所有树中，我们必须找到一棵能回击的树。”
quote_en:
“Of all the trees we could've hit, we had to get one that hits back.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “三个人可以保守秘密，如果他们中的两个死了。”
quote_en:
“Three may keep a secret, if two of them are dead.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “任何坠入爱河的人都在寻找自己缺失的部分。所以，任何陷入爱河的人一想到爱人都会感到难过。这就像回到一个你有美好回忆的房间里，一个你很久没见过的房间里。”
quote_en:
“Anyone who falls in love is searching for the missing pieces of themselves. So anyone who's in love gets sad when they think of their lover. It's like stepping back inside a room you have fond memories of, one you haven't seen in a long time.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “善良的灵魂并不像我以前想的那么稀少。发现世界上有这么多善良的灵魂真是太棒了。”
quote_en:
“Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我已经接受了不知道自己要去哪里的感觉。我训练自己去爱它。因为只有当我们悬浮在半空中，看不到降落的时候，我们才会迫使翅膀展开，唉，开始飞行。当我们飞行时，我们可能仍然不知道要去哪里。但奇迹在于翅膀的展开。你可能不知道你要去哪里，但你知道只要你展开翅膀，风就会把你带走。”
quote_en:
“I have come to accept the feeling of not knowing where I am going. And I have trained myself to love it. Because it is only when we are suspended in mid-air with no landing in sight, that we force our wings to unravel and alas begin our flight. And as we fly, we still may not know where we are going to. But the miracle is in the unfolding of the wings. You may not know where you're going, but you know that so long as you spread your wings, the winds will carry you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “最重要的是，我恨你，因为我经常想起你。这很恶心，我停不下来。”
quote_en:
“Most of all, I hate you because I think of you. Often. It's disgusting, and I can't stop.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “残忍不会让人不诚实，就像勇敢不会让人善良一样。”
quote_en:
“Cruelty does not make a person dishonest, the same way bravery does not make a person kind.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “美丽只是肤浅的，但丑陋是彻头彻尾的。”
quote_en:
“Beauty is only skin deep, but ugly goes clean to the bone.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个好人生命中最美好的部分：他那小小的、无名的、被遗忘的善良和爱的行为。”
quote_en:
“The best portion of a good man's life: his little, nameless unremembered acts of kindness and love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “也许有野兽……也许只有我们。”
quote_en:
“Maybe there is a beast… maybe it's only us.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我最好的朋友是一个会给我一本我没有读过的书的人。”
quote_en:
“My Best Friend is a person who will give me a book I have not read.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果我有一个属于自己的世界，一切都是无稽之谈。没有什么会是现在的样子，因为一切都会是现在不是的样子。相反，什么是，它不会是。什么不是，它会是。你看？”
quote_en:
“If I had a world of my own, everything would be nonsense. Nothing would be what it is, because everything would be what it isn't. And contrary wise, what is, it wouldn't be. And what it wouldn't be, it would. You see?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “看到花园很漂亮，不必相信它的底部也有仙女，这还不够吗？”
quote_en:
“Isn't it enough to see that a garden is beautiful without having to believe that there are fairies at the bottom of it too?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “音乐表达了那些无法言说、无法沉默的东西。”
quote_en:
“Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “艺术和爱是同一件事：这是在不属于你的事物中看到自己的过程。”
quote_en:
“Art and love are the same thing: It’s the process of seeing yourself in things that are not you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “智慧来自经验。经验往往是缺乏智慧的结果。”
quote_en:
“Wisdom comes from experience. Experience is often a result of lack of wisdom.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我说让世界见鬼去吧，但我应该一直喝茶。”
quote_en:
“I say let the world go to hell, but I should always have my tea.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “傻瓜说话，懦夫沉默，智者倾听。”
quote_en:
“Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “对我来说，有美好的日子也有艰难的日子——即使是现在。不要让艰难的日子占上风。”
quote_en:
“There are good days and hard days for me—even now. Don’t let the hard days win.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候，与一个你毫无共同之处的人交谈，仍然被他们的存在所吸引，这是一种爱的形式。”
quote_en:
“Sometimes it's a form of love just to talk to somebody that you have nothing in common with and still be fascinated by their presence.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “冬天来了。”
quote_en:
“Winter is coming.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “做你自己的圣经。选择并收集你所有阅读材料中像号角声一样对你来说的所有单词和句子。”
quote_en:
“Make your own Bible. Select and collect all the words and sentences that in all your readings have been to you like the blast of a trumpet.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有男人的女人就像没有自行车的鱼。”
quote_en:
“A woman without a man is like a fish without a bicycle.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “灯塔不会跑遍整个岛屿寻找船只来拯救；它们只是站在那里闪闪发光。”
quote_en:
“Lighthouses don’t go running all over an island looking for boats to save; they just stand there shining.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我渴望那些最终会毁灭我的东西。”
quote_en:
“I desire the things which will destroy me in the end.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “别告诉我，”杰斯说，“西蒙把自己变成了一只豹猫，你想让我在伊莎贝尔把他变成小偷之前做点什么。好吧，你得等到明天。我没空了。”他指着自己——他穿着袖子上有个洞的蓝色睡衣。“看，杰米。”做任何事都是为了——”“杰西！”她打断了他，声音变得尖叫起来。“闭嘴，听我说，好吗？”
quote_en:
“Don't tell me," Jace said, "Simon's turned himself into an ocelot and you want me to do something about it before Isabelle makes him into a stole. Well, you'll have have to wait till tomorrow. I'm out of commission." He pointed at himself - he was wearing blue pajamas with a hole in the sleeve. "Look. Jammies.""Jace," Clary said, "this is important.""Don't tell me," he said. "You've got a drawing emergency. You need a nude model. Well, I'm not in the mood. You could always ask Hodge," he said as an afterthought. "I hear he'll do anything for a -""JACE!" she interrupted him, her voice rising to a scream. "JUST SHUT UP FOR A SECOND AND LISTEN, WILL YOU?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “原谅敌人比原谅朋友容易。”
quote_en:
“It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我很聪明，永远不会长大，同时欺骗人们相信我长大了。”
quote_en:
“I was wise enough never to grow up, while fooling people into believing I had.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “否认龙存在的人经常被龙吃掉。从内部。”
quote_en:
“People who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons. From within.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我时不时地喜欢按照别人告诉我的去做，只是为了迷惑人们。”
quote_en:
“Every now and then I like to do as I'm told, just to confuse people.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你不看报纸，你就不知情。如果你看报纸，就会被误导。”
quote_en:
“If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're mis-informed.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “别那么谦虚，你没那么伟大。”
quote_en:
“Don't be so humble - you are not that great.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “卢西恩，当你长时间被困在黑暗中时，你会发现黑暗开始回头看。”
quote_en:
“When you spend so long trapped in darkness, Lucien, you find that the darkness begins to stare back.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有些书的封底和封面是迄今为止最好的部分。”
quote_en:
“There are books of which the backs and covers are by far the best parts.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要相信你听到的，只相信你看到的一半。”
quote_en:
“Believe nothing you hear, and only one half that you see.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “即使在最黑暗的时候，只要记得开灯，幸福也能找到。”
quote_en:
“Happiness can be found, even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.”
    
  ―

“It's possible to go on, no matter how impossible it seems, and that in time, the grief . . . lessens. It may not go away completely, but after a while it's not so overwhelming.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一本好书是我生命中的一件大事。”
quote_en:
“A good book is an event in my life.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 狐狸说：“人们已经忘记了这个事实。但你不能忘记。你要永远对你驯服的东西负责。你要对你的玫瑰负责。”
quote_en:
“People have forgotten this truth," the fox said. "But you mustn’t forget it. You become responsible forever for what you’ve tamed. You’re responsible for your rose.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我总是在自杀和杀死周围的人之间左右为难。”
quote_en:
“I am constantly torn between killing myself and killing everyone around me.”
    
  ―

“To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我问自己关于现在的事：它有多宽，有多深，有多少是我的。”
quote_en:
“And I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “只要你不停下来，走得多慢都没关系。”
quote_en:
“It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我已经发现独处是不好的，所以我和周围的人建立了友谊，有时和宇宙在一起，有时和我自己微不足道的自我在一起；但我的书永远是我的朋友，让其他一切都失败吧。”
quote_en:
“I had already found that it was not good to be alone, and so made companionship with what there was around me, sometimes with the universe and sometimes with my own insignificant self; but my books were always my friends, let fail all else.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这个世界充满了神奇的东西，耐心地等待我们的感官变得更加敏锐。”
quote_en:
“The world is full of magic things, patiently waiting for our senses to grow sharper.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “Peeta，你在面试时说你永远喜欢我。永远是什么时候开始的？哦，让我想想。我想是开学的第一天。我们五岁。你穿了一件红色格子裙，头发……是两条辫子，而不是一条。我们排队时，我父亲指给你看。”你父亲？为什么？“他说，'看到那个小女孩了吗？我想娶她的母亲，但她和一个煤矿工人私奔了。'“什么？你在编造！”不，这是真的。我说，'一个煤矿工？如果她能有你，她为什么想要一个煤矿矿工？'他说：“因为当他唱歌时……连鸟儿都会停下来听。”
quote_en:
“Peeta, you said at the interview you’d had a crush on me forever. When did forever start?Oh, let’s see. I guess the first day of school. We were five. You had on a red plaid dress and your hair...it was in two braids instead of one. My father pointed you out when we were waiting to line up."Your father? Why?"He said, ‘See that little girl? I wanted to marry her mother, but she ran off with a coal miner.'"What? You’re making that up!"No, true story. And I said, 'A coal miner? Why did she want a coal miner if she could’ve had you?' And he said, 'Because when he sings...even the birds stop to listen.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我不必与人交谈时，我的想象力会更好地发挥作用。”
quote_en:
“My imagination functions much better when I don't have to speak to people.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “多亏了我晚上独自读书，我或多或少还是清醒的。”
quote_en:
“It is thanks to my evening reading alone that I am still more or less sane.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你所做的事情会产生影响，你必须决定你想产生什么样的影响。”
quote_en:
“What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “成功最糟糕的部分是试图找到一个为你高兴的人。”
quote_en:
“The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “月亮是一个忠诚的伴侣。它永远不会离开。它总是在那里，看着我们，坚定不移，在我们的光明和黑暗时刻了解我们，就像我们一样永远在变化。每一天，它都是自己的不同版本。有时软弱而苍白，有时坚强而充满光明。月亮理解人类的意义。不确定。孤独。被不完美所困扰。”
quote_en:
“The moon is a loyal companion.It never leaves. It’s always there, watching, steadfast, knowing us in our light and dark moments, changing forever just as we do. Every day it’s a different version of itself. Sometimes weak and wan, sometimes strong and full of light. The moon understands what it means to be human.Uncertain. Alone. Cratered by imperfections.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我一见到你就知道我需要你的一些东西。结果发现这根本不是关于你的。只有你。”
quote_en:
“I knew the second I met youthat there was something about you I needed. Turns out it wasn’t something about you at all. It was just you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “愿邪恶的力量在去你家的路上变得混乱。”
quote_en:
“May the forces of evil become confused on the way to your house.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有罪恶，也没有美德。人们只是做一些事情。”
quote_en:
“There ain't no sin and there ain't no virtue. There's just stuff people do.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “只有那些冒险走得太远的人，才有可能知道自己能走多远。”
quote_en:
“Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “只有死者看到了战争的结束。”
quote_en:
“Only the dead have seen the end of war.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “试图定义自己就像试图咬自己的牙齿。”
quote_en:
“Trying to define yourself is like trying to bite your own teeth.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “痛苦需要被关注。上帝在我们的快乐中对我们低语，在我们的良心中说话，但在我们的痛苦中呼喊。这是他唤醒聋哑世界的扩音器。”
quote_en:
“Pain insists upon being attended to. God whispers to us in our pleasures, speaks in our consciences, but shouts in our pains. It is his megaphone to rouse a deaf world.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “是的，霜冻。垂死者的最后一道防线。”
quote_en:
“Yes, frosting. The final defense of the dying.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们只能知道我们什么都不知道。这是人类智慧的最高境界。”
quote_en:
“We can know only that we know nothing. And that is the highest degree of human wisdom.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “!لك شيء في هذا العالم.. فقم”
quote_en:
“!لك شيء في هذا العالم.. فقم”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “他要么永远活着，要么在尝试中死去。”
quote_en:
“He was going to live forever, or die in the attempt.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “孩子们从爱父母开始；随着年龄的增长，他们会评判父母；有时他们会原谅父母。”
quote_en:
“Children begin by loving their parents; as they grow older they judge them; sometimes they forgive them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “永远不要放弃……没有人知道接下来会发生什么。”
quote_en:
“Never give up... No one knows what's going to happen next.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “今天很好。今天很有趣。明天又是新的一天。”
quote_en:
“Today was good. Today was fun. Tomorrow is another one.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不多愁善感——我和你一样浪漫。你知道，这个想法是，多愁善心的人认为事情会持续下去——浪漫的人绝望地相信事情不会持续下去。”
quote_en:
“I'm not sentimental--I'm as romantic as you are. The idea, you know,is that the sentimental person thinks things will last--the romanticperson has a desperate confidence that they won't.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时，即使是力量也必须屈服于智慧。”
quote_en:
“Even strength must bow to wisdom sometimes.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “永远不要低估大群体中愚蠢的人的力量。”
quote_en:
“Never underestimate the power of stupid people in large groups.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有一天，你会亲吻一个你无法呼吸的男人，发现呼吸无关紧要。”
quote_en:
“One day you will kiss a man you can't breathe without, and find that breath is of little consequence.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这个世界是一个危险的地方，不是因为那些邪恶的人，而是因为那些对此无动于衷的人。”
quote_en:
“The world is a dangerous place to live, not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don't do anything about it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “光认为它比任何东西都快，但这是错误的。无论光传播得多快，它都会发现黑暗总是先到达那里，并在等待它。”
quote_en:
“Light thinks it travels faster than anything but it is wrong. No matter how fast light travels, it finds the darkness has always got there first, and is waiting for it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一旦你把碎片放回一起，即使你看起来完好无损，你也永远不会和秋天前完全一样。”
quote_en:
“Once you had put the pieces back together, even though you may look intact, you were never quite the same as you'd been before the fall.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “人们担心孩子们玩枪，青少年看暴力视频；我们担心某种暴力文化会接管他们。没有人担心孩子们会听成千上万首关于心碎、拒绝、痛苦、苦难和失去的歌曲。”
quote_en:
“People worry about kids playing with guns, and teenagers watching violent videos; we are scared that some sort of culture of violence will take them over. Nobody worries about kids listening to thousands - literally thousands - of songs about broken hearts and rejection and pain and misery and loss.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一开始什么都没有，爆炸了。”
quote_en:
“In the beginning there was nothing, which exploded.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我的舌头会说出我心中的愤怒，否则我隐藏的心会碎的。”
quote_en:
“My tongue will tell the anger of my heart, or else my heart concealing it will break.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “但在孤独的生活中，很少有另一个灵魂靠近你的时刻，就像星星每年掠过地球一样。对我来说，他就是这样一个星座。”
quote_en:
“But in a solitary life, there are rare moments when another soul dips near yours, as stars once a year brush the earth. Such a constellation was he to me.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我很高兴你和我在一起。山姆，一切都结束了。”
quote_en:
“I am glad you are here with me. Here at the end of all things, Sam.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你独自做的梦只是一个梦。你一起做的梦是现实。”
quote_en:
“A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.”
    
  ―

“Who in the world am I? Ah, that's the great puzzle.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “答应我，你永远不会忘记我，因为如果我以为你会忘记我，我永远不会离开。”
quote_en:
“Promise me you'll never forget me because if I thought you would, I'd never leave.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “创造力是智力享受乐趣。”
quote_en:
“Creativity is intelligence having fun.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果我遵守了所有的规则，我就永远不会有任何进展。”
quote_en:
“If I'd observed all the rules I'd never have got anywhere.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “把人分为好人和坏人是荒谬的。人要么迷人，要么乏味。”
quote_en:
“It is absurd to divide people into good and bad. People are either charming or tedious.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你的信仰变成你的思想，你的思想变成你的言语，你的言语变成你的行动，你的行动变成你的习惯，你的习惯变成你的价值观，你的价值成为你的命运。”
quote_en:
“Your beliefs become your thoughts, Your thoughts become your words, Your words become your actions, Your actions become your habits, Your habits become your values, Your values become your destiny.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果事情开始发生，不要担心，不要炖，只要继续下去，你也会开始发生的。”
quote_en:
“If things start happening, don't worry, don't stew, just go right along and you'll start happening too.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 我祖父说：“每个人死后都必须留下一些东西。一个孩子、一本书、一幅画、一座房子、一堵墙、一双鞋。或者一个花园。你的手以某种方式触摸过的东西，这样你死后你的灵魂就有地方去了，当人们看到你种下的那棵树或那朵花时，你就在那里。你做什么都没关系，他说，只要你把手拿开后把它从触摸前的样子变成像你一样的东西。他说，刚修剪草坪的人和真正的园丁之间的区别在于触摸。草坪修剪工可能根本不在那里；园丁将在那里度过一生。”
quote_en:
“Everyone must leave something behind when he dies, my grandfather said. A child or a book or a painting or a house or a wall built or a pair of shoes made. Or a garden planted. Something your hand touched some way so your soul has somewhere to go when you die, and when people look at that tree or that flower you planted, you're there. It doesn't matter what you do, he said, so long as you change something from the way it was before you touched it into something that's like you after you take your hands away. The difference between the man who just cuts lawns and a real gardener is in the touching, he said. The lawn-cutter might just as well not have been there at all; the gardener will be there a lifetime.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “她弯下腰，看着他那张死气沉沉的脸，莱塞尔吻了她最好的朋友鲁迪·斯坦纳，嘴唇柔软而真诚。他尝起来又满是灰尘，又甜又甜。在树荫下，在无政府主义者西装收藏的光芒中，他尝起来像是悔恨。她吻了他又长又软，当她抽离时，她用手指碰了碰他的嘴……她没有说再见。她无能为力，在他身边多待了几分钟，她就能够从地上撕下来了。人类能做什么让我感到惊讶，即使溪水顺着他们的脸流下来，他们蹒跚前行…”
quote_en:
“She leaned down and looked at his lifeless face and Leisel kissed her best friend, Rudy Steiner, soft and true on his lips. He tasted dusty and sweet. He tasted like regret in the shadows of trees and in the glow of the anarchist's suit collection. She kissed him long and soft, and when she pulled herself away, she touched his mouth with her fingers...She did not say goodbye. She was incapable, and after a few more minutes at his side, she was able to tear herself from the ground. It amazes me what humans can do, even when streams are flowing down their faces and they stagger on...”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你想保守秘密，你也必须对自己隐瞒。”
quote_en:
“If you want to keep a secret, you must also hide it from yourself.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要温和地进入那个美好的夜晚。愤怒，愤怒地反对光明的消逝。”
quote_en:
“Do not go gentle into that good night.Rage, rage against the dying of the light.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “他是我爸爸妈妈最好的朋友。他是一名被判有罪的杀人犯，但他已经从巫师监狱越狱，正在逃亡。不过，他喜欢和我保持联系……了解我的消息……看看我是否高兴……”
quote_en:
“He was my mum and dad's best friend. He's a convicted murderer, but he's broken out of wizard prison and he's on the run. He likes to keep in touch with me, though...keep up with my news...check if I'm happy...”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我的灵魂来自别处，我敢肯定，我打算最终去那里。”
quote_en:
“My soul is from elsewhere, I'm sure of that, and I intend to end up there.”
    
  ―

“No matter what he does, every person on earth plays a central role in the history of the world. And normally he doesn't know it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “别以为它会死，”死神说。“只要把它想成是为了躲避洪水而早点离开。”
quote_en:
“DON'T THINK OF IT AS DYING, said Death. JUST THINK OF IT AS LEAVING EARLY TO AVOID THE RUSH.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “人民不应该害怕政府。政府应该害怕人民。”
quote_en:
“People shouldn't be afraid of their government. Governments should be afraid of their people.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要爱上像我这样的人。我会带你去博物馆、公园和纪念碑，在每一个美丽的地方亲吻你，这样你再也不能回到他们身边，除非尝到我嘴里的鲜血。我会以最美丽的方式摧毁你。当我离开时，你会终于明白，为什么风暴是以人的名字命名的。”
quote_en:
“Do not fall in love with people like me. I will take you to museums, and parks, and monuments, and kiss you in every beautiful place, so that you can never go back to them without tasting me like blood in your mouth.I will destroy you in the most beautiful way possible. And when I leave you will finally understand, why storms are named after people.”
    
  ―

“For what it’s worth: it’s never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. There’s no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you see things that startle you. I hope you feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people with a different point of view. I hope you live a life you’re proud of. If you find that you’re not, I hope you have the courage to start all over again.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你知道吗，在几乎整个人类历史上，平均寿命都不到30年？你可以指望真正的成年期是10年左右，对吧？没有退休计划，没有职业规划。没有规划。没有时间规划。没有未来。但后来寿命开始变长，人们开始拥有越来越多的未来。现在生活已经成为未来。你生命中的每一刻都是为了未来而活的——你上高中是为了上大学，这样你就可以找到一份好工作，这样你就能买一栋漂亮的房子，这样你才能负担得起送孩子上大学的费用，这样他们就可以得到一份好的工作。好工作，这样他们就可以买一栋漂亮的房子，这样他们就能负担得起送孩子上大学的费用。”
quote_en:
“Did you know that for pretty much the entire history of the human species, the average life span was less than thirty years? You could count on ten years or so of real adulthood, right? There was no planning for retirement, There was no planning for a career. There was no planning. No time for plannning. No time for a future. But then the life spans started getting longer, and people started having more and more future. And now life has become the future. Every moment of your life is lived for the future--you go to high school so you can go to college so you can get a good job so you can get a nice house so you can afford to send your kids to college so they can get a good job so they can get a nice house so they can afford to send their kids to college.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想知道雪是否会轻轻地亲吻树木和田野？然后，它会用一条白色的被子把它们紧紧地盖起来；也许它会说，”亲爱的，去睡吧，直到夏天再来。“
quote_en:
“I wonder if the snow  the trees and fields, that it kisses them so gently? And then it covers them up snug, you know, with a white quilt; and perhaps it says, "Go to sleep, darlings, till the summer comes again.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “记住，记住，这是现在，现在，现在。活下去，感受它，坚持它。我想敏锐地意识到我认为理所当然的一切。”
quote_en:
“Remember, remember, this is now, and now, and now. Live it, feel it, cling to it. I want to become acutely aware of all I’ve taken for granted.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “大多数关于巫术的书都会告诉你女巫是裸体工作的。这是因为大多数有关巫术的书是由男人写的。”
quote_en:
“Most books on witchcraft will tell you that witches work naked. This is because most books on witchcraft were written by men.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你自己，就像整个宇宙中的任何人一样，值得你的爱和感情。”
quote_en:
“You yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.”
    
  ―

“What are all these?" Clary asked."Vials of holy water, blessed knives, steel and silver blades," Jace said, piling the weapons on the floor beside him, "electrum wire - not much use at the moment but it's always good to have spares - silver bullets, charms of protetion, crucifixes, stars of David-""Jesus," said Clary"I doubt he'd fit.""Jace." Clary was appalled.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这些船悬挂在天空中的方式与砖块悬挂的方式大致相同。”
quote_en:
“The ships hung in the sky in much the same way that bricks don't.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “但谁不敢抓住刺，谁就永远不会渴望玫瑰。”
quote_en:
“But he who dares not grasp the thorn Should never crave the rose.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有人确切地知道它们对其他人的生活有多大的影响。通常，我们不知道。但我们仍然在努力。”
quote_en:
“No one knows for certain how much impact they have on the lives of other people. Oftentimes, we have no clue. Yet we push it just the same.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “慈悲是道德的基础。”
quote_en:
“Compassion is the basis of morality.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当心说话时，头脑会觉得反对是不雅的。”
quote_en:
“When the heart speaks, the mind finds it indecent to object.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “无论我们失去什么（比如一个你或一个我），我们总能在海里找到我们自己。”
quote_en:
“For whatever we lose (like a you or a me),It's always our self we find in the sea.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “知道的人不说话。说话的人不知道。”
quote_en:
“Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要等到隧道尽头出现灯光，大步走到那里，自己点燃那该死的东西。”
quote_en:
“Don't wait for a light to appear at the end of the tunnel, stride down there and light the bloody thing yourself.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我本可以有另一种生活，但我现在有了这种生活。”
quote_en:
“There was another life that I might have had, but I am having this one.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在某种程度上，很高兴知道有希腊神在那里，因为当事情出错时，你会有人责怪你。例如，当你从一辆刚刚被怪物袭击并被闪电炸毁的公共汽车上走下来时，除了其他一切，外面还在下雨，大多数人可能会认为这真的很倒霉；当你是混血儿时，你就会明白一些邪恶的力量真的在试图扰乱你的一天。”
quote_en:
“In a way, it's nice to know that there are Greek gods out there, because you have somebody to blame when things go wrong. For instance, when you're walking away from a bus that's just been attacked by monster hags and blown up by lightning, and it's raining on top of everything else, most people might think that's just really bad luck; when you're a half-blood, you understand that some devine force is really trying to mess up your day.”
    
  ―

“One thing you can't hide - is when you're crippled inside.”
    
  ―

“You're alive only once, as far as we know, and what could be worse than getting to the end of your life and realizing you hadn't lived it?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我现在明白了，虽然那些谈论自己痛苦的人通常会受伤，但那些保持沉默的人会更受伤。”
quote_en:
“I have learned now that while those who speak about one's miseries usually hurt, those who keep silence hurt more.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我的图书馆是一个充满渴望的档案馆。”
quote_en:
“My library is an archive of longings.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “沉默是上帝的语言，其他一切都是糟糕的翻译。”
quote_en:
“silence is the language of god, all else is poor translation.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “爱是没有评判。”
quote_en:
“Love is the absence of judgment.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你拥有别人的……身体。”他点头接受了这一说法。“你想拥有我的身体吗？”“我想对你的身体做很多事情，但这不是其中之一。”
quote_en:
“You possess other people's...bodies."He accepted that statement with a nod."Do you want to possess my body?""I want to do a lot of things to your body, but that's not one of them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “告诉我，我会忘记；教我，我可能会记住；让我参与，我会学习。”
quote_en:
“Tell me and I forget, teach me and I may remember, involve me and I learn.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我希望我能再次成为一个女孩，半野蛮、坚韧、自由。”
quote_en:
“I wish I were a girl again, half-savage and hardy, and free.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “永远做正确的事。这会让一半的人满意，让另一半人震惊。”
quote_en:
“Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不需要你，你这个白痴。我选择了你。然后你又选择了我。”
quote_en:
“I didn’t need you, you idiot. I picked you. And then you picked me back.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我的恩惠如海般无边无际，我的爱如大海般深沉；我给你的越多，我拥有的就越多，因为两者都是无限的。”
quote_en:
“My bounty is as boundless as the sea,My love as deep; the more I give to thee,The more I have, for both are infinite.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想见你。知道你的声音。当你第一次转过街角时认出你。当我走进你刚刚离开的房间时，感觉到你的气味。知道你脚跟的抬起，脚的滑动。熟悉你包嘴唇的方式，然后当我靠在你的空间里吻你时，让它们稍微分开。我想知道你轻声细语“更多”的快乐。”
quote_en:
“I want to see you.Know your voice.Recognize you when youfirst come 'round the corner.Sense your scent when I come into a room you've just left.Know the lift of your heel,the glide of your foot.Become familiar with the way you purse your lipsthen let them part, just the slightest bit,when I lean in to your spaceand kiss you.I want to know the joy of how you whisper "more”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在随后的沉默中，我知道这里可能会发生任何事情。这可能太晚了：我可能又错过了机会。但我至少知道我试过了，我鼓起勇气伸出了手，不管结果如何。”好吧，他说。他吸了一口气。“如果你能做点什么，你会怎么做？”我朝他走了一步，把我们之间的空间关上。“这个，”我说。然后我吻了他。”
quote_en:
“I knew, in the silence that followed, that anything could happen here. It might be too late: again, I might have missed my chance. But I would at least know I tried, that I took my heart and extended my hand, whatever the outcome."Okay," he said. He took a breath. "What would you do, if you could do anything?"I took a step toward him, closing the space between us. "This," I said. And then I kissed him.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “最好的幻想是用梦的语言写成的。它就像梦一样活着，比现实更真实……至少在一瞬间……我们醒来前的那个漫长的魔法时刻。幻想是银色和猩红色、靛蓝色和天蓝色，黑曜石上镶嵌着金色和青金石。现实是胶合板和塑料，用泥棕色和橄榄色装饰。幻想有哈瓦那辣椒和蜂蜜、肉桂和丁香、稀有红肉和夏天一样甜的葡萄酒的味道。现实是豆子和豆腐，最后是灰烬。现实是伯班克的条形购物中心、克利夫兰的烟囱、纽瓦克的一个停车场。幻想是米纳斯提力斯的塔楼、戈尔斯的古老石头。蒙赫斯特，卡米洛特的大厅。幻想在伊卡洛斯的翅膀上飞翔，现实在西南航空公司。为什么我们的梦想最终成真时变得如此之小？我想，我们阅读幻想是为了再次找到颜色。品尝浓郁的香料，聆听海妖的歌声。幻想中有一种古老而真实的东西，它诉说着我们内心深处的东西，诉说着一个孩子，他梦想着有一天能在黑夜的森林里狩猎，在空心山下盛宴，在奥兹国以南、香格里拉以北的某个地方找到一份永恒的爱。他们可以保住自己的天堂。当我死的时候，我宁愿去中土世界。”
quote_en:
“The best fantasy is written in the language of dreams. It is alive as dreams are alive, more real than real ... for a moment at least ... that long magic moment before we wake. Fantasy is silver and scarlet, indigo and azure, obsidian veined with gold and lapis lazuli. Reality is plywood and plastic, done up in mud brown and olive drab. Fantasy tastes of habaneros and honey, cinnamon and cloves, rare red meat and wines as sweet as summer. Reality is beans and tofu, and ashes at the end. Reality is the strip malls of Burbank, the smokestacks of Cleveland, a parking garage in Newark. Fantasy is the towers of Minas Tirith, the ancient stones of Gormenghast, the halls of Camelot. Fantasy flies on the wings of Icarus, reality on Southwest Airlines. Why do our dreams become so much smaller when they finally come true? We read fantasy to find the colors again, I think. To taste strong spices and hear the songs the sirens sang. There is something old and true in fantasy that speaks to something deep within us, to the child who dreamt that one day he would hunt the forests of the night, and feast beneath the hollow hills, and find a love to last forever somewhere south of Oz and north of Shangri-La. They can keep their heaven. When I die, I'd sooner go to middle Earth.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你的敌人犯错时，永远不要打断他。”
quote_en:
“Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我无法让你理解。我无法让任何人理解我内心发生的事情。我甚至无法向自己解释。”
quote_en:
“I cannot make you understand. I cannot make anyone understand what is happening inside me. I cannot even explain it to myself.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们永远不能评判别人的生活，因为每个人只知道自己的痛苦和放弃。觉得自己走在正确的道路上是一回事，但认为自己的道路是唯一的道路是另一回事。”
quote_en:
“We can never judge the lives of others, because each person knows only their own pain and renunciation. It's one thing to feel that you are on the right path, but it's another to think that yours is the only path.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “图书馆里住着晚上从书页里出来的灵魂。”
quote_en:
“The library is inhabited by spirits that come out of the pages at night.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们的记忆是一个比宇宙更完美的世界：它把生命还给了那些不存在的人。”
quote_en:
“Our memory is a more perfect world than the universe: it gives back life to those who no longer exist.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有些事情你不能分享而不喜欢对方，击倒一个12英尺高的山巨魔就是其中之一。”
quote_en:
“There are some things you can't share without ending up liking each other, and knocking out a twelve-foot mountain troll is one of them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “年轻人不知道年龄的想法和感受。但如果老年人忘记了年轻时的感觉，他们就会感到内疚。”
quote_en:
“Youth can not know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “虽然我的灵魂可能会陷入黑暗，但它会在完美的光中升起；我太爱星星了，不害怕黑夜。”
quote_en:
“Though my soul may set in darkness, it will rise in perfect light; I have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “保持微笑，因为生活是美好的，有太多值得微笑的事情。”
quote_en:
“Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “十四行诗十八首不爱你，就好像你是盐玫瑰、黄玉或火中射出的康乃馨之箭。我爱你，就像在阴影和灵魂之间秘密地爱着某些黑暗的东西。我爱着你，就像永远不会开花的植物，但它本身却带着隐藏的花朵的光芒；由于你的爱，一种从地上升起的固体香味，在我体内黑暗地生活着。我不知道如何、何时或从哪里爱你。我直截了当地爱你，没有复杂性或骄傲；所以我爱你是因为我只知道这样：在我不存在的地方，你也不存在，离我如此之近，以至于你放在我胸前的手就是我的。手，闭上，我睡着的时候，你的眼睛也闭上。”
quote_en:
“Sonnet XVIII do not love you as if you were salt-rose, or topaz,or the arrow of carnations the fire shoots off.I love you as certain dark things are to be loved,in secret, between the shadow and the soul.I love you as the plant that never bloomsbut carries in itself the light of hidden flowers;thanks to your love a certain solid fragrance,risen from the earth, lives darkly in my body.I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where.I love you straightforwardly, without complexities or pride;so I love you because I know no other way than this: where I does not exist, nor you,so close that your hand on my chest is my hand,so close that your eyes close as I fall asleep. ”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “艺术使我们能够找到自己，同时失去自己。”
quote_en:
“Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “成功会让很多人讨厌你。我希望不是这样。如果能享受成功而不看到周围人的嫉妒，那就太棒了。”
quote_en:
“Success makes so many people hate you. I wish it wasn't that way. It would be wonderful to enjoy success without seeing envy in the eyes of those around you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你必须知道你支持什么，而不仅仅是你反对什么。”
quote_en:
“You have to know what you stand for, not just what you stand against.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果我不那么爱你，我也许可以多谈谈这件事。”
quote_en:
“If I loved you less, I might be able to talk about it more.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “为了你爱的人做你讨厌的事情是伟大的。”
quote_en:
“There is greatness in doing something you hate for the sake of someone you love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我没有什么可失去的时候，我拥有了一切。当我不再是现在的我时，我找到了自己。”
quote_en:
“When I had nothing to lose, I had everything. When I stopped being who I am, I found myself.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “正是我们无法回答的问题教会了我们最多。它们教会了我们如何思考。如果你给一个人一个答案，他得到的只是一个小事实。但给他一个问题，他会寻找自己的答案。”
quote_en:
“It's the questions we can't answer that teach us the most. They teach us how to think. If you give a man an answer, all he gains is a little fact. But give him a question and he'll look for his own answers.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “女人的美丽不在于她穿的衣服、身材或梳头的方式。女人的美丽在于她的眼睛，因为那是通往她心灵的大门，是爱居住的地方。女人的真正美丽反映在她的灵魂中。这是她充满爱意地给予的关怀，她表现出的激情，女人的美丽只会随着岁月的流逝而增长。”
quote_en:
“The beauty of a woman is not in the clothes she wears, the figure that she carries, or the way she combs her hair. The beauty of a woman is seen in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides. True beauty in a woman is reflected in her soul. It's the caring that she lovingly gives, the passion that she shows & the beauty of a woman only grows with passing years.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想要一个完美的结局。现在我终于明白了，有些诗不押韵，有些故事没有明确的开头、中间和结尾。”
quote_en:
“I wanted a perfect ending. Now I've learned, the hard way, that some poems don't rhyme, and some stories don't have a clear beginning, middle, and end.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “然后我意识到那是什么。是他。他身上的某种特质让我觉得自己快要摔倒了。或者变成液体。或者突然着火。”
quote_en:
“Then I realize what it is. It's him. Something about him makes me feel like I am about to fall. Or turn to liquid. Or burst into flames.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我可能不确定我真正感兴趣的是什么，但我绝对确定什么不是。”
quote_en:
“I may not have been sure about what really did interest me, but I was absolutely sure about what didn't.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你以为我的第一本能是保护你。因为你很小，或者是个女孩，或者是一个僵硬的人。但你错了。”他把脸靠在我的脸上，用手指搂着我的下巴。他的手闻起来像金属。他上一次拿枪或刀是什么时候？我的皮肤在接触点会刺痛，就像他在通过皮肤传输电流一样。“我的本能是推你直到你断了，看看我有多用力。”他说，手指在挤压这个词。他的声音让我的身体绷紧了，所以我像弹簧一样紧绷，我忘了呼吸。我的，他补充道，“但我抗拒它。”“为什么……”我咽得很厉害。“为什么这是你的第一本能？”“恐惧不会让你闭嘴；它会把你吵醒。我见过它。它很迷人。”他放开我，但没有抽离，他的手抚摸着我的下巴和脖子。“有时候我只是想再看一次。想看到你醒过来。”
quote_en:
“You think my first instinct is to protect you. Because you're small, or a girl, or a Stiff. But you're wrong."He leans his face close to mine and wraps his fingers around my chin. His hand smells like metal. When was the last time he held a gun, or a knife? My skin tingles at the point of contact, like he's transmitting electricity through his skin. "My  instinct is to push you until you break, just to see how hard I have to press." he says, his fingers squeezing at the word . My body tenses at the edge in his voice, so I am coiled as tight as a spring, and I forget to breathe.His dark eyes lifting to mine, he adds, "But I resist it." "Why..." I swallow hard. "Why is that your first instinct?""Fear doesn't shut you down; it wakes you up. I've seen it. It's fascinating." He releases me but doesn't pull away, his hand grazing my jaw, my neck. "Sometimes I just want to see it again. Want to see you awake.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我必须学会满足于比我应得的更快乐。”
quote_en:
“I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “自信就是无知。如果你感到骄傲，那是因为有些事情你不知道。”
quote_en:
“Confidence is ignorance. If you're feeling cocky, it's because there's something you don't know.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你可以拥有一切。只是不能一下子全部拥有。”
quote_en:
“You can have it all. Just not all at once.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “沉默是朋友之间真正的对话。重要的不是说什么，而是从不需要说什么。”
quote_en:
“Silence make the real conversations between friends. Not the saying, but the never needing to say that counts.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “所以当月亮只半满的时候，你只会觉得有点狼吗？”“你可以这么说。”“好吧，如果你想的话，你可以把头伸出车窗。”“我是狼人，不是金毛猎犬。”
quote_en:
“So when the moon's only partly full, you only feel a little wolfy?" "You could say that.""Well, you can go ahead and hang your head out the car window if you feel like it.""I'm a werewolf, not a golden retriever.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “那些可以放弃基本自由来获得一点暂时安全的人，既不值得自由，也不值得安全。”
quote_en:
“They who can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “只有一种罪，那就是偷窃……当你撒谎时，你偷走了别人了解真相的权利。”
quote_en:
“There is only one sin. and that is theft... when you tell a lie, you steal someones right to the truth.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在个人中，精神错乱是罕见的；但在团体、政党、国家和时代中，这是规则。”
quote_en:
“In individuals, insanity is rare; but in groups, parties, nations and epochs, it is the rule.”
    
  ―

“We didn't talk about anything heavy or light. We were just there together. And that was enough”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在毁灭的时代，创造一些东西。”
quote_en:
“In a time of destruction, create something.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “难道没有办法摆脱头脑吗？”
quote_en:
“Is there no way out of the mind?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我敢打赌，有时候你可以在某人的手中找到宇宙的所有奥秘。”
quote_en:
“I bet you could sometimes find all the mysteries of the universe in someone's hand.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我会记得我们的嘴唇因爱而生的吻，你如何给了我你所拥有的一切，我如何给了你我剩下的东西，我会记得你的小房间——你的感觉——窗户里的光——你的记录——你的书——我们的早晨咖啡——我们的中午——我们的夜晚——我们的身体一起洒在一起——睡在流动的小溪里——立即永远——你的腿——我的腿——你的手臂——你的微笑和你的温暖，让我再次大笑。”
quote_en:
“I will remember the kisses our lips raw with love and how you gave me everything you had and how I offered you what was left of me, and I will remember your small room the feel of you the light in the window your records your books our morning coffee our noons our nights our bodies spilled together sleeping the tiny flowing currents immediate and forever your leg my leg your arm my arm your smile and the warmth of you who made me laugh again.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个孩子可以教会一个成年人三件事：无缘无故地快乐，总是忙于某事，知道如何尽全力去要求他想要的东西。”
quote_en:
“A child can teach an adult three things: to be happy for no reason, to always be busy with something, and to know how to demand with all his might that which he desires.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “生活不是在暴风雨中找到避难所。而是学会在雨中跳舞。”
quote_en:
“Life isn't finding shelter in the storm. It's about learning to dance in the rain.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “万物皆有美，但不是每个人都能看到。”
quote_en:
“Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.”
    
  ―

“A girl should be two things: who and what she wants.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有一颗永不硬化的心，一个永不疲倦的脾气，一个永远不会受伤的触碰。”
quote_en:
“Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.”
    
  ―

“I'm saying that I'm a moody, insecure, narrow-minded, jealous, borderline homicidal bitch, and I want you to promise me that you're okay with that, because it's who I am, and you're what I need.”
    
  ―

“The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “勇气是对恐惧的抵抗，对恐惧的掌握，而不是没有恐惧。”
quote_en:
“Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “永远不要忘记你是什么，因为世界肯定不会忘记你。让它成为你的力量。这样它就永远不会成为你的弱点。”
quote_en:
“Never forget what you are, for surely the world will not. Make it your strength. Then it can never be your weakness.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “و كلما أمسكت بحالة من حالاتي و قلت هذا هو أنا .. ما تلبث هذه الحالة أن تفلت من أصابعي و تحل محلها حالة أخرى .. هي أنا .. أيضاً..”
quote_en:
“و كلما أمسكت بحالة من حالاتي و قلت هذا هو أنا .. ما تلبث هذه الحالة أن تفلت من أصابعي و تحل محلها حالة أخرى .. هي أنا .. أيضاً..”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想，燃烧得如此明亮的火是不会持久的。”
quote_en:
“I suppose a fire that burns that bright is not meant to last.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “洛丽塔，我的生命之光，我的腰之火。我的罪，我的灵魂。Lo-lee-ta：舌尖从上颚往下走了三步，在三点时敲击牙齿。Lo.lee-ta。她是Lo，普通的Lo，早上，穿着一只袜子站着四英尺十英寸。她是穿着休闲裤的Lola。她是学校里的Dolly。她是虚线上的Dolores。但在我怀里，她一直是Lolita。她有先兆吗？她有，确实有。事实上，如果我没有在一个夏天爱上一个最初的女孩，可能根本就没有Lolita了。”海边的公主国。哦，什么时候？大约在洛丽塔出生前几年，我的年龄就是那个夏天。你总是可以指望一个杀人犯有一种奇特的散文风格。陪审团的女士们、先生们，第一件展品是六翼天使们所羡慕的，那些被误导的、简单的、高贵的、有翅膀的六翼天使。看看这纠结的荆棘。”
quote_en:
“Lolita, light of my life, fire of my loins. My sin, my soul. Lo-lee-ta: the tip of the tongue taking a trip of three steps down the palate to tap, at three, on the teeth. Lo. Lee. Ta. She was Lo, plain Lo, in the morning, standing four feet ten in one sock. She was Lola in slacks. She was Dolly at school. She was Dolores on the dotted line. But in my arms she was always Lolita. Did she have a precursor? She did, indeed she did. In point of fact, there might have been no Lolita at all had I not loved, one summer, an initial girl-child. In a princedom by the sea. Oh when? About as many years before Lolita was born as my age was that summer. You can always count on a murderer for a fancy prose style. Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, exhibit number one is what the seraphs, the misinformed, simple, noble-winged seraphs, envied. Look at this tangle of thorns.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “养狗的人会注意到，如果你给它们提供食物、水、住所和感情，它们会认为你是上帝。而养猫的人则不得不意识到，如果给它们提供了食物、水和住所以及感情，它们就会得出上帝的结论。”
quote_en:
“Owners of dogs will have noticed that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they will think you are god. Whereas owners of cats are compelled to realize that, if you provide them with food and water and shelter and affection, they draw the conclusion that  are gods.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “引语是机智的有用替代品。”
quote_en:
“Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “记住，人会变，但过去不会。”
quote_en:
“Keep in mind that people change, but the past doesn't.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不认为，先生，你有任何权利命令我，仅仅因为你比我大，或者因为你看的世界比我多；你声称的优越感取决于你对时间和经验的利用。”
quote_en:
“I do not think, sir, you have any right to command me, merely because you are older than I, or because you have seen more of the world than I have; your claim to superiority depends on the use you have made of your time and experience.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “继续你的心告诉你，否则你会失去一切。”
quote_en:
“Go on with what your heart tells you, or you will lose all.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一本闲置在书架上的书是浪费的弹药。”
quote_en:
“A book lying idle on a shelf is wasted ammunition.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “失去的机会，失去的可能性，我们再也回不来的感觉。这是活着的一部分意义。但在我们的脑海里——至少我是这么想的——有一个小房间可以储存这些记忆。一个像这个图书馆的书架一样的房间。为了了解我们自己内心的运作，我们必须不断制作新的参考卡。我们必须每隔一段时间把东西掸掉，让新鲜空气进来，换花瓶里的水。换句话说，你将永远生活在自己的私人图书馆里。”
quote_en:
“Lost opportunities, lost possibilities, feelings we can never get back. That's part of what it means to be alive. But inside our heads - at least that's where I imagine it - there's a little room where we store those memories. A room like the stacks in this library. And to understand the workings of our own heart we have to keep on making new reference cards. We have to dust things off every once in awhile, let in fresh air, change the water in the flower vases. In other words, you'll live forever in your own private library.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “每次你对某人微笑，都是一种爱的行为，是送给那个人的礼物，一件美好的事情。”
quote_en:
“Every time you smile at someone, it is an action of love, a gift to that person, a beautiful thing.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “世界上没有什么是完全错误的。即使是一个停止的时钟，每天也有两次是正确的。”
quote_en:
“Nothing in the world is ever completely wrong. Even a stopped clock is right twice a day.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “书籍是文明的载体……它们是心灵宝藏的伴侣、老师、魔术师和银行家。书籍是印刷品中的人性。”
quote_en:
“Books are the carriers of civilization...They are companions, teachers, magicians, bankers of the treasures of the mind. Books are humanity in print.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在爱情中，我们只需要练习这一点：放手。因为坚持很容易；我们不需要学习。”
quote_en:
“We need, in love, to practice only this: letting each other go. For holding on comes easily; we do not need to learn it.”
    
  ―

“Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你朋友的诗很糟糕，”他说。Clary眨了眨眼，一时措手不及。“什么？”“我说他的诗很糟糕。听起来他好像吃了字典，开始随意吐单词。”
quote_en:
“Your friend's poetry is terrible," he said.Clary blinked, caught momentarily off guard. "What?""I said his poetry was terrible. It sounds like he ate a dictionary and started vomiting up words at random.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有人告诉初学者这一点，我希望有人告诉我。我们所有从事创意工作的人，我们之所以从事这项工作，是因为我们有很好的品味。但存在着这种差距。在最初的几年里，你做的东西并不那么好。它试图做得很好，它有潜力，但事实并非如此。但你的品味，让你进入游戏的东西，仍然是致命的。你的品味是你的工作让你失望的原因。很多人从来没有经历过这一阶段，他们就放弃了。我认识的大多数从事有趣、有创意的工作的人都经历了多年。我们知道我们的工作没有我们想要的特殊东西。我们所有这些都要经历。如果你刚开始，或者你还处于这个阶段，你必须知道这是正常的，你能做的最重要的事情就是做很多工作。给自己一个截止日期，这样每周你都会完成一个故事。只有通过大量的工作，你才能缩小差距，你的工作会和你的抱负一样好。我花了比我见过的任何人都长的时间才弄清楚如何做到这一点。这需要一段时间。花点时间是正常的。你只需奋力前行。”
quote_en:
“Nobody tells this to people who are beginners, I wish someone told me. All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it’s just not that good. It’s trying to be good, it has potential, but it’s not. But your taste, the thing that got you into the game, is still killer. And your taste is why your work disappoints you. A lot of people never get past this phase, they quit. Most people I know who do interesting, creative work went through years of this. We know our work doesn’t have this special thing that we want it to have. We all go through this. And if you are just starting out or you are still in this phase, you gotta know its normal and the most important thing you can do is do a lot of work. Put yourself on a deadline so that every week you will finish one story. It is only by going through a volume of work that you will close that gap, and your work will be as good as your ambitions. And I took longer to figure out how to do this than anyone I’ve ever met. It’s gonna take awhile. It’s normal to take awhile. You’ve just gotta fight your way through.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “أحسد الأطفال الرضّع، لأنهم يملكون وحدهم حق الصراخ والقدرة عليه، قبل أن تروض الحياة حبالهم الصوتية، وتعلِّمهم الصمت”
quote_en:
“أحسد الأطفال الرضّع، لأنهم يملكون وحدهم حق الصراخ والقدرة عليه، قبل أن تروض الحياة حبالهم الصوتية، وتعلِّمهم الصمت”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一本读了一半的书就是一段半途而废的爱情。”
quote_en:
“A half-read book is a half-finished love affair.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当有人尊重你时，你永远不应该感到惊讶，你应该预料到这一点。”
quote_en:
“You should never be surprised when someone treats you with respect, you should expect it.”
    
  ―

“Change will not come if we wait for some other person, or if we wait for some other time. We are the ones we've been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有证据就可以断言的，可以在没有证据的情况下被驳回。”
quote_en:
“That which can be asserted without evidence, can be dismissed without evidence.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “真是太好了——什么都感觉不到，但仍然因为活着而获得全部荣誉。”
quote_en:
“How nice -- to feel nothing, and still get full credit for being alive.”
    
  ―

“The glory of friendship is not the outstretched hand, not the kindly smile, nor the joy of companionship; it is the spiritual inspiration that comes to one when you discover that someone else believes in you and is willing to trust you with a friendship.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “脸上的雪球无疑是持久友谊的完美开始。”
quote_en:
“A snowball in the face is surely the perfect beginning to a lasting friendship.”
    
  ―

“Must you go? I was rather hoping you'd stay and be a ministering angel, but if you must go, you must.""I'll stay," Will said a bit crossly, and threw himself down in the armchair Tessa had just vacated. "I can minister angelically.""None too convincingly. And you're not as pretty to look at as Tessa is," Jem said, closing his eyes as he leaned back against the pillow."How rude. Many who have gazed upon me have compared the experience to gazing at the radiance of the sun."Jem still had his eyes closed. "If they mean it gives you a headache, they aren't wrong.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你们很多人都很关心，只是还不够。”
quote_en:
“A lot of you cared, just not enough.”
    
  ―

“If you end up with a boring miserable life because you listened to your mom, your dad, your teacher, your priest, or some guy on television telling you how to do your shit, then you deserve it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “机智是指以一种他们期待这次旅行的方式告诉某人去地狱的能力。”
quote_en:
“Tact is the ability to tell someone to go to hell in such a way that they look forward to the trip.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你不尝试一些事情，生活有什么好处？”
quote_en:
“What's the good of living if you don't try a few things?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “仅仅因为你偏执，并不意味着他们没有在追你。”
quote_en:
