“Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean they aren't after you.”
    
  ―

“Dreams like a podcast,Downloading truth in my ears.They tell me cool stuff.""Apollo?" I guess, because I figured nobody else could make a haiku that bad.He put his finger to his lips. "I'm incognito. Call me Fred.""A god named Fred?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “梦想确实会成真，只要我们足够努力。如果你愿意为它牺牲一切，你就可以拥有生活中的任何东西。”
quote_en:
“Dreams do come true, if only we wish hard enough. You can have anything in life if you will sacrifice everything else for it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你找到自己的道路时，你不能害怕。你需要有足够的勇气犯错。失望、失败和绝望是上帝用来给我们指明道路的工具。”
quote_en:
“When you find your path, you must not be afraid. You need to have sufficient courage to make mistakes. Disappointment, defeat, and despair are the tools God uses to show us the way.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “学会珍惜自己，这意味着：为你的幸福而战。”
quote_en:
“Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “老年人宣战。但必须战斗和死亡的是年轻人。”
quote_en:
“Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.”
    
  ―

“When I get lonely these days, I think: So BE lonely, Liz. Learn your way around loneliness. Make a map of it. Sit with it, for once in your life. Welcome to the human experience. But never again use another person's body or emotions as a scratching post for your own unfulfilled yearnings.”
    
  ―

“If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一切都在眼前。这也是我所说的永远。对我们中的任何一个人来说，我们的永远都可能在一个小时或一百年后结束。你永远无法确定，所以你最好珍惜每一秒。”
quote_en:
“It's all in the view. That's what I mean about forever, too. For any one of us our forever could end in an hour, or a hundred years from now. You never know for sure, so you'd better make every second count.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “把自己暴露在最深的恐惧中；在那之后，恐惧就没有力量了，对自由的恐惧会缩小并消失。你是自由的。”
quote_en:
“Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有爱的地方，往往也有恨。它们可以并存。”
quote_en:
“Where there is love, there is often also hate. They can exist side by side.”
    
  ―

“Every book, every volume you see here, has a soul. The soul of the person who wrote it and of those who read it and lived and dreamed with it. Every time a book changes hands, every time someone runs his eyes down its pages, its spirit grows and strengthens.”
    
  ―

“Trust is like a mirror, you can fix it if it's broken, but you can still see the crack in that mother fucker's reflection.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我只是让他们把恶魔学教科书中的条目从‘几乎灭绝’改为‘亚历克还不够灭绝。他更喜欢他的怪物真的、真的灭绝了。’这会让你高兴吗？”
quote_en:
“I'll just have them change the entry in the demonology textbook from 'almost extinct' to 'not extinct enough for Alec. He prefers his monsters really, really extinct.' Will that make you happy?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不知道爱情会改变。人会改变。环境会改变。”
quote_en:
“I don't know that love changes. People change. Circumstances change.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “所以，请，哦，请，我们恳求，我们祈祷，把你的电视机扔掉，你可以在墙上安装一个可爱的书架。”
quote_en:
“So please, oh please, we beg, we pray, go throw your TV set away, and in its place you can install, a lovely bookshelf on the wall.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “但星星的本质是交叉的，莎士比亚的错误从来没有比卡西乌斯注意到的更大，亲爱的布鲁图斯，错误不在于我们的星星，而在于我们自己。”
quote_en:
“But it is the nature of stars to cross, and never was Shakespeare more wrong than when he has Cassius note, ‘The fault, dear Brutus, is not in our stars / But in ourselves.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要花时间敲打墙壁，希望把它变成一扇门。”
quote_en:
“Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door. ”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “无神论太简单了。如果整个宇宙没有意义，我们就永远不会发现它没有意义……”
quote_en:
“Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning...”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “时间不能治愈情感上的痛苦，你需要学会如何放手。”
quote_en:
“Time doesn’t heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这样，心会碎，但会破碎地活着。”
quote_en:
“And thus the heart will break, yet brokenly live on.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “独自一人！不管你喜欢与否，独自一人都是一件很重要的事情！”
quote_en:
“All alone! Whether you like it or not, alone is something you'll be quite a lot!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “世界确实很滑稽，但笑话是关于人类的。”
quote_en:
“The world is indeed comic, but the joke is on mankind.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我的名字叫Celaena Sardothien。但无论我的名字是Celaena、Lillian还是Bitch，都没什么区别，因为无论你叫我什么，我都会打败你。”
quote_en:
“My name is Celaena Sardothien. But it makes no difference if my name's Celaena or Lillian or Bitch, because I'd still beat you, no matter what you call me.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “上帝不能给我们和平与幸福，因为没有这样的东西。”
quote_en:
“God can't give us peace and happiness apart from Himself because there is no such thing.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “事实就是我所创造的。我可以点燃这个世界，然后称之为雨。”
quote_en:
“The truth is what I make it. I could set this world on fire and call it rain.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “善良是一种聋哑人能听见、盲人能看见的语言。”
quote_en:
“Kindness is a language which the deaf can hear and the blind can see.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们会在一起，”他承诺道。“你不会离开我的。再也不会了。”
quote_en:
“We're staying together," he promised. "You're not getting away from me. Never again.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “家庭是混乱的。不朽的家庭是永远混乱的。有时我们能做的最好的事情就是提醒彼此，无论好坏，我们都是有关系的……并尽量减少致残和杀戮。”
quote_en:
“Families are messy. Immortal families are eternally messy. Sometimes the best we can do is to remind each other that we're related for better or for worse...and try to keep the maiming and killing to a minimum.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有人比那些不承认错误的人更经常犯错。”
quote_en:
“No persons are more frequently wrong, than those who will not admit they are wrong.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “哭。原谅。学习。继续前进。让你的眼泪浇灌你未来幸福的种子。”
quote_en:
“Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有痛苦，就没有同情心。”
quote_en:
“Without suffering, there'd be no compassion.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “漂亮的脸。漂亮的身体。可怕的态度。这是辣妹的三位一体。”
quote_en:
“Beautiful face. Beautiful body. Horrible attitude. It was the holy trinity of hot boys.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “礼貌是漂亮包装中的欺骗。”
quote_en:
“Politeness is deception in pretty packaging.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你认识一个抑郁的人，请下定决心永远不要问他们为什么。抑郁不是对糟糕情况的直接反应；抑郁就像天气一样。试着理解他们正在经历的黑暗、嗜睡、绝望和孤独。当他们从另一边过来时，陪在他们身边。很难成为抑郁者的朋友，但这是你做过的最善良、最高尚、最好的事情之一。”
quote_en:
“If you know someone who’s depressed, please resolve never to ask them why. Depression isn’t a straightforward response to a bad situation; depression just is, like the weather.Try to understand the blackness, lethargy, hopelessness, and loneliness they’re going through. Be there for them when they come through the other side. It’s hard to be a friend to someone who’s depressed, but it is one of the kindest, noblest, and best things you will ever do.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果人们拒绝以新的眼光看待你，他们只能看到你的过去，只看到你犯的错误，如果他们没有意识到你不是你的错误，那么他们就必须离开。”
quote_en:
“If people refuse to look at you in a new light and they can only see you for what you were, only see you for the mistakes you've made, if they don't realize that you are not your mistakes, then they have to go.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果说生活教会了我们一个教训，那就是希望并不能让它成为现实。”
quote_en:
“If there's a single lesson that life teaches us, it's that wishing doesn't make it so.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果谈话是歌词，笑声是音乐，那么一起度过的时间就是一首旋律，可以一遍又一遍地重播而不会变得陈旧。”
quote_en:
“If conversation was the lyrics, laughter was the music, making time spent together a melody that could be replayed over and over without getting stale.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我一生中遇到的最悲伤的人是那些根本不关心任何事情的人。激情和满足是相辅相成的，没有它们，任何幸福都是暂时的，因为没有什么能让它持续下去。”
quote_en:
“The saddest people I've ever met in life are the ones who don't care deeply about anything at all. Passion and satisfaction go hand in hand, and without them, any happiness is only temporary, because there's nothing to make it last.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “所有的父母都会伤害他们的孩子。这是无法避免的。青春就像原始的玻璃，会吸收处理者的印记。有些父母会弄脏孩子，有些会破裂，有些会把孩子的童年完全摔成无法修复的锯齿状碎片。”
quote_en:
“All parents damage their children. It cannot be helped. Youth, like pristine glass, absorbs the prints of its handlers. Some parents smudge, others crack, a few shatter childhoods completely into jagged little pieces, beyond repair.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “世界就是这样结束的，不是砰的一声，而是呜咽。”
quote_en:
“This is the way the world endsNot with a bang but a whimper.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “用你内心的呼吸填满你的纸。”
quote_en:
“Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “忧虑永远不会夺走明天的悲伤，只会消耗今天的力量。”
quote_en:
“Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow, but only saps today of its strength.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要害怕；我们的命运不能从我们身上夺走；这是一份礼物。”
quote_en:
“Do not be afraid; our fateCannot be taken from us; it is a gift.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个字接一个字就是力量。”
quote_en:
“A word after a word after a word is power.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “让我们的伤痕坠入爱河。”
quote_en:
“Let our scars fall in love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “性感不仅仅是尺寸。我不需要卧室来证明我的女人味。我可以传达同样多的性感，从树上摘苹果或站在雨中。”
quote_en:
“There is more to sex appeal than just measurements. I don't need a bedroom to prove my womanliness. I can convey just as much sex appeal, picking apples off a tree or standing in the rain.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “书不是为了让人相信，而是为了让人去探究。当我们思考一本书时，我们不能问自己它说了什么，而是它意味着什么……”
quote_en:
“Books are not made to be believed, but to be subjected to inquiry. When we consider a book, we mustn't ask ourselves what it says but what it means...”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这是一堂创意写作课。第一条规则：不要使用分号。它们是异装癖雌雄同体，绝对不代表任何东西。它们所做的只是表明你上过大学。”
quote_en:
“Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “知识最大的敌人不是无知，而是知识的幻觉。”
quote_en:
“The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it is the illusion of knowledge.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “读完一本新书后，千万不要让自己再读一本新书，直到你读了一本旧书。”
quote_en:
“It is a good rule after reading a new book, never to allow yourself another new one till you have read an old one in between.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “人们说时间能治愈一切创伤，但这是假设悲伤的根源是有限的。”
quote_en:
“They say time heals all wounds, but that presumes the source of the grief is finite”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这就是为什么当电影中的大坏蛋们互相问候时，他们什么也不说，他们只是点头。点头意味着，‘我’是个坏蛋，我认识到你也是个坏蛋，’但他们什么也没说，因为他们是金刚狼和万磁王，解释会破坏他们的氛围。”
quote_en:
“That's why when major badasses greet each other in movies, they don't say anything, they just nod. The nod means, 'I' am a badass, and I recognize that you, too, are a badass,' but they don't say anything because they're Wolverine and Magneto and it would mess up their vibe to explain.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想不整容就变老。我想有勇气忠于我做的脸。”
quote_en:
“I want to grow old without facelifts. I want to have the courage to be loyal to the face I have made.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我知道在你心中，我只是夏天，而不是一年四季。”
quote_en:
“I know I am but summer to your heart, and not the full four seasons of the year.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你不能阻止未来，你不能倒退过去。学习秘密的唯一方法……就是按下播放键。”
quote_en:
“You can't stop the futureYou can't rewind the pastThe only way to learn the secret...is to press play.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你想了解一个人到底是什么，就给他权力。任何人都能忍受逆境，只有伟人才能忍受繁荣。亚伯拉罕·林肯的荣耀在于，他从不滥用权力，只站在仁慈的一边。”
quote_en:
“If you want to find out what a man is to the bottom, give him power. Any man can stand adversity — only a great man can stand prosperity. It is the glory of Abraham Lincoln that he never abused power only on the side of mercy”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “被爱的人，谁是穷人？”
quote_en:
“Who, being loved, is poor?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我爱上了他。但我不会默认地和他在一起，就好像没有其他人可供我使用一样。我和他呆在一起是因为我选择了，每天醒来，每天我们吵架、撒谎或让对方失望。我一次又一次地选择他，他也选择了我。”
quote_en:
“I fell in love with him. But I don't just stay with him by default as if there's no one else available to me. I stay with him because I choose to, every day that I wake up, every day that we fight or lie to each other or disappoint each other. I choose him over and over again, and he chooses me.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “无论有多少天塌下来，我们都必须活下去。”
quote_en:
“We've got to live, no matter how many skies have fallen.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我还是个孩子的时候，成年人会告诉我不要编造，警告我如果我这样做会发生什么。据我所知，到目前为止，这似乎涉及很多国外旅行，不必早上起得太早。”
quote_en:
“When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “-”“你为什么不喜欢被触碰？”-“因为我有五十度的操蛋，阿纳斯塔西娅”
quote_en:
“- "Why don't you like to be touched?" - "Because I'm fifty shades of fucked-up, Anastasia”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你会知道真相，真相会让你发疯。”
quote_en:
“You shall know the truth and the truth shall make you mad.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要试图把生活变成一个数学问题，把自己放在中心，一切都是平等的。当你很好的时候，坏事仍然可能发生。如果你很坏，你仍然可以很幸运。”
quote_en:
“Don’t try to make life a mathematics problem with yourself in the center and everything coming out equal. When you’re good, bad things can still happen. And if you’re bad, you can still be lucky.”
    
  ―

“It was a mistake," you said. But the cruel thing was, it felt like the mistake was mine, for trusting you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “老实说，如果你再慢一点，你就会倒退。”
quote_en:
“Honestly, if you were any slower, you’d be going backward.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你想告诉我一个人的内心，不要告诉我他读了什么，而是告诉我他重读了什么。”
quote_en:
“If you would tell me the heart of a man, tell me not what he reads, but what he rereads.”
    
  ―

“A man who procrastinates in his choosing will inevitably have his choice made for him by circumstance.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “问题不在于为朋友而死，而在于找到一个值得为之而死的朋友。”
quote_en:
“The trouble is not in dying for a friend, but in finding a friend worth dying for.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “正如人们所说：爱和咳嗽是无法掩饰的。即使是轻微的咳嗽。即使是小小的爱。”
quote_en:
“As it has been said:Love and a coughcannot be concealed.Even a small cough.Even a small love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我竖起大拇指，有什么邪恶的东西从这边来了。”
quote_en:
“By the pricking of my thumbs, Something wicked this way comes.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们DNA中的氮、牙齿中的钙、血液中的铁、苹果派中的碳都是在坍缩恒星的内部形成的。我们是由恒星物质组成的。”
quote_en:
“The nitrogen in our DNA, the calcium in our teeth, the iron in our blood, the carbon in our apple pies were made in the interiors of collapsing stars. We are made of starstuff.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这不是我的行动，”Jace同意道。“先是糖果和鲜花，然后是道歉信，然后是贪婪的恶魔群。按这个顺序。”
quote_en:
“It wouldn't be my move," Jace agreed. "First the candy and flowers, then the apology letters, then the ravenous demon hordes. In that order.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “从来没有过，爱直到分离的时刻才知道自己的深度。”
quote_en:
“Ever has it been that love knows not its own depth until the hour of separation.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有人能为你建造一座桥，你必须在这座桥上渡过生命的洪流，除了你自己，没有人能。”
quote_en:
“No one can construct for you the bridge upon which precisely you must cross the stream of life, no one but you yourself alone.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你不是你的工作，你不是你在银行里有多少钱。你不是你开的车。你不是钱包里的东西。你不是他妈的卡其裤。你都在唱歌，都在跳舞，这是世界上的垃圾。”
quote_en:
“You are not your job, you're not how much money you have in the bank. You are not the car you drive. You're not the contents of your wallet. You are not your fucking khakis. You are all singing, all dancing crap of the world.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我是个商人，”他告诉她。“不多也不少。”“你是个小偷，卡兹。”“我刚才不是这么说的吗？”
quote_en:
“I'm a business man," he'd told her. "No more, no less.""You're a thief, Kaz.""Isn't that what I just said?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “非法移民在美国一直是个问题。问问任何印度人。”
quote_en:
“Illegal aliens have always been a problem in the United States. Ask any Indian.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “世界上没有什么比真诚的无知和认真的愚蠢更危险的了。”
quote_en:
“Nothing in the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你认为自己太小，无法有所作为，试着和蚊子一起睡觉。”
quote_en:
“If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “跟傻瓜讲道理，他会说你傻。”
quote_en:
“Talk sense to a fool and he calls you foolish.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我自由了，这就是我迷失的原因。”
quote_en:
“I am free and that is why I am lost.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我喝酒是为了让别人更有趣。”
quote_en:
“I drink to make other people more interesting.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你寻找的有益想法写在书的某个地方。”
quote_en:
“The helpful thought for which you lookIs written somewhere in a book.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “幸福就是把某人抱在怀里，知道你拥有整个世界。”
quote_en:
“Happiness is holding someone in your arms and knowing you hold the whole world.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们就像世界黎明时的神，我们的喜悦如此明亮，我们只能看到另一个。”
quote_en:
“We were like gods at the dawning of the world, & our joy was so bright we could see nothing else but the other.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们认为最值得我们感激的事情是理所当然的。”
quote_en:
“We take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “恐惧是你的感受。勇敢是你所做的。”
quote_en:
“Scared is what you're feeling. Brave is what you're doing.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果A是生活中的成功，那么A等于x加y加z。工作是x；y是玩耍；z是闭嘴。”
quote_en:
“If A is a success in life, then A equals x plus y plus z. Work is x; y is play; and z is keeping your mouth shut”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “主啊，原谅我对他们的小玩笑，我也会原谅你对我的大玩笑。”
quote_en:
“Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on TheeAnd I'll forgive Thy great big one on me.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “敞开心扉。有人会来的。有人来找你。但首先你必须敞开心扉。”
quote_en:
“Open your heart. Someone will come. Someone will come for you. But first you must open your heart.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要让自己妥协——你就是你所拥有的一切。”
quote_en:
“Don't compromise yourself - you're all you have.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “即使在未来，故事也从从前开始。”
quote_en:
“Even in the Future the Story Begins with Once Upon a Time.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “对你的未来了解太多从来都不是一件好事。”
quote_en:
“Knowing too much of your future is never a good thing.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 在老鼠和人类的所有话语中，最令人悲伤的是，“这可能是。”
quote_en:
“Of all the words of mice and men, the saddest are, "It might have been.”
    
  ―

“I want you always to remember me. Will you remember that I existed, and that I stood next to you here like this?”
    
  ―

“A house without books is like a room without windows.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “她发现，书籍是一种过上千种生活的方式，或者是在漫长的一生中寻找力量的方式。”
quote_en:
“Books, she has found, are a way to live a thousand lives--or to find strength in a very long one.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “无论你去哪里，都要全心全意地去。”
quote_en:
“Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “自由的灵魂是罕见的，但当你看到它时，你就会知道——基本上是因为当你靠近或和他们在一起时，你感觉很好，非常好。”
quote_en:
“the free soul is rare, but you know it when you see it - basically because you feel good, very good, when you are near or with them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “时间是两地之间最长的距离。”
quote_en:
“Time is the longest distance between two places.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想哭，但什么也没出来。这只是一种悲伤的疾病，病态的悲伤，当你感觉不到更糟的时候。我想你知道。我想每个人都知道。但我想我经常知道，太经常了。”
quote_en:
“I felt like crying but nothing came out. it was just a sort of sad sickness, sick sad, when you can't feel any worse. I think you know it. I think everybody knows it now and then. but I think I have known it pretty often, too often.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在你所在的地方做你的一点好事；正是这些小好事组合在一起，压倒了世界。”
quote_en:
“Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.”
    
  ―

“One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.”
    
  ―

“Are you implying that shreds of my reputation remain intact?" Will demanded with mock horror. "Clearly I have been doing something wrong. Or not something wrong, as the case may be." He banged on the side of the carriage. "Thomas! We must away at once to the nearest brothel. I seek scandal and low companionship.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “从那里到这里，从这里到那里，到处都是有趣的东西！”
quote_en:
“From there to here, from here to there, funny things are everywhere!”
    
  ―

“You see I usually find myself among strangers because I drift here and there trying to forget the sad things that happened to me.”
    
  ―

“No one has ever become poor by giving.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们的母亲总是我们见过的最奇怪、最疯狂的人。”
quote_en:
“Our mothers always remain the strangest, craziest people we've ever met.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “勇气存在于不太可能的地方。”
quote_en:
“Courage is found in unlikely places.”
    
  ―

“You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. In fact, it may be necessary to encounter the defeats, so you can know who you are, what you can rise from, how you can still come out of it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当人们说话时，要全神贯注地听。大多数人从不听。”
quote_en:
“When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “心灵一旦开悟，就不会再变得黑暗。”
quote_en:
“The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “即使没有阿斯兰来领导，我也站在阿斯兰一边。即使没有纳尼亚，我也要尽可能地像纳尼亚人一样生活。”
quote_en:
“I'm on Aslan's side even if there isn't any Aslan to lead it. I'm going to live as like a Narnian as I can even if there isn't any Narnia.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “人只喜欢计算自己的烦恼；他不计算自己的幸福。”
quote_en:
“Man only likes to count his troubles; he doesn't calculate his happiness.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “因为你不能和世界上所有的傻瓜争论。让他们为所欲为更容易，然后在他们不注意的时候欺骗他们。”
quote_en:
“Because you can't argue with all the fools in the world. It's easier to let them have their way, then trick them when they're not paying attention.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这就是粗心的话。它们会让人们对你的爱减少一点。”
quote_en:
“That's what careless words do. They make people love you a little less.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你真正看的时候，很多东西都会变得美丽。”
quote_en:
“So many things become beautiful when you really look.”
    
  ―

“Fear is a phoenix. You can watch it burn a thousand times and still it will return.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “他需要告诉她……什么？她可爱、勇敢，比他应得的任何东西都要好。他扭曲、弯曲、错误，但还没有崩溃到无法为她拼凑成一个男人的样子。他无意中开始依靠她，寻找她，需要她靠近。他需要感谢她的新帽子。”
quote_en:
“He needed to tell her...what? That she was lovely and brave and better than anything he deserved. That he was twisted, crooked, wrong, but not so broken that he couldn't pull himself together into some semblance of a man for her. That without meaning to, he'd begun to lean on her, to look for her, to need her near. He needed to thank her for his new hat.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “哭是普通女人的事。漂亮女人去购物。”
quote_en:
“Crying is for plain women. Pretty women go shopping.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想我会躺在地板上痛苦地扭动一会儿，”他咕哝道，“这让我放松。”“是吗？哦，你在讽刺。这可能是个好兆头。”
quote_en:
“I thought I'd lie on the floor and writhe in pain for a while," he grunted, "It relaxes me.""It does? Oh - you're being sarcastic. That's a good sign probably.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “爱可以改变一个人，就像父母可以改变一个婴儿一样——尴尬地，而且往往是一团糟。”
quote_en:
“Love can change a person the way a parent can change a baby- awkwardly, and often with a great deal of mess.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我关心的不是上帝是否站在我们一边；我最关心的是站在上帝一边，因为上帝永远是对的。”
quote_en:
“My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “每当你读到癌症小册子或网站或其他什么东西时，他们总是把抑郁症列为癌症的副作用之一。但事实上，抑郁症并不是癌症的副作用。抑郁症是死亡的副作用”
quote_en:
“Whenever you read a cancer booklet or website or whatever, they always list depression among the side effects of cancer. But, in fact, depression is not a side effect of cancer. Depression is a side effect of dying.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想那一刻我意识到我真的很爱她。因为没有什么可以得到的，这并不重要。”
quote_en:
“And I guess I realized at that moment that I really did love her. Because there was nothing to gain, and that didn't matter.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “她发现的还有一本书是如何一本接一本的，无论她走到哪里，门都会打开，日子不够她想读的书。”
quote_en:
“What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我的口味最简单。我总是对最好的感到满意。”
quote_en:
“I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们沉迷于我们的想法。如果我们不能改变我们的想法，我们就无法改变任何事情。”
quote_en:
“We are addicted to our thoughts. We cannot change anything if we cannot change our thinking.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “她拒绝无聊，主要是因为她不无聊。”
quote_en:
“She refused to be bored chiefly because she wasn't boring.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “因此，亲爱的先生，爱你的孤独，试着唱出它给你带来的痛苦。因为那些在你身边的人离你很远……这表明你周围的空间开始变得广阔……为你的成长感到高兴，当然你不能带任何人同行，对那些留下来的人要温柔；在他们面前要自信和冷静，不要用怀疑折磨他们，不要用你的信仰或快乐吓唬他们，他们无法理解。寻找一些简单而真实的感觉，了解你与他们的共同点，当你自己一次又一次地改变时，这不一定会改变；当你看到他们时，要以一种形式热爱生活这不是你自己的，对那些日渐衰老、害怕你所信任的孤独的人要宽容……不要指望任何理解；但要相信一种像遗产一样为你储存的爱，并相信在这种爱中，有一种力量和祝福是如此之大，以至于你可以随心所欲地旅行，而不必走出它。”
quote_en:
“Therefore, dear Sir, love your solitude and try to sing out with the pain it causes you. For those who are near you are far away... and this shows that the space around you is beginning to grow vast.... be happy about your growth, in which of course you can't take anyone with you, and be gentle with those who stay behind; be confident and calm in front of them and don't torment them with your doubts and don't frighten them with your faith or joy, which they wouldn't be able to comprehend. Seek out some simple and true feeling of what you have in common with them, which doesn't necessarily have to alter when you yourself change again and again; when you see them, love life in a form that is not your own and be indulgent toward those who are growing old, who are afraid of the aloneness that you trust.... and don't expect any understanding; but believe in a love that is being stored up for you like an inheritance, and have faith that in this love there is a strength and a blessing so large that you can travel as far as you wish without having to step outside it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这是一件奇怪的事情，哈利，但也许那些最适合掌权的人是那些从未寻求过权力的人。那些像你一样，被赋予领导权的人，因为他们必须承担领导权，他们惊讶地发现自己穿得很好。”
quote_en:
“It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “إن المرأة تحب رجلها ليس لأنه أقوى الرجال، و لا أوسمهم، و لا أغناهم، بل لأنه هو.. بضعفه و قوته.. و الحب ليس إستعراض قوة لكنه طاقة عطاء دافئة مستمرة”
quote_en:
“إن المرأة تحب رجلها ليس لأنه أقوى الرجال، و لا أوسمهم، و لا أغناهم، بل لأنه هو.. بضعفه و قوته.. و الحب ليس إستعراض قوة لكنه طاقة عطاء دافئة مستمرة”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你看得对，你会发现整个世界都是一个花园。”
quote_en:
“If you look the right way, you can see that the whole world is a garden.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你对他们来说只是一种选择时，永远不要把别人放在首位。”
quote_en:
“Never make someone a priority when all you are to them is an option.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “真正困难和令人惊奇的是，放弃完美，开始成为自己。”
quote_en:
“The thing that is really hard, and really amazing, is giving up on being perfect and beginning the work of becoming yourself.”
    
  ―

“Strange as it may seem, I still hope for the best, even though the best, like an interesting piece of mail, so rarely arrives, and even when it does it can be lost so easily.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “男性幻想，男性幻想，一切都是由男性幻想主导的吗？站在基座上或跪在地上，这都是男性幻想：你足够强壮，可以接受他们所提供的东西，否则你太软弱了，什么都做不了。即使假装你不迎合男性幻想也是男性幻想：假装你看不见，假装你有自己的生活，你可以洗脚梳头，不知道有谁从钥匙孔里窥视，从你头上的钥匙孔里凝视，如果没有别的地方的话。你是一个女人，里面有个男人在看一个女人。你是自己的窥淫癖者。”
quote_en:
“Male fantasies, male fantasies, is everything run by male fantasies? Up on a pedestal or down on your knees, it's all a male fantasy: that you're strong enough to take what they dish out, or else too weak to do anything about it. Even pretending you aren't catering to male fantasies is a male fantasy: pretending you're unseen, pretending you have a life of your own, that you can wash your feet and comb your hair unconscious of the ever-present watcher peering through the keyhole, peering through the keyhole in your own head, if nowhere else. You are a woman with a man inside watching a woman. You are your own voyeur.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “回忆的乐趣已经从我身上消失了，因为再也没有人可以一起回忆了。感觉就像失去了你的共同回忆者就意味着失去了记忆本身，就好像我们所做的事情比几个小时前更不真实、更不重要。”
quote_en:
“The pleasure of remembering had been taken from me, because there was no longer anyone to remember with. It felt like losing your co-rememberer meant losing the memory itself, as if the things we'd done were less real and important than they had been hours before.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “写故事的第一句话很有趣。你永远不知道它们会把你带到哪里。”
quote_en:
“There is something delicious about writing the first words of a story. You never quite know where they'll take you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你满足于做自己，不进行比较或竞争时，每个人都会尊重你。”
quote_en:
“When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everyone will respect you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “别让那些混蛋把你打倒。”
quote_en:
“Don't let the bastards grind you down.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我的灵魂会找到你的。”
quote_en:
“My soul will find yours.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “声誉是别人对你的了解。荣誉是你对自己的了解。”
quote_en:
“Reputation is what other people know about you. Honor is what you know about yourself.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “然而，那些逃离地狱的人从不谈论它，事后也不会和其他人谈论它。”
quote_en:
“those who escape hellhowevernever talk aboutitand nothing muchbothers themafterthat.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个值得思考的奇妙事实是，每一个人类生物对彼此来说都是如此深刻的秘密和神秘。”
quote_en:
“A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候，你必须失去一切，才能找到真正的自己。”
quote_en:
“Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们为了更快地治愈疾病而撕裂了太多的自我，以至于我们在30岁时破产了，每次和新朋友开始交往时，我们能提供的都更少了。但为了不感到任何东西而什么都不感觉——真是浪费！”
quote_en:
“We rip out so much of ourselves to be cured of things faster than we should that we go bankrupt by the age of thirty and have less to offer each time we start with someone new. But to feel nothing so as not to feel anything - what a waste!”
    
  ―

“When we least expect it, life sets us a challenge to test our courage and willingness to change; at such a moment, there is no point in pretending that nothing has happened or in saying that we are not yet ready. The challenge will not wait. Life does not look back. A week is more than enough time for us to decide whether or not to accept our destiny.”
    
  ―

“The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你越了解自己是谁，想要什么，就越不会让事情让你心烦意乱。”
quote_en:
“The more you know who you are, and what you want, the less you let things upset you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我喜欢看人们团聚，我喜欢看到人们跑来跑去，我喜欢亲吻和哭泣，我喜欢不耐烦，嘴巴说得不够快的故事，耳朵不够大的耳朵，眼睛无法接受所有的变化，我喜欢拥抱，聚在一起，思念某人的结束。”
quote_en:
“I like to see people reunited, I like to see people run to each other, I like the kissing and the crying, I like the impatience, the stories that the mouth can't tell fast enough, the ears that aren't big enough, the eyes that can't take in all of the change, I like the hugging, the bringing together, the end of missing someone.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我只能注意到，过去是美好的，因为人们永远不会意识到当时的情感。它会在以后扩展，因此我们对现在没有完整的情感，只有对过去的情感。”
quote_en:
“I can only note that the past is beautiful because one never realises an emotion at the time. It expands later, and thus we don't have complete emotions about the present, only about the past.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “来和我一起睡吧：我们不会做爱，爱会让我们。”
quote_en:
“Come sleep with me: We won't make Love, Love will make us.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “闪耀你最明亮的光芒，就是做真正的自己。”
quote_en:
“To shine your brightest light is to be who you truly are.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “佩塔，为什么我从来不知道你什么时候做噩梦？”我说。他说：“我不知道。我想我不会哭，也不会到处乱撞。我只是吓得瘫倒在地。”。“你应该叫醒我，”我说，想着如何在糟糕的夜晚打断他的睡眠两三次。大概需要多长时间才能让我冷静下来。他说：“没必要。我的噩梦通常是失去你。”。“一旦我意识到你在这里，我就没事了。”
quote_en:
“Peeta, how come I never know when you're having a nightmare?” I say.“I don't know. I don't think I cry out or thrash around or anything. I just come to, paralyzed with terror,” he says.“You should wake me,” I say, thinking about how I can interrupt his sleep two or three times on a bad night. About how long it can take to calm me down.“It's not necessary. My nightmares are usually about losing you,” he says. “I'm okay once I realize you're here.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我敦促你注意自己什么时候快乐，并在某个时候大喊、喃喃自语或思考，‘如果这不好，我不知道是什么。’”
quote_en:
“And I urge you to please notice when you are happy, and exclaim or murmur or think at some point, 'If this isn't nice, I don't know what is.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想的不是所有的痛苦，而是仍然存在的美丽。”
quote_en:
“I don't think of all the misery, but of the beauty that still remains.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你有没有想过，在过去的生活中，亚历克是一个有九十只猫的老妇人，她总是对邻居家的孩子大喊大叫，让他们离开她的草坪？因为我有。”
quote_en:
“Did you ever think that in a past life Alec was an old woman with ninety cats who was always yelling at the neighborhood kids to get off her lawn? Because I do,”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “努力一点，变得更好一点。”
quote_en:
“Try a little harder to be a little better.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “然后圣诞怪杰想到了一些他以前没有想到的事情！他想，如果圣诞节不是来自商店呢？如果圣诞节……也许……意味着更多呢！”
quote_en:
“Then the Grinch thought of something he hadn't before! What if Christmas, he thought, doesn't come from a store. What if Christmas...perhaps...means a little bit more!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “旅程有终点是件好事；但最终重要的是旅程。”
quote_en:
“It is good to have an end to journey toward; but it is the journey that matters, in the end.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我今天很成功，因为我有一个朋友相信我，我不忍心让他失望。”
quote_en:
“I'm a success today because I had a friend who believed in me and I didn't have the heart to let him down.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我认为，言语是如此不可预测的生物。没有枪，没有剑，没有军队或国王会比一句话更有力量。剑可能会杀人，但言语会刺伤并留下来，埋在我们的骨头里，成为我们带到未来的尸体，一直在挖掘，却无法从我们的肉体上撕下它们的骨架。”
quote_en:
“Words, I think, are such unpredictable creatures. No gun, no sword, no army or king will ever be more powerful than a sentence. Swords may cut and kill, but words will stab and stay, burying themselves in our bones to become corpses we carry into the future, all the time digging and failing to rip their skeletons from our flesh.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “只剩下一页可以写了。我会用只有一个音节的单词来填满它。我爱。我曾经爱过。我会爱。”
quote_en:
“There is only one page left to write on. I will fill it with words of only one syllable. I love. I have loved. I will love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “真爱通常是最不方便的。”
quote_en:
“True love is usually the most inconvenient kind.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “卖掉你的聪明，买来困惑。”
quote_en:
“Sell your cleverness and buy bewilderment.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “她一直想要文字，她爱文字；在文字中长大。文字给了她清晰，带来了理由和形状。”
quote_en:
“She had always wanted words, she loved them; grew up on them. Words gave her clarity, brought reason, shape.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “白痴！吹牛！奇怪！调整！”
quote_en:
“Nitwit! Blubber! Oddment! Tweak!”
    
  ―

“May the odds be ever in your favor!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你曾经所在的地方，世界上有一个洞，我发现自己白天不停地走来走去，晚上又掉进去。我非常想念你。”
quote_en:
“Where you used to be, there is a hole in the world, which I find myself constantly walking around in the daytime, and falling in at night. I miss you like hell.”
    
  ―

“When you play a game of thrones you win or you die.”
    
  ―

“Ah, my daughter,ʺ he said. ʺEighteen, and already youʹve been accused of murder, aided felons, and acquired a death count higher than most guardians will ever see.ʺ He paused. ʺI couldnʹt be prouder.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我总是把自己的情绪融入到工作中。这样，除了我自己，我不会伤害任何人。”
quote_en:
“I always channel my emotions into my work. That way, I don't hurt anyone but myself.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “真的，痂和药膏的组合看起来很可怕。我忍不住很享受他的痛苦。”可怜的芬尼克。这是你这辈子第一次看起来不漂亮吗？”我说。“一定是。这种感觉是全新的。这些年你是怎么做到的？”他问。“避开镜子。你会忘记的，”我说，“如果我一直看着你，就不会了，”他说
quote_en:
“Really, the combination of the scabs and the ointment looks hideous. I can't help enjoying his distress."Poor Finnick. Is this the first time in your life you haven't looked pretty?" I say."It must be. The sensation's completely new. How have you managed it all these years?" he asks."Just avoid mirrors. You'll forget about it," I say."Not if I keep looking at you," he says.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你本可以骗我的。每次我给你打电话，卢克都说你病了。我以为你在躲我。又一次。”“我没有。我确实想和你谈谈。我一直在想你。”
quote_en:
“You could have fooled me. Everytime I called you, Luke said you were sick. I figured you were avoiding me. Again.""I wasn't. I did want to talk to you. I've been thinking about you all the time.""I've been thinking about you, too.""I really was sick. I swear. I almost died back there on the ship, you know.""I know. Everytime you almost die, I almost die myself.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有书的童年——那就不是童年。那就像被拒之门外，远离了你可以去寻找最稀有快乐的魔法之地。”
quote_en:
“A childhood without books – that would be no childhood. That would be like being shut out from the enchanted place where you can go and find the rarest kind of joy.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “爱的开始是让我们所爱的人成为完美自己的意愿，是不扭曲他们以符合我们自己形象的决心。”
quote_en:
“The beginning of love is the will to let those we love be perfectly themselves, the resolution not to twist them to fit our own image.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “希望可以是一种强大的力量。也许它没有真正的魔力，但当你知道你最希望什么，并把它当作你内心的一盏灯时，你就可以让事情发生，几乎就像魔法一样。”
quote_en:
“Hope can be a powerful force. Maybe there's no actual magic in it, but when you know what you hope for most and hold it like a light within you, you can make things happen, almost like magic.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “让我给你一个建议。那个试图把你从可怕的命运中拯救出来的英俊年轻人永远不会错。即使他说天空是紫色的，是刺猬做的。”
quote_en:
“Let me give you a piece of advice. The handsome young fellow who's trying to rescue you from a hideous fate is never wrong. Not even if he says the sky is purple and made of hedgehogs.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果不是为了让彼此的生活变得不那么困难，我们活着是为了什么？”
quote_en:
“What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “记忆，即使是你最珍贵的记忆，也会出乎意料地迅速消失。但我不同意这一点。我最珍视的记忆，我从未见过它们消失。”
quote_en:
“Memories, even your most precious ones, fade surprisingly quickly. But I don’t go along with that. The memories I value most, I don’t ever see them fading.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你知道‘我早就告诉过你’有一个弟弟雅各布吗？”她打断我的话问道。“他的名字叫‘闭嘴’。”
quote_en:
“Did you know that 'I told you so' has a brother,Jacob?" she asked cutting me off. "His name is 'Shut the hell up'.”
    
  ―

“It's not gray," Clary felt compelled to point out. "It's green.""If there was such a thing as terminal literalism, you'd have died in childhood," said Jace.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “阅读带给我们未知的朋友”
quote_en:
“Reading brings us unknown friends”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这个故事是我自己写的。讲的是一个女孩，她失去了名誉，却从未错过。”
quote_en:
“I wrote the story myself. It's about a girl who lost her reputation and never missed it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不想喝茶，”克拉里压低了声音说。“我想找到我的母亲。然后我想找出是谁先带走了她，我想杀了他们。”“不幸的是，”霍奇说，“我们现在都没有痛苦的复仇，所以要么喝茶，要么什么都没有。”
quote_en:
“I don't want tea," said Clary, with muffled force. "I want to find my mother. And then I want to find out who took her in the first place, and I want to kill them.""Unfortunately," said Hodge, "we're all out of bitter revenge at the moment, so it's either tea or nothing.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “眼泪是需要书写的文字。”
quote_en:
“Tears are words that need to be written.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “随着时间的推移，伤害开始消退，更容易放手。至少我认为是这样。但在接下来的几年里，我遇到的每个男孩都在找你，当感情变得太强烈时，我会再给你写一封信。但我从来没有寄过信，因为我害怕会发现什么。到那时，你已经继续你的生活了，我不想再想你爱别人了。我想记住我们，就像那个夏天一样。我不想失去它。”
quote_en:
“In time, the hurt began to fade and it was easier to just let it go. At least I thought it was. But in every boy I met in the next few years, I found myself looking for you, and when the feelings got too strong, I'd write you another letter. But I never sent them for fear of what I might find. By then, you'd gone on with your life and I didn't want to think about you loving someone else. I wanted to remember us like we were that summer. I didn't ever want to lose that.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不一样，不是更少。”
quote_en:
“I am different, not less.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “艺术能洗去灵魂中日常生活的灰尘。”
quote_en:
“Art washes away from the soul the dust of everyday life.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候，当我必须做一些我不想做的事情时，我会假装自己是书中的角色。更容易知道他们会做什么。”
quote_en:
“Sometimes, when I have to do something I don't want to do, I pretend I'm a character from a book. It's easier to know what they would do.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们什么时候见过面？直到你看到了我的裂缝，我也看到了你的裂缝。在那之前，我们只是在看对方的想法，就像看你的窗帘，但从不看里面。但是一旦容器破裂，光线就会进来。光线可以出去。”
quote_en:
“When did we see each other face-to-face? Not until you saw into my cracks and I saw into yours. Before that, we were just looking at ideas of each other, like looking at your window shade but never seeing inside. But once the vessel cracks, the light can get in. The light can get out.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 阿拉斯加笑着说：“你真的读过你房间里的那些书吗？”“哦，天哪。我可能读过其中的三分之一。但我会把它们都读一遍。我称之为我的人生图书馆。从我小时候起，每年夏天我都会去旧货市场买所有看起来有趣的书。所以我总是有东西可以读。”
quote_en:
“Have you really read all those books in your room?”Alaska laughing- “Oh God no. I’ve maybe read a third of ‘em. But I’m going to read them all. I call it my Life’s Library. Every summer since I was little, I’ve gone to garage sales and bought all the books that looked interesting. So I always have something to read.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “时间就像我想坐的火车上挥手一样流逝。我希望你永远不必像我想你那样想任何事情。”
quote_en:
“Time was passing like a hand waving from a train I wanted to be on. I hope you never have to think about anything as much as I think about you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你不能对人类失去信心。人类就像一片海洋；如果海洋中有几滴是脏的，海洋就不会变脏。”
quote_en:
“You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is like an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “信仰不是相信上帝会做你想做的事。而是相信上帝会做出正确的事。”
quote_en:
“Faith is not the belief that God will do what you want. It is the belief that God will do what is right.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “今天是星期几？”维尼问。“就在今天，”小猪吱吱叫道。“我最喜欢的一天，”维尼说
quote_en:
“What day is it?” asked Pooh. “It’s today,” squeaked Piglet.“My favorite day,” said Pooh.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我没有去过任何地方，但它在我的名单上。”
quote_en:
“I haven't been everywhere, but it's on my list.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你真的很努力，而且你很善良，那么神奇的事情就会发生。”
quote_en:
“If you work really hard, and you're kind, amazing things will happen.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “啊，音乐，”他说，擦了擦眼睛，“这是我们在这里所做的一切之外的魔法！”
quote_en:
“Ah, music," he said, wiping his eyes. "A magic beyond all we do here!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “为了从自己的灰烬中崛起，凤凰第一次必须燃烧。”
quote_en:
“In order to riseFrom its own ashesA phoenixFirstMustBurn.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当一个人和另一个分享同一本书的人住在一起时，所有阅读的乐趣都会加倍。”
quote_en:
“The pleasure of all reading is doubled when one lives with another who shares the same books.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “动物是我的朋友……我不吃我的朋友。”
quote_en:
“Animals are my friends...and I don't eat my friends.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你能理解吗？在某个地方，有人，你能理解我一点，爱我一点吗？尽管我绝望了，尽管我有理想，尽管如此，我热爱生活。但这很难，我有很多东西要学。”
quote_en:
“Can you understand? Someone, somewhere, can you understand me a little, love me a little? For all my despair, for all my ideals, for all that - I love life. But it is hard, and I have so much - so very much to learn.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “焦虑是自由的眩晕。”
quote_en:
“Anxiety is the dizziness of freedom.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “世界正在崩溃，对我来说唯一真正重要的是她还活着。”
quote_en:
“The world was collapsing, and the only thing that really mattered to me was that she was alive.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “从前，一个天使和一个魔鬼坠入爱河。结局并不好。”
quote_en:
“Once upon a time, an angel and a devil fell in love. It did not end well.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有比家更好的地方了。”
quote_en:
“There is no place like home.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “و كن من أنتَ حيث تكون و احمل عبءَ قلبِكَ وحدهُ”
quote_en:
“و كن من أنتَ حيث تكون و احمل عبءَ قلبِكَ وحدهُ”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “友谊比爱情更深刻地标志着一种生活。爱情有退化成痴迷的风险，友谊只不过是分享。”
quote_en:
“Friendship marks a life even more deeply than love. Love risks degenerating into obsession, friendship is never anything but sharing.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “感谢生活中发生的一切；这都是一种经历。”
quote_en:
“Be thankful for everything that happens in your life; it’s all an experience.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你是所有的颜色在一个，在全亮度。”
quote_en:
“You are all the colors in one, at full brightness.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “只有一种善，即知识，还有一种恶，即无知。”
quote_en:
“There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.”
    
  ―

“You're an idiot.""I've never claimed to be otherwise.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “真正的发现之旅不在于寻找新的风景，而在于拥有新的眼光。”
quote_en:
“The real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes, but in having new eyes.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “无论你想做什么，现在就做。条件总是不可能的。”
quote_en:
“Whatever you're meant to do, do it now. The conditions are always impossible.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当它们生活在你的内心时，言语是不同的。”
quote_en:
“Words were different when they lived inside of you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你只是担心他们会雇一个男教练，他会比你更性感。”Jace的眉毛扬起。“比我更性感？”“这可能会发生，”Clary说，“你知道，理论上。”
quote_en:
“You're just worried they'll hire a male instructor and he'll be hotter than you." Jace's eyebrows went up. "Hotter than me?" "It could happen," Clary said, "You know, theoretically.""Theoretically the planet could suddenly crack in half, leaving me on one side and you on the other, forever and tragically parted, but I'm not worried about that either. Some things," Jace said, with his customary crooked smile, "are just too unlikely to dwell upon.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我总是对一个我一点也不高兴认识的人说‘很高兴认识你’。不过，如果你想活下去，你必须说这些话。”
quote_en:
“I am always saying "Glad to've met you" to somebody I'm not at all glad I met. If you want to stay alive, you have to say that stuff, though.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我自己从来没有能够准确地了解女权主义是什么：我只知道，每当我表达出与门垫不同的情绪时，人们都会称我为女权主义者。”
quote_en:
“I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “分离之所以如此痛苦，是因为我们的灵魂是相互联系的。也许它们一直是，也会是。也许在这之前，我们已经活了一千次，在每一次生命中，我们都找到了彼此。也许每一次，我们都是因为同样的原因被迫分开的。这意味着这次再见既是过去一万年的告别，也是未来的前奏。”
quote_en:
“The reason it hurts so much to separate is because our souls are connected. Maybe they always have been and will be. Maybe we've lived a thousand lives before this one and in each of them we've found each other. And maybe each time, we've been forced apart for the same reasons. That means that this goodbye is both a goodbye for the past ten thousand years and a prelude to what will come.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候你读了一本非常特别的书，读完后你想随身携带几个月，只是为了靠近它。”
quote_en:
“Sometimes you read a book so special that you want to carry it around with you for months after you've finished just to stay near it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不值得做某事，除非某个地方有人更希望你不做。”
quote_en:
“It's not worth doing something unless someone, somewhere, would much rather you weren't doing it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “那些能让你相信荒谬的人，也能让你犯下暴行。”
quote_en:
“Those who can make you believe absurdities, can make you commit atrocities.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要问你能为你的国家做什么。问问午餐吃什么。”
quote_en:
“Ask not what you can do for your country. Ask what’s for lunch.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们看一个有趣的故事的时间越长、越仔细，它就越悲伤。”
quote_en:
“The longer and more carefully we look at a funny story, the sadder it becomes.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “顺便说一句，我更喜欢书，而不是电影。电影告诉你该怎么想。一本好的书让你自己选择一些想法。电影给你看粉红色的房子。一本畅销书告诉你有一栋粉红色的房子，让你画一些最后的装饰，也许选择屋顶风格，把你自己的车停在前面。我的想象力总是超过一部电影能想出的任何东西。举个例子，那些该死的哈利波特电影。这根本不是弗勒·德拉库尔的样子。”
quote_en:
“I love books, by the way, way more than movies. Movies tell you what to think. A good book lets you choose a few thoughts for yourself. Movies show you the pink house. A good book tells you there's a pink house and lets you paint some of the finishing touches, maybe choose the roof style,park your own car out front. My imagination has always topped anything a movie could come up with. Case in point, those darned Harry Potter movies. That was so not what that part-Veela-chick, Fleur Delacour, looked like.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “所以我像孤独的房子一样等你，直到你再次见到我，住在我的房子里。直到那时，我的窗户都疼了。”
quote_en:
“so I wait for you like a lonely housetill you will see me again and live in me.Till then my windows ache.”
    
  ―

“The important thing to you is not how many years in your life, but how much life in your years!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “问题不在于我单身，也不可能一直单身，而在于我很孤独，也很可能一直孤独。”
quote_en:
“The trouble is not that I am single and likely to stay single, but that I am lonely and likely to stay lonely.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我言出必行。大象是百分之百忠诚的！”
quote_en:
“I meant what I said and I said what I meant. An elephant's faithful one-hundred percent!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “忠于自己，孩子。如果你知道自己的心，你总会有一个不撒谎的朋友。”
quote_en:
“Remain true to yourself, child. If you know your own heart, you will always have one friend who does not lie.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “每当你想以同样的方式做出反应时，问问自己，你是想成为过去的囚徒还是未来的先驱。”
quote_en:
“Every time you are tempted to react in the same old way, ask if you want to be a prisoner of the past or a pioneer of the future.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我厌倦了仅仅喜欢别人。我希望上帝能让我遇到一个我可以尊重的人。”
quote_en:
“I'm sick of just liking people. I wish to God I could meet somebody I could respect.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候，美好的事物会突然出现在我们的生活中。我们不能总是理解它们，但我们必须相信它们。我知道你想质疑一切，但有时只要有一点信心就值得了。”
quote_en:
“Sometimes beautiful things come into our lives out of nowhere. We can't always understand them, but we have to trust in them. I know you want to question everything, but sometimes it pays to just have a little faith.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: ”给她地狱从我们，皮维斯
quote_en:
“Give her hell from us, Peeves.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你热爱你所做的事情，愿意付出一切代价，那就在你力所能及的范围内。而且，你晚上独自度过的每一分钟都是值得的，思考你想设计或建造什么。我保证，这是值得的。”
quote_en:
“If you love what you do and are willing to do what it takes, it's within your reach. And it'll be worth every minute you spend alone at night, thinking and thinking about what it is you want to design or build. It'll be worth it, I promise.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “从孩提时代起，我就没有去过。和别人一样，我也没有见过。和别人看到的一样，我无法醒来。我的心以同样的语调快乐。我所爱的一切，都是我一个人爱的。”
quote_en:
“From childhood's hour I have not been. As others were, I have not seen. As others saw, I could not awaken. My heart to joy at the same tone. And all I loved, I loved alone.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我要叫醒佩塔，”我说。“不，等等，”芬尼克说。“让我们一起做。把我们的脸放在他的面前。”好吧，我同意，我的生活中剩下的乐趣太少了。我们把自己放在佩塔的两边，俯身直到我们的脸离他的鼻子只有几英寸远，然后摇晃他。“佩塔。佩塔，醒醒，”我用柔和的歌声说。他的眼睑睁开，然后他跳起来，就像我们刺伤了他一样。“啊！”芬尼克和我倒在沙子里，笑得前仰后合。每次我们试图停下来，我们都会看Peeta试图保持一种轻蔑的表情，这让我们再次出发。”
quote_en:
“I'm going to wake Peeta," I say."No, wait," says Finnick. "Let's do it together. Put our faces right in front of his."Well, there's so little opportunity for fun left in my life, I agree. We position ourselves on either side of Peeta, lean over until our faces are inches frim his nose, and give him a shake. "Peeta. Peeta, wake up," I say in a soft, singsong voice.His eyelids flutter open and then he jumps like we've stabbed him. "Aa!"Finnick and I fall back in the sand, laughing our heads off. Every time we try to stop, we look at Peeta's attempt to maintain a disdainful expression and it sets us off again.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “记住，黑暗并不总是等同于邪恶，就像光明并不总是带来好处一样。”
quote_en:
“Remember, darkness does not always equate to evil, just as light does not always bring good.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “只有被追求者、追求者、忙碌者和疲惫者。”
quote_en:
“There are only the pursued, the pursuing, the busy and the tired.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “明天可能是地狱，但今天是个好日子，在好日子里，其他什么都不重要。”
quote_en:
“Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有一次，在一个沉闷的午夜，当我虚弱而疲惫地思考着许多古怪而奇怪的被遗忘的知识时，我点了点头，几乎要睡着了，突然传来一声轻敲，就像有人轻轻地敲我的房门。这是个客人，”我喃喃自语道，“敲我的房间门——只有这个，仅此而已。”啊，我清楚地记得那是在阴冷的十二月，每一块垂死的余烬都在地板上制造了鬼魂这里越来越少了。每一块紫色窗帘的丝绸般悲伤而不确定的沙沙声都让我感到一阵前所未有的恐怖；所以现在，为了让我的心跳停止，我站在那里重复道：有客人在我的房间门口恳求入口——有晚来的客人在我房间门口请求入口；就是这样，仅此而已。”不久，我的灵魂变得更加坚强；我说：“先生，再也不用犹豫了，夫人，我真诚地请求您的原谅；但事实是，我在打盹，你轻轻地敲着，你轻轻的敲着，敲着我的房门，我几乎不确定我听到了你的声音”——我把门打开了；——黑暗在那里，什么都没有。我站在黑暗深处凝视着，很久以来，我站在那里想，害怕，怀疑，做梦，做梦，从来没有人敢做梦；但沉默没有中断，寂静没有任何迹象，那里唯一说的话就是低声说的话，“莱诺雷？我轻声细语地说，一个回声低声回应道：“莱诺雷！”！“就这一点，仅此而已。回到房间，我的灵魂在燃烧，很快我又听到一声比以前更大的敲击声。当然，”我说，“那肯定是我窗棂上的东西：那么，让我看看那里有什么，这个神秘的探索——让我的心静一静，这个神秘探索；——这是风，仅此一点。”我打开百叶窗，这时，一阵轻佻和扑腾，一只昔日圣洁的庄严乌鸦走了进来；他一点也不恭敬；他一分钟也没停下来；但是，以主人或女士的姿态，栖息在我的房门上方——栖息在我房门上方的一尊帕拉斯半身像上——栖息着，坐着，仅此而已。然后，这只乌木鸟用它严肃而庄重的表情，把我悲伤的幻想骗到了微笑中。虽然你的头顶被剃光了，但你，”我说，“肯定没有懦弱、可怕、冷酷、古老的乌鸦从夜之海岸游荡——告诉我，你在夜之普鲁顿海岸上的高贵名字是什么！乌鸦说：“再也不要了。”。“我很惊讶这只笨拙的鸟能如此清楚地听到话语，尽管它的回答没有什么意义，也没有什么相关性；因为我们不禁同意，没有一个活着的人能在他的房门上看到鸟——在他房门上的雕塑半身像上看到鸟或野兽，名字叫“永远”
quote_en:
“Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary,Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore,While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a tapping,As of some one gently rapping, rapping at my chamber door.Tis some visitor," I muttered, "tapping at my chamber door — Only this, and nothing more."Ah, distinctly I remember it was in the bleak December,And each separate dying ember wrought its ghost upon the floor.Eagerly I wished the morrow; — vainly I had sought to borrowFrom my books surcease of sorrow — sorrow for the lost Lenore —For the rare and radiant maiden whom the angels name Lenore — Nameless here for evermore.And the silken sad uncertain rustling of each purple curtainThrilled me — filled me with fantastic terrors never felt before;So that now, to still the beating of my heart, I stood repeating,Tis some visitor entreating entrance at my chamber door —Some late visitor entreating entrance at my chamber door; — This it is, and nothing more."Presently my soul grew stronger; hesitating then no longer,Sir," said I, "or Madam, truly your forgiveness I implore;But the fact is I was napping, and so gently you came rapping,And so faintly you came tapping, tapping at my chamber door,That I scarce was sure I heard you"— here I opened wide the door; — Darkness there, and nothing more.Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there wondering, fearing,Doubting, dreaming dreams no mortals ever dared to dream before;But the silence was unbroken, and the stillness gave no token,And the only word there spoken was the whispered word, "Lenore?"This I whispered, and an echo murmured back the word, "Lenore!" — Merely this, and nothing more.Back into the chamber turning, all my soul within me burning,Soon again I heard a tapping somewhat louder than before.Surely," said I, "surely that is something at my window lattice:Let me see, then, what thereat is, and this mystery explore —Let my heart be still a moment and this mystery explore; — 'Tis the wind and nothing more."Open here I flung the shutter, when, with many a flirt and flutter,In there stepped a stately raven of the saintly days of yore;Not the least obeisance made he; not a minute stopped or stayed he;But, with mien of lord or lady, perched above my chamber door —Perched upon a bust of Pallas just above my chamber door — Perched, and sat, and nothing more.Then this ebony bird beguiling my sad fancy into smiling,By the grave and stern decorum of the countenance it wore.Though thy crest be shorn and shaven, thou," I said, "art sure no craven,Ghastly grim and ancient raven wandering from the Nightly shore —Tell me what thy lordly name is on the Night's Plutonian shore!" Quoth the Raven, "Nevermore."Much I marveled this ungainly fowl to hear discourse so plainly,Though its answer little meaning— little relevancy bore;For we cannot help agreeing that no living human beingEver yet was blest with seeing bird above his chamber door —Bird or beast upon the sculptured bust above his chamber door, With such name as "Nevermore.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “……然后，我有自然、艺术和诗歌，如果这还不够，那什么才足够呢？”
quote_en:
“...and then, I have nature and art and poetry, and if that is not enough, what is enough?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想成为你无可救药地爱上的朋友。那个你抱在怀里、躺在床上、陷入你脑海中的私人世界的人。我想成为那种朋友。那个会记住你说的话以及你说话时嘴唇形状的人。你身体的每一个曲线、每一个雀斑、每一次颤抖。我想知道在哪里碰你，我想知道如何碰你。我想说服你为我设计一个微笑。是的，我确实想成为你的朋友。我想做你在全世界最好的朋友。”
quote_en:
“I want to be the friend you fall hopelessly in love with. The one you take into your arms and into your bed and into the private world you keep trapped in your head. I want to be that kind of friend. The one who will memorize the things you say as well as the shape of your lips when you say them. I want to know every curve, every freckle, every shiver of your body. I want to know where to touch you, I want to know how to touch you. I want to know convince you to design a smile just for me. Yes, I do want to be your friend. I want to be your best friend in the entire world.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你无权发表意见。你有权发表意见。没有人有权无知。”
quote_en:
“You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your  opinion. No one is entitled to be ignorant.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “也许有些人注定不会永远出现在我们的生活中。也许有些人只是路过。就像有些人走过我们的生活，给我们带来了一些东西：礼物、祝福、我们需要吸取的教训。这就是他们在这里的原因。你将永远拥有这份礼物。”
quote_en:
“Maybe some people just aren't meant to be in our lives forever. Maybe some people are just passing through. It's like some people just come through our lives to bring us something: a gift, a blessing, a lesson we need to learn. And that's why they're here. You'll have that gift forever.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想，人们如此顽固地坚持仇恨的原因之一是，他们感觉到，一旦仇恨消失，他们将被迫应对痛苦。”
quote_en:
“I imagine one of the reasons people cling to their hates so stubbornly is because they sense, once hate is gone, they will be forced to deal with pain.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有两种方式可以逃离生活的痛苦——音乐和猫。”
quote_en:
“There are two means of refuge from the misery of life — music and cats.”
    
  ―

“You'd think people had better things to gossip about," said Ginny as she sat on the common room floor, leaning against Harry’s legs and reading the Daily Prophet. "Three Dementor attacks in a week, and all Romilda Vane does is ask me if it’s true you’ve got a Hippogriff tattooed across your chest."Ron and Hermione both roared with laughter. Harry ignored them.What did you tell her?"I told her it's a Hungarian Horntail," said Ginny, turning a page of the newspaper idly. "Much more macho."Thanks," said Harry, grinning. "And what did you tell her Ron’s got?"A Pygmy Puff, but I didn’t say where.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候，一个人手中的圣经比（另一个人）手中的威士忌酒瓶更糟糕……只是有一些人——他们忙于担心下一个世界，从未学会在这个世界生活，你可以在街上看看结果。”
quote_en:
“Sometimes the Bible in the hand of one man is worse than a whisky bottle in the hand of (another)... There are just some kind of men who - who're so busy worrying about the next world they've never learned to live in this one, and you can look down the street and see the results.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你的整个生活都像恶作剧时，很难享受恶作剧。”
quote_en:
“It's hard to enjoy practical jokes when your whole life feels like one.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “时间是你生命中的硬币。你花掉了它。不要让别人替你花掉它。”
quote_en:
“Time is the coin of your life. You spend it. Do not allow others to spend it for you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在这个世界上，有很多方法可以变得勇敢。有时勇敢意味着为比自己更大的事情或为别人献出生命。有时它意味着为了更大的东西而放弃你所知道的一切，或者你所爱的人。但有时它没有。有时它只不过是咬牙切齿地忍受痛苦，每天的工作，慢慢走向更好的生活。这就是我现在必须拥有的那种勇气。”
quote_en:
“There are so many ways to be brave in this world. Sometimes bravery involves laying down your life for something bigger than yourself, or for someone else. Sometimes it involves giving up everything you have ever known, or everyone you have ever loved, for the sake of something greater.But sometimes it doesn't.Sometimes it is nothing more than gritting your teeth through pain, and the work of every day, the slow walk toward a better life. That is the sort of bravery I must have now.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你知道他们说你只会伤害你爱的人吗？好吧，这是双向的。”
quote_en:
“You know how they say you only hurt the ones you love? Well, it works both ways.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “写作就像性。首先，你是为了爱而写作，然后是为了朋友而写作，最后是为了钱而写作。”
quote_en:
“Writing is like sex. First you do it for love, then you do it for your friends, and then you do it for money.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我喜欢有人对某事感到兴奋。这很好。”
quote_en:
“I like it when somebody gets excited about something. It's nice.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “幸福在于有足够的睡眠。仅此而已，仅此而已。”
quote_en:
“Happiness consists in getting enough sleep. Just that, nothing more.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在记忆中爱别人很容易；困难的是当他们在你面前时爱他们。”
quote_en:
“It is easy to love people in memory; the hard thing is to love them when they are there in front of you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一本没有我的画的日记？狂热的幻想在哪里？浪漫的封面在哪里？”
quote_en:
“A diary with no drawings of me in it? Where are the torrid fantasies? The romance covers?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “作为一个女人，我没有国家。作为一个女性，我不想要国家。作为女性，我的国家就是整个世界。”
quote_en:
“As a woman I have no country. As a woman I want no country. As a woman, my country is the whole world.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “孩子们从来都不善于听长辈的话，但他们从来都不会不模仿长辈。”
quote_en:
“Children have never been very good at listening to their elders, but they have never failed to imitate them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当一个人恋爱时，一个人总是从欺骗自己开始，最后总是欺骗别人。这就是世界所说的浪漫。”
quote_en:
“When one is in love, one always begins by deceiving one's self, and one always ends by deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “他走了，我没有时间告诉他我刚刚意识到的事情：我原谅了他，她原谅了我们，我们必须原谅才能在迷宫中生存。我们中有很多人不得不忍受那天做过的事情和没有做的事情。事情进展不顺，当时看起来还不错，因为我们看不到未来。如果我们能看到我们最小的行为所造成的无休止的后果就好了。但除非知道得更好，否则我们无法知道得更好。当我走回去把Takumi的便条交给上校时，我发现我永远不会知道。我永远不会足够了解她。知道她在最后几分钟的想法，永远不会知道她是否是故意离开我们的。但不知道不会让我不关心，我会永远爱我弯曲的邻居阿拉斯加·杨，带着我弯曲的心。”
quote_en:
“He was gone, and I did not have time to tell him what I had just now realized: that I forgave him, and that she forgave us, and that we had to forgive to survive in the labyrinth. There were so many of us who would have to live with things done and things left undone that day. Things that did not go right, things that seemed okay at the time because we could not see the future. If only we could see the endless string of consequences that result from our smallest actions. But we can’t know better until knowing better is useless. And as I walked back to give Takumi’s note to the Colonel, I saw that I would never know. I would never know her well enough to know her thoughts in those last minutes, would never know if she left us on purpose. But the not-knowing would not keep me from caring, and I would always love Alaska Young, my crooked neighbor, with all my crooked heart.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “摧毁人民的最有效方法是否认和抹杀他们自己对历史的理解。”
quote_en:
“The most effective way to destroy people is to deny and obliterate their own understanding of their history.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你读过的所有书都被别人读过。你喜欢的所有歌曲都被别人听过。对你来说漂亮的女孩对别人来说也很漂亮。如果你在快乐的时候看到这些事实，你会感觉很棒，因为你在描述‘团结’。”
quote_en:
“And all the books you've read have been read by other people. And all the songs you've loved have been heard by other people. And that girl that's pretty to you is pretty to other people. and that if you looked at these facts when you were happy, you would feel great because you are describing 'unity.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “除非你走出舒适区，否则你永远不会改变你的生活；改变始于舒适区的尽头。”
quote_en:
“You never change your life until you step out of your comfort zone; change begins at the end of your comfort zone.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “说废话是友谊的特权，让她的废话得到尊重。”
quote_en:
“Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你只能在你喜欢的事情上真正取得成就。不要把钱作为你的目标。相反，要追求你喜欢做的事情，然后把它们做得很好，以至于人们无法把目光从你身上移开。”
quote_en:
“You can only become truly accomplished at something you love. Don’t make money your goal. Instead pursue the things you love doing and then do them so well that people can’t take their eyes off of you.”
    
  ―

“People come, people go – they’ll drift in and out of your life, almost like characters in a favorite book. When you finally close the cover, the characters have told their story and you start up again with another book, complete with new characters and adventures. Then you find yourself focusing on the new ones, not the ones from the past.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “最好的快乐总是出乎意料的。”
quote_en:
“The finest of pleasures are always the unexpected ones.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “愿它在黑暗的地方成为你的光，当所有其他的灯都熄灭的时候。”
quote_en:
“May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “他彻头彻尾地指责我是邓布利多的人。”“他太粗鲁了。”“我告诉他我是。”邓布利多张开嘴想说话，然后又闭上了。凤凰福克斯发出了一声低沉、柔和、悦耳的叫声。令哈利极度尴尬的是，他突然意识到邓布利多明亮的蓝眼睛看起来很水汪汪的，赶紧盯着自己的膝盖。然而，当邓布利多说话时，他的声音很稳定。“我很感动，哈利。”
quote_en:
“He accused me of being Dumbledore's man through and through.""How very rude of him.""I told him I was."Dumbledore opened his mouth to speak and then closed it again. Fawkes the phoenix let out a low, soft, musical cry. To Harry's intense embarrassment, he suddenly realized that Dumbledore's bright blue eyes looked rather watery, and stared hastily at his own knee. When Dumbledore spoke, however, his voice was quite steady. "I am very touched, Harry.”
    
  ―

“It is a far, far better thing that I do, than I have ever done; it is a far, far better rest that I go to than I have ever known.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你不了解历史，那么你什么都不知道。你是一片叶子，却不知道它是树的一部分。”
quote_en:
“If you don't know history, then you don't know anything. You are a leaf that doesn't know it is part of a tree. ”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “失去的爱仍然是爱。它采取了不同的形式，仅此而已。你看不见他们的笑容，也看不到他们的食物，摸不着他们的头发，或者在舞池里移动他们。但当这些感觉减弱时，另一种感觉会增强。记忆。记忆成为你的伴侣。你培养它。你抓住它。你和它一起跳舞。”
quote_en:
“Lost love is still love. It takes a different form, that's all. You can't see their smile or bring them food or tousle their hair or move them around a dance floor. But when those senses weaken another heightens. Memory. Memory becomes your partner. You nurture it. You hold it. You dance with it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “成年人只是过时的孩子，见鬼去吧。”
quote_en:
“Adults are just obsolete children and the hell with them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “1.用你的话无可挑剔。正直地说话。只说你的意思。避免用这个词来诋毁自己或八卦他人。在真理和爱的方向上使用你的话语的力量。不要拿任何个人的东西，别人做的一切都不是因为你。其他人的言行都是他们自己的现实、自己的梦想的投影。当你对他人的意见和行为免疫时，你就不会成为不必要痛苦的受害者。不要做出假设。鼓起勇气问问题，表达你真正想要的东西。尽可能清晰地与他人沟通，以避免误解、悲伤和戏剧性。只需这一份协议，你就可以彻底改变你的生活。4.永远尽你最大的努力。你的最佳状态会随时发生变化；当你健康的时候和生病的时候会有所不同。在任何情况下，只要尽你最大的努力，你就会避免自我判断、自我虐待和后悔。”
quote_en:
“1. Be Impeccable With Your WordSpeak with integrity. Say only what you mean. Avoid using the word to speak against yourself or to gossip about others. Use the power of your word in the direction of truth and love. 2. Don't Take Anything PersonallyNothing others do is because of you. What others say and do is a projection of their own reality, their own dream. When you are immune to the opinions and actions of others, you won't be the victim of needless suffering. 3. Don't Make AssumptionsFind the courage to ask questions and to express what you really want. Communicate with others as clearly as you can to avoid misunderstandings, sadness and drama. With just this one agreement, you can completely transform your life. 4. Always Do Your BestYour best is going to change from moment to moment; it will be different when you are healthy as opposed to sick. Under any circumstance, simply do your best, and you will avoid self-judgment, self-abuse and regret.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “无聊的该死的人。遍布地球。传播更多无聊的该死人。多么恐怖的节目。地球上到处都是他们。”
quote_en:
“Boring damned people. All over the earth. Propagating more boring damned people. What a horror show. The earth swarmed with them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “从来没有人告诉我，悲伤感觉就像恐惧。”
quote_en:
“No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果我们不能笑，我们都会发疯的。”
quote_en:
“If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你的唱片收藏存在激烈分歧，或者如果你最喜欢的电影在聚会上相遇时甚至不会相互交谈，那么假装任何关系都有未来是没有用的。”
quote_en:
“It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候，我觉得过去和未来对双方都如此紧迫，以至于现在根本没有空间。”
quote_en:
“Sometimes, I feel the past and the future pressing so hard on either side that there's no room for the present at all.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你是个画家。你是个面包师。你喜欢开着窗户睡觉。你从不在茶里放糖。你总是把鞋带打结。”
quote_en:
“You're a painter. You're a baker. You like to sleep with the windows open. You never take sugar in your tea. And you always double-knot your shoelaces.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “它给了我力量，让我有人为之奋斗；我永远无法为自己而战，但为了别人，我可以杀人。”
quote_en:
“It gives me strength to have somebody to fight for; I can never fight for myself, but, for others, I can kill.”
    
  ―

“I read once that the ancient Egyptians had fifty words for sand & the Eskimos had a hundred words for snow. I wish I had a thousand words for love, but all that comes to mind is the way you move against me while you sleep & there are no words for that.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一切都有裂缝。光就是这样进来的。”
quote_en:
“There is a crack in everything.That's how the light gets in.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我太聪明、太苛刻、太足智多谋，任何人都无法完全掌控我。没有人完全了解我或爱我。我只有我自己”
quote_en:
“I am too intelligent, too demanding, and too resourceful for anyone to be able to take charge of me entirely. No one knows me or loves me completely. I have only myself”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “上帝啊，但生活是孤独的，尽管有各种鸦片，尽管没有目的的“派对”有刺耳的金属箔般的欢乐，尽管我们都戴着虚伪的笑容。当你终于找到一个你觉得可以倾诉灵魂的人时，你会对你说的话感到震惊——它们是如此生锈、丑陋、毫无意义和虚弱，因为它们被困在你内心狭小狭窄的黑暗中这么久。是的，有快乐、满足和陪伴——但灵魂在其可怕的自我意识中的孤独是可怕和压倒性的。”
quote_en:
“God, but life is loneliness, despite all the opiates, despite the shrill tinsel gaiety of "parties" with no purpose, despite the false grinning faces we all wear. And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter - they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long. Yes, there is joy, fulfillment and companionship - but the loneliness of the soul in its appalling self-consciousness is horrible and overpowering.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “总是去参加别人的葬礼，否则他们就不会来参加你的葬礼。”
quote_en:
“Always go to other people's funerals, otherwise they won't come to yours.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我喜欢太多的东西，从一颗流星跑到另一颗流星，直到坠落。这就是夜晚，它对你有什么影响。除了我自己的困惑，我什么也不能给任何人。”
quote_en:
“I like too many things and get all confused and hung-up running from one falling star to another till i drop. This is the night, what it does to you. I had nothing to offer anybody except my own confusion.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我一生中经历过一些可怕的事情，其中一些确实发生了。”
quote_en:
“I've lived through some terrible things in my life, some of which actually happened.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我大约八岁的时候，我决定，除了人类之外，最美好的东西就是一本书。”
quote_en:
“When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “漂亮的女人想知道我的秘密在哪里。我不可爱，也不适合时装模特的体型。但当我开始告诉她们时，她们认为我在撒谎。我说，这就在我的手臂范围内。我的臀部跨度、步幅、嘴唇的卷曲。我是一个非凡的女人。非凡的女人，就是我。”
quote_en:
“Pretty women wonder where my secret lies.I'm not cute or built to suit a fashion model's sizeBut when I start to tell them,They think I'm telling lies.I say,It's in the reach of my armsThe span of my hips,The stride of my step,The curl of my lips.I'm a womanPhenomenally.Phenomenal woman,That's me.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当雪落下，白风吹过时，独狼死了，但狼群活了下来。”
quote_en:
“When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies but the pack survives.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我今天不能去上学了，”小佩吉·安·麦凯说。“我得了麻疹和流行性腮腺炎，一道伤口，皮疹和紫色肿块。我的嘴湿了，喉咙干了。我的右眼快瞎了。我扁桃体像石头一样大，我数了十六次水痘。还有一次——十七次，你不觉得我的脸看起来是绿色的吗？我的脚踝扭伤了，每次下雨我的铅笔都疼。我的脚趾很冷，脚趾麻木了，拇指上有一条线。我的脖子僵硬，声音很弱，说话时几乎不说话。我的舌头塞满了我的嘴，我觉得我的头发在掉。我的肘部弯曲了，脊椎不直，我的体温是八分之一。我的大脑萎缩了，我听不见，耳朵里有个洞。我有一个钉子，我的心……什么？那是什么？你说什么？你说今天是。。。。。。。。。。。。。。星期六？喂，我要出去玩了！”
quote_en:
“I cannot go to school today"Said little Peggy Ann McKay."I have the measles and the mumps,A gash, a rash and purple bumps.My mouth is wet, my throat is dry.I'm going blind in my right eye.My tonsils are as big as rocks,I've counted sixteen chicken pox.And there's one more - that's seventeen,And don't you think my face looks green?My leg is cut, my eyes are blue,It might be the instamatic flu.I cough and sneeze and gasp and choke,I'm sure that my left leg is broke.My hip hurts when I move my chin,My belly button's caving in.My back is wrenched, my ankle's sprained,My 'pendix pains each time it rains.My toes are cold, my toes are numb,I have a sliver in my thumb.My neck is stiff, my voice is weak,I hardly whisper when I speak.My tongue is filling up my mouth,I think my hair is falling out.My elbow's bent, my spine ain't straight,My temperature is one-o-eight.My brain is shrunk, I cannot hear,There's a hole inside my ear.I have a hangnail, and my heart is ...What? What's that? What's that you say?You say today is .............. Saturday?G'bye, I'm going out to play!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我有死的勇气。我想知道的是，你有活下去的勇气吗？”
quote_en:
“I've got the guts to die. What I want to know is, have you got the guts to live?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我在你这个年纪的时候，电视被称为书。”
quote_en:
“When I was your age, television was called books.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “并不总是需要坚强，而是要感觉坚强。”
quote_en:
“It's not always necessary to be strong, but to feel strong.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要让过去的记忆限制了你未来的潜力。除了你的头脑，你在人生旅途中所能取得的成就是无限的。”
quote_en:
“Do not let the memories of your past limit the potential of your future. There are no limits to what you can achieve on your journey through life, except in your mind.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “战争的最高艺术是不战而屈之于敌。”
quote_en:
“The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要屈服于你的恐惧。如果你屈服于恐惧，你将无法与内心对话。”
quote_en:
“Don't give in to your fears. If you do, you won't be able to talk to your heart.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我一定是美人鱼，兰戈。我不怕深，也不怕浅。”
quote_en:
“I must be a mermaid, Rango. I have no fear of depths and a great fear of shallow living.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你想要什么？”“只要咖啡。黑得像我的灵魂。”
quote_en:
“What do you want?""Just coffee. Black - like my soul.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有一个词能让我们摆脱生活的所有重量和痛苦：那就是爱。”
quote_en:
“One wordFrees us of all the weight and pain of life:That word is love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “问题是，如果你不自己度过一生，别人就会为你度过一生。”
quote_en:
“The trouble is if you don’t spend your life yourself, other people spend it for you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我第一次找到了我真正爱的东西——我找到了你。你是我的同情——我更好的自我——我的好天使——我对你有着强烈的依恋。我认为你很好，很有天赋，很可爱：我心中孕育着一种炽热而庄严的激情；它向你倾斜，把你吸引到我的生命中心和春天，把我的存在包裹在你身边——用纯净而强大的火焰点燃，把你和我融为一体。”
quote_en:
“I have for the first time found what I can truly love–I have found you. You are my sympathy–my better self–my good angel–I am bound to you with a strong attachment. I think you good, gifted, lovely: a fervent, a solemn passion is conceived in my heart; it leans to you, draws you to my centre and spring of life, wrap my existence about you–and, kindling in pure, powerful flame, fuses you and me in one.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “解放自己是一回事，声称拥有那个被解放的自我是另一回事。”
quote_en:
“Freeing yourself was one thing, claiming ownership of that freed self was another.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “友谊——我的定义——建立在两件事上。尊重和信任。这两个要素都必须存在。而且必须是相互的。你可以尊重某人，但如果你没有信任，友谊就会崩溃。”
quote_en:
“Friendship- my definition- is built on two things. Respect and trust. Both elements have to be there. And it has to be mutual. You can have respect for someone, but if you don't have trust, the friendship will crumble.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我认为我们都有精神病。我们这些在精神病院外的人只是把它藏得好一点——也许毕竟不是那么好。”
quote_en:
“I think that we're all mentally ill. Those of us outside the asylums only hide it a little better - and maybe not all that much better after all.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “阅读是我们不知不觉地、往往是无助地潜入他人皮肤、他人声音、他人灵魂的唯一方式。”
quote_en:
“Reading is the sole means by which we slip, involuntarily, often helplessly, into another's skin, another's voice, another's soul.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我一定很爱你。”
quote_en:
“I must have loved you a lot.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “好人对公共事务漠不关心的代价就是被坏人统治。”
quote_en:
“The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men.”
    
  ―

“The love of learning, the sequestered nooks,And all the sweet serenity of books”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们中很少有人是我们看起来的样子。”
quote_en:
“Very few of us are what we seem.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这道伤疤已经十九年没有让哈利痛苦了。一切都很好。”
quote_en:
“The scar had not pained Harry for nineteen years. All was well.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个人一生中发生的事情在记忆中被烧焦，在心中被烧毁，以至于无法忘记。”
quote_en:
“There's things that happen in a person's life that are so scorched in the memory and burned into the heart that there's no forgetting them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你想了解任何人吗？看看他们读过什么书，以及他们是如何被阅读的……”
quote_en:
“You want to know about anybody? See what books they read, and how they've been read...”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我过去常常梦想逃离平凡的生活，但我的生活从来都不平凡。我只是没有注意到它有多么非凡。”
quote_en:
“I used to dream about escaping my ordinary life, but my life was never ordinary. I had simply failed to notice how extraordinary it was.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果大海着火，相信你的心，即使星星倒退，也要靠爱生活。”
quote_en:
“Trust your heart if the seas catch fire, live by love though the stars walk backward.”
    
  ―

“It's the job that's never started as takes longest to finish.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你可以通过写作创造任何东西。”
quote_en:
“You can make anything by writing.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我旅行不是为了去任何地方，而是为了去。我旅行是为了旅行。最重要的是搬家。”
quote_en:
“I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “砖墙的存在是有原因的。砖墙不是为了把我们挡在外面。砖墙的存在给了我们一个机会，让我们展示我们多么想要某样东西。因为砖墙的存在就是为了阻止那些不够想要它的人。他们的存在是为了阻止其他人。”
quote_en:
“The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don’t want it badly enough. They’re there to stop the other people.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们是音乐制作人，我们是梦想的梦想家。”
quote_en:
“We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams.”
    
  ―

“You must write every single day of your life... You must lurk in libraries and climb the stacks like ladders to sniff books like perfumes and wear books like hats upon your crazy heads... may you be in love every day for the next 20,000 days. And out of that love, remake a world.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “图书馆是屋顶下的无限空间。”
quote_en:
“A library is infinity under a roof.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个人的伟大不在于他获得了多少财富，而在于他的正直和积极影响周围人的能力。”
quote_en:
“The greatness of a man is not in how much wealth he acquires, but in his integrity and his ability to affect those around him positively.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有哀悼者，没有葬礼。”
quote_en:
“No Mourners.No Funerals.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “睁开眼睛，在它们永远闭上之前，看看你能用它们做什么。”
quote_en:
“Open your eyes and see what you can with them before they close forever.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “真相会让你自由的。但要等到它结束了。”
quote_en:
“The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “黑洞是上帝除以零的地方。”
quote_en:
“Black holes are where God divided by zero.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不是宠物，不是洋娃娃，也不是动物。我是一个幸存者，我很坚强。我不会再软弱或无助，我不会，不能被打破。驯服。”
quote_en:
“I was not a pet, not a doll, not an animal.I was a survivor, and I was strong.I would not be weak, or helpless again I would not, could not be broken. Tamed.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在彩虹之上的某个地方，天空是蓝色的，你敢于梦想的梦想真的成真了。”
quote_en:
“Somewhere over the rainbow, skies are blue, and the dreams that you dare to dream really do come true.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “家有可能是一个人，而不是一个地方吗？”
quote_en:
“Is it possible for home to be a person and not a place?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在文学之外，是否存在‘致命的缺陷’，即人生中期那道艳丽的黑暗裂缝？我过去认为没有。现在我认为是的。我认为我的问题是：不惜一切代价对风景如画的病态渴望。”
quote_en:
“Does such a thing as 'the fatal flaw,' that showy dark crack running down the middle of a life, exist outside literature? I used to think it didn't. Now I think it does. And I think that mine is this: a morbid longing for the picturesque at all costs.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “咒语。维克多说你必须要我…关心我…才能奏效。”当他什么也没说的时候，我试图抓住他的衬衫，但我的手指太弱了。“是吗？你想要我吗？”他的话很厚。“是的，罗扎。我确实想要你。我仍然想要。我希望…我们能在一起。”“那你为什么骗我？”我们到达诊所，他设法打开门，同时还抱着我。他一进门，就开始呼救。“你为什么撒谎？”我又喃喃地说。他仍然抱着我，低头看着我。我能听到越来越近的声音和脚步声。“因为我们不能在一起。”“因为年龄的关系，对吧？”我问。“因为你是我的导师？”他的指尖轻轻擦去了我脸颊上滑落的泪水。“这是其中的一部分，”他说。“但也。。。好吧，总有一天，你和我都会成为丽莎的骄傲。我必须不惜一切代价保护她。如果一群斯特罗盖人来了，我需要把我的身体扔到他们和她之间。“我知道。当然，这就是你必须做的。”黑色的闪光再次在我眼前舞动。我渐渐消失了。“不。如果我让自己爱你，我就不会把自己扔在她面前。我会把自己扔到你面前。”
quote_en:
“The spell. Victor said you had to want me... to care about me... for it to work." When he didn't say anything, I tried to grip his shirt, but my fingers were too weak. "Did you? Did you want me?"His words came out thickly. "Yes, Roza. I did want you. I still do. I wish... we could be together.""Then why did you lie to me?"We reached the clinic, and he managed to open the door while still holding me. As soon as he stepped inside, he began yelling for help. "Why did you lie?" I murmured again.Still holding me in his arms, he looked down at me. I could hear voices and footsteps getting closer."Because we can't be together.""Because of the age thing, right?" I asked. "Because you're my mentor?"His fingertip gently wiped away a tear that had escaped down my cheek. "That's part of it," he said. "But also... well, you and I will both be Lissa's gaurdians someday. I need to protect her at all cost. If a pack of Strogoi come, I need to throw my body between them and her."I know that. Of course that's what you have to do." The black sparkles were dancing in front of my eyes again. I was fading out."No. If I let myself love you, I won't throw myself in front of her. I'll throw myself in front of you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “女人的心应该藏在上帝里面，以至于男人必须寻求他才能找到她。”
quote_en:
“A woman's heart should be so hidden in God that a man has to seek Him just to find her.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “请相信我一切都好，即使不是这样，也很快就会好起来的。我也会永远相信你。”
quote_en:
“please believe that things are good with me, and even when they're not, they will be soon enough. And i will always believe the same about you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “天知道，我们永远不必为自己的眼泪感到羞愧，因为它们是雨水洒在大地上令人眼花缭乱的尘土上，覆盖着我们坚硬的心。我哭后比以前好多了——更抱歉，更意识到自己的忘恩负义，更温柔。”
quote_en:
“Heaven knows we need never be ashamed of our tears, for they are rain upon the blinding dust of earth, overlying our hard hearts. I was better after I had cried, than before--more sorry, more aware of my own ingratitude, more gentle.”
    
  ―

“I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes.Because if you are making mistakes, then you are making new things, trying new things, learning, living, pushing yourself, changing yourself, changing your world. You're doing things you've never done before, and more importantly, you're Doing Something.So that's my wish for you, and all of us, and my wish for myself. Make New Mistakes. Make glorious, amazing mistakes. Make mistakes nobody's ever made before. Don't freeze, don't stop, don't worry that it isn't good enough, or it isn't perfect, whatever it is: art, or love, or work or family or life.Whatever it is you're scared of doing, Do it.Make your mistakes, next year and forever.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “犯错误，抓住机会，看起来很傻，但要继续前进。不要停滞不前。”
quote_en:
“Make your mistakes, take your chances, look silly, but keep on going. Don’t freeze up.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “智者无需多言，愚者才需要建议。”
quote_en:
