“I hope that one day you will have the experience of doing something you do not understand for someone you love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个知识分子？是的。永远不要否认。知识分子是一个头脑在观察自己的人。我喜欢这样，因为我很高兴成为观察者和被观察者的两半。”“它们能结合在一起吗？”这是一个实际的问题。我们必须认真对待。“我鄙视智力”实际上意味着：“我无法忍受我的怀疑。”
quote_en:
“An intellectual? Yes. And never deny it. An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself. I like this, because I am happy to be both halves, the watcher and the watched. "Can they be brought together?" This is a practical question. We must get down to it. "I despise intelligence" really means: "I cannot bear my doubts.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “尊严/ˈdignitē/名词1。当你意识到你关心的人在智力或精神上没有什么可以给你的，只有头痛的那一刻。2.当你意识到上帝对你有更大的计划，不包括晚上哭泣或Pinterest上悲伤的引文。当你停止与他人比较，因为这会损害你的价值、教育和父母的智慧。当你实现梦想的那一刻，不是因为它会证明什么或给你什么，而是因为这就是你想做的一切。人们的意见并不重要。5.当你意识到没有人是你的敌人，除了你自己。当你意识到你可以拥有生活中想要的一切的那一刻。然而，这需要时机、正确的心、正确的行动、正确的激情和冒险的意愿。如果它不是你的，那是因为你真的不想要它，不需要它，或者上帝阻止了它。当你意识到祖先的鬼魂站在你和你爱的人之间的那一刻。他们真的不想让你和一个行为不端的人搞砸家族。当你意识到幸福从来不是为了得到一个人的那一刻。他们只是你实现人生使命的帮手。当你相信爱不是输或赢的时候。这只是片刻的时间，随后是永恒的情况。当你意识到你一直是对的人的那一刻。只有无知的人才会远离伟大。”
quote_en:
“Dignity/ˈdignitē/ noun 1. The moment you realize that the person you cared for has nothing intellectually or spiritually to offer you, but a headache. 2. The moment you realize God had greater plans for you that don’t involve crying at night or sad Pinterest quotes.3. The moment you stop comparing yourself to others because it undermines your worth, education and your parent’s wisdom.4. The moment you live your dreams, not because of what it will prove or get you, but because that is all you want to do. People’s opinions don’t matter. 5. The moment you realize that no one is your enemy, except yourself.6. The moment you realize that you can have everything you want in life. However, it takes timing, the right heart, the right actions, the right passion and a willingness to risk it all. If it is not yours, it is because you really didn’t want it, need it or God prevented it. 7. The moment you realize the ghost of your ancestors stood between you and the person you loved. They really don't want you mucking up the family line with someone that acts anything less than honorable.8. The moment you realize that happiness was never about getting a person. They are only a helpmate towards achieving your life mission.9. The moment you believe that love is not about losing or winning. It is just a few moments in time, followed by an eternity of situations to grow from.10. The moment you realize that you were always the right person. Only ignorant people walk away from greatness.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “大多数男人宁愿否认一个残酷的事实，也不愿面对它。”
quote_en:
“Most men would rather deny a hard truth than face it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 亚历克看着她，摇了摇头。“你是怎么做到衣服上永远不会沾到泥的？”伊莎贝尔若有所思地耸耸肩。“我的心是纯洁的。它排斥污垢。”
quote_en:
“Alec looked at her and shook his head. "How do you manage never to get mud on your clothes?"Isabelle shrugged philosophically. "I'm pure at heart. It repels the dirt.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “死没什么。不活是可怕的。”
quote_en:
“It is nothing to die. It is frightful not to live.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “好吧，”苏珊说。N拿起宇宙，把它磨成最细的粉末，把它穿过最细的筛子，然后给我一个正义的原子，一个仁慈的分子。然后——死亡挥了挥手。然后你表现得好像世界上有一些理想的秩序，好像宇宙中有一些……一些可以用来判断它。”是的，但人们必须相信这一点，或者什么是——“我的观点完全正确。”
quote_en:
“All right," said Susan. "I'm not stupid. You're saying humans need...  to make life bearable."REALLY? AS IF IT WAS SOME KIND OF PINK PILL? NO. HUMANS NEED FANTASY TO BE HUMAN. TO BE THE PLACE WHERE THE FALLING ANGEL MEETS THE RISING APE."Tooth fairies? Hogfathers? Little—"YES. AS PRACTICE. YOU HAVE TO START OUT LEARNING TO BELIEVE THE  LIES."So we can believe the big ones?"YES. JUSTICE. MERCY. DUTY. THAT SORT OF THING."They're not the same at all!"YOU THINK SO? THEN TAKE THE UNIVERSE AND GRIND IT DOWN TO THE FINEST POWDER AND SIEVE IT THROUGH THE FINEST SIEVE AND THEN  ME ONE ATOM OF JUSTICE, ONE MOLECULE OF MERCY. AND YET—Death waved a hand. AND YET YOU ACT AS IF THERE IS SOME IDEAL ORDER IN THE WORLD, AS IF THERE IS SOME...SOME  IN THE UNIVERSE BY WHICH IT MAY BE JUDGED."Yes, but people have  to believe that, or what's the —"MY POINT EXACTLY.”
    
  ―

“Open a book this minute and start reading. Don’t move until you’ve reached page fifty. Until you’ve buried your thoughts in print. Cover yourself with words. Wash yourself away. Dissolve.”
    
  ―

“I was dead until you found me, though I breathed. I was sightless, though I could see. And then you came...and I was awakened.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你想做爱，就上大学。如果你想接受教育，就去图书馆。”
quote_en:
“If you want to get laid, go to college. If you want an education, go to the library.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “书中一定有什么东西，我们无法想象的东西，能让一个女人呆在燃烧的房子里；那里一定有什么。你不能无缘无故地呆着。”
quote_en:
“There must be something in books, something we can’t imagine, to make a woman stay in a burning house; there must be something there. You don’t stay for nothing.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “飞向月球。即使你错过了，你也会降落在群星之中。”
quote_en:
“Shoot for the moon. Even if you miss, you'll land among the stars.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “生长缓慢的树结出最好的果实。”
quote_en:
“Trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.”
    
  ―

“لا تجالس أنصاف العشاق، ولا تصادق أنصاف الأصدقاء، لا تقرأ لأنصاف الموهوبين،لا تعش نصف حياة، ولا تمت نصف موت،لا تختر نصف حل، ولا تقف في منتصف الحقيقة، لا تحلم نصف حلم، ولا تتعلق بنصف أمل، إذا صمتّ.. فاصمت حتى النهاية، وإذا تكلمت.. فتكلّم حتى النهاية، لا تصمت كي تتكلم، ولا تتكلم كي تصمت. إذا رضيت فعبّر عن رضاك، لا تصطنع نصف رضا، وإذا رفضت.. فعبّر عن رفضك، لأن نصف الرفض قبول.. النصف هو حياة لم تعشها، وهو كلمة لم تقلها،وهو ابتسامة أجّلتها، وهو حب لم تصل إليه، وهو صداقة لم تعرفها.. النصف هو ما يجعلك غريباً عن أقرب الناس إليك، وهو ما يجعل أقرب الناس إليك غرباء عنك. النصف هو أن تصل وأن لاتصل، أن تعمل وأن لا تعمل،أن تغيب وأن تحضر.. النصف هو أنت، عندما لا تكون أنت.. لأنك لم تعرف من أنت، النصف هو أن لا تعرف من أنت.. ومن تحب ليس نصفك الآخر.. هو أنت في مكان آخر في الوقت نفسه. نصف شربة لن تروي ظمأك، ونصف وجبة لن تشبع جوعك،نصف طريق لن يوصلك إلى أي مكان، ونصف فكرة لن تعطي لك نتيجة النصف هو لحظة عجزك وأنت لست بعاجز.. لأنك لست نصف إنسان. أنت إنسان وجدت كي تعيش الحياة، وليس كي تعيش نصف حياة ليست حقيقة الإنسان بما يظهره لك.. بل بما لا يستطيع أن يظهره، لذلك.. إذا أردت أن تعرفه فلا تصغي إلى ما يقوله .. بل إلى ما لا يقوله.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “始终面向阳光，阴影就会落在你身后。”
quote_en:
“Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “反智主义一直是贯穿我们政治和文化生活的一条主线，它是由民主意味着
quote_en:
“Anti-intellectualism has been a constant thread winding its way through our political and cultural life, nurtured by the false notion that democracy means that ”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有什么比光速更快的了，除了坏消息，它遵守自己的特殊规律。”
quote_en:
“Nothing travels faster than the speed of light, with the possible exception of bad news, which obeys its own special laws.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “心中有一个永远不会被填满的地方，即使在最美好的时刻和最伟大的时刻，我们也会知道它，我们会比以前更了解它。心中有一处永远不会被填补的地方，我们会在那个空间里等待。”
quote_en:
“there is a place in the heart thatwill never be filleda spaceand even during thebest momentsandthe greatest timestimeswe will know itwe will know itmore thaneverthere is a place in the heart thatwill never be filledandwe will waitandwaitin that space.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “水听得懂。冰不会原谅。”
quote_en:
“The water hears and understands. The ice does not forgive.”
    
  ―

“Men go to far greater lengths to avoid what they fear than to obtain what they desire.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你是否曾经失去过你爱的人，想要再谈一次，再找一次机会来弥补你以为他们会永远在这里的时间？如果是这样，那么你知道你可以一辈子都在收集，没有一天会比你希望回来的日子更重要。”
quote_en:
“Have you ever lost someone you love and wanted one more conversation, one more chance to make up for the time when you thought they would be here forever? If so, then you know you can go your whole life collecting days, and none will outweigh the one you wish you had back.”
    
  ―

“there are two types of people in the world: those who prefer to be sad among others, and those who prefer to be sad alone.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个人经常在逃避命运的路上遇到命运。”
quote_en:
“A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 马格努斯站在门边，不耐烦地拍了拍手指。“走吧，青少年们。唯一能在我卧室里亲昵的人就是我那个了不起的自己。”“亲昵？”克拉里重复道，以前从未听说过这个词。“了不起？”杰斯重复道，他只是很讨厌。马格努斯咆哮道。咆哮听起来像是“滚出去”
quote_en:
“Magnus, standing by the door, snapped his fingers impatiently. "Move it along, teenagers. The only person who gets to canoodle in my bedroom is my magnificent self.""Canoodle?" repeated Clary, never having heard the word before."Magnificent?" repeated Jace, who was just being nasty. Magnus growled. The growl sounded like "Get out.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “地球有它的音乐给那些愿意倾听的人”
quote_en:
“The earth has its music for those who will listen”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “谁在小事上不注重事实，谁就不能在大事上得到信任”
quote_en:
“Whoever is careless with the truth in small matters cannot be trusted with important matters”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你可能想躺下来，”马格纳斯建议道。“我发现，当可怕的现实感袭来时，这会有所帮助。”
quote_en:
“You might want to lie down," Magnus advised. "I find that it helps when the crushing sense of horrible realization sets in.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “勇气不是没有继续下去的力量，而是在你没有力量的时候继续下去。”
quote_en:
“Courage isn't having the strength to go on - it is going on when you don't have strength.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “时尚是一种令人无法忍受的丑陋，我们不得不每六个月改变一次。”
quote_en:
“Fashion is a form of ugliness so intolerable that we have to alter it every six months.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们不能害怕改变。你可能会在你所处的池塘里感到非常安全，但如果你从不冒险离开它，你就永远不会知道有一片海洋。抓住现在对你有好处的东西，可能就是你没有更好的东西的原因。”
quote_en:
“We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea. Holding onto something that is good for you now, may be the very reason why you don't have something better.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我讨厌害怕女人力量的男人。”
quote_en:
“I hate men who are afraid of women's strength.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你为什么要担心you-KNOW-WHO，而你却应该担心you-NO-POO？困扰全国的便秘感！”
quote_en:
“Why are you worrying about YOU-KNOW-WHO, when you should be worrying about YOU-NO-POO? The constipation sensation that's gripping the nation!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不可能的事情不可能发生，因此不可能的事必须是可能的，尽管表面上看起来是可能的。”
quote_en:
“The impossible could not have happened, therefore the impossible must be possible in spite of appearances.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “让雨亲吻你。让雨用银色的水滴敲打你的头。让雨给你唱摇篮曲。”
quote_en:
“Let the rain kiss you. Let the rain beat upon your head with silver liquid drops. Let the rain sing you a lullaby.”
    
  ―

“God does not play dice with the universe; He plays an ineffable game of His own devising, which might be compared, from the perspective of any of the other players [i.e. everybody], to being involved in an obscure and complex variant of poker in a pitch-dark room, with blank cards, for infinite stakes, with a Dealer who won't tell you the rules, and who .”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我们年轻的时候，单词散落在我们周围。它们是由经验组装而成的，我们也是如此，一句一句，直到故事形成。”
quote_en:
“When we are young, the words are scattered all around us. As they are assembled by experience, so also are we, sentence by sentence, until the story takes shape.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要为一个不会为你哭泣的人哭泣。”
quote_en:
“Don't cry over someone who wouldn't cry over you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你一个人就够了。你没有什么要向任何人证明的。”
quote_en:
“You alone are enough. You have nothing to prove to anybody.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “热爱生活，即使你对生活没有胃口，即使你手里拿着的一切都像烧焦的纸一样嗡嗡作响，喉咙里塞满了淤泥，也要热爱它。当悲伤与你同在时，它的热带热量使空气变得浓稠，重如水，更适合鳃而不是肺；当悲伤压垮你时，你只喜欢自己的肉，一种肥胖的悲伤，你会想，一个身体怎么能承受得了这种痛苦？然后你像手掌之间的脸一样拥抱生活，一张普通的脸，没有迷人的微笑，没有紫罗兰色的眼睛，你说，是的，我会带你，我会再次爱你。”
quote_en:
“to love life, to love it evenwhen you have no stomach for itand everything you've held dearcrumbles like burnt paper in your hands,your throat filled with the silt of it.When grief sits with you, its tropical heatthickening the air, heavy as watermore fit for gills than lungs;when grief weights you like your own fleshonly more of it, an obesity of grief,you think, How can a body withstand this?Then you hold life like a facebetween your palms, a plain face,no charming smile, no violet eyes,and you say, yes, I will take youI will love you, again.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我写作是为了给自己力量。我写作是要成为我不是的角色。我写作的目的是探索我害怕的一切。”
quote_en:
“I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of. ”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “生活要么是一场大胆的冒险，要么什么都不是。”
quote_en:
“Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你在合适的年龄读到的故事永远不会完全离开你。你可能会忘记是谁写的，或者故事叫什么。有时你会确切地忘记发生了什么，但如果一个故事触动了你，它会一直伴随着你，萦绕在你脑海中那些你很少去的地方。”
quote_en:
“Stories you read when you're the right age never quite leave you. You may forget who wrote them or what the story was called. Sometimes you'll forget precisely what happened, but if a story touches you it will stay with you, haunting the places in your mind that you rarely ever visit.”
    
  ―

“I am both happy and sad at the same time, and I'm still trying to figure out how that could be.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你接触了几年神话的东西，你了解到天堂通常是你被杀的地方。”
quote_en:
“You deal with mythological stuff for a few years, you learn that paradises are usually places where you get killed.”
    
  ―

“You’ll miss the best things if you keep your eyes shut.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “传播光的方式有两种：做蜡烛或镜子。”
quote_en:
“There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that receives it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “每当人们同意我的观点时，我总是觉得我一定错了。”
quote_en:
“Whenever people agree with me I always feel I must be wrong.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “她用斜体字感觉，用大写字母思考。”
quote_en:
“She feels in italics and thinks in CAPITALS.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “伟大的头脑讨论想法。普通的头脑讨论事件。小的头脑讨论人。”
quote_en:
“Great minds discuss ideas. Average minds discuss events. Small minds discuss people.”
    
  ―

“If no one cares for you at all, do you even really exist?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想在一段关系中，你告诉我你爱我，这只是对你已经向我展示的东西的正式认可。”
quote_en:
“I want to be in a relationship where you telling me you love me is just a ceremonious validation of what you already show me.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当一盏灯熄灭时，它比从未发光时要暗得多。”
quote_en:
“It's so much darker when a light goes out than it would have been if it had never shone.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不感到绝望的最好方法是站起来做点什么。不要等待好事发生在你身上。如果你出去做一些好事，你会让世界充满希望，你会给自己充满希望。”
quote_en:
“The best way to not feel hopeless is to get up and do something. Don’t wait for good things to happen to you. If you go out and make some good things happen, you will fill the world with hope, you will fill yourself with hope.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “定义我们的不是我们说什么或想什么，而是我们做什么。”
quote_en:
“It isn't what we say or think that defines us, but what we do.”
    
  ―

“I know not all that may be coming, but be it what it will, I'll go to it laughing.”
    
  ―

“I'm not a religious person but I do sometimes think God made you for me.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “虚构是我们讲述真相的谎言。”
quote_en:
“Fiction is the lie through which we tell the truth.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “笑声是灵魂的酒——笑声柔和，或响亮而深沉，略带严肃——人类对生命值得活下去的滑稽宣言。”
quote_en:
“Laughter is wine for the soul - laughter soft, or loud and deep, tinged through with seriousness - the hilarious declaration made by man that life is worth living.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “让你与众不同的东西，如果你真的与众不同的话，不可避免地也会让你感到孤独。”
quote_en:
“The thing that makes you exceptional, if you are at all, is inevitably that which must also make you lonely.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们将在没有黑暗的地方见面。”
quote_en:
“We shall meet in the place where there is no darkness.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有些夜晚，狼群沉默，只有月亮在嚎叫。”
quote_en:
“There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls. ”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你会失去你最珍视的东西，所以尽可能珍惜它。”
quote_en:
“You will lose what you value most, so treasure it while you can.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你只能年轻一次。但你总是可以不成熟。”
quote_en:
“You can only be young once. But you can always be immature.”
    
  ―

“There is more than one way to burn a book. And the world is full of people running about with lit matches.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你让我想活下去，罗文。不是生存；不是存在。活下去。”
quote_en:
“You make me want to live, Rowan. Not survive; not exist. Live.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我知道这是错的——上帝，这是各种各样的错误——但我只想和你躺在一起，和你一起醒来，在我的生命中只有一次，只有一次。”
quote_en:
“I know it's wrong - God, it's all kinds of wrong - but I just want to lie down with you and wake up with you, just once, just once ever in my life.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你从来没有做过，你应该做。这些事情很有趣，很有趣。”
quote_en:
“If you never did you should. These things are fun and fun is good.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “只有一代读者才能孕育出一代作家。”
quote_en:
“Only a generation of readers will spawn a generation of writers.”
    
  ―

“Do you not see how necessary a world of pains and troubles is to school an intelligence and make it a soul?”
    
  ―

“We do not believe in ourselves until someone reveals that deep inside us something is valuable, worth listening to, worthy of our trust, sacred to our touch. Once we believe in ourselves we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight or any experience that reveals the human spirit.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个女孩真正想要的是一个男人向她证明他们并不都是一样的。”
quote_en:
“All a girl really wants is for one guy to prove to her that they are not all the same.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你认为，因为他不爱你，你就一文不值。你认为，由于他不再想要你，他对你的判断和意见是正确的。如果他把你赶出去，那么你就是垃圾。你认为他属于你，因为你想属于他。不要。这是一个坏词，‘属于’。尤其是当你把它放在你爱的人身上时。爱不应该是这样的。你见过云爱山的方式吗？它们绕着山转；有时你甚至看不见山。但你知道吗？你爬到山顶，你看到了什么？他的头。云永远不会遮住头。他的头伸了出来，因为云朵让他穿过；它们没有把他裹起来。它们让他昂首挺胸，自由自在，没有任何东西可以隐藏或束缚他。你不能拥有一个人。你不能失去你不拥有的东西。假设你拥有了他。你真的会爱一个没有你的人吗？你真的想要这样的人？当你走出门时，有人崩溃了吗？你不会吧？他也没有。你要把你的一生都交给他。你的一生，女孩。如果它对你来说意义不大，你可以把它送给他，那么为什么它对他来说还有意义呢？他不能比你更看重你自己。”
quote_en:
“You think because he doesn't love you that you are worthless. You think that because he doesn't want you anymore that he is right -- that his judgement and opinion of you are correct. If he throws you out, then you are garbage. You think he belongs to you because you want to belong to him. Don't. It's a bad word, 'belong.' Especially when you put it with somebody you love. Love shouldn't be like that. Did you ever see the way the clouds love a mountain? They circle all around it; sometimes you can't even see the mountain for the clouds. But you know what? You go up top and what do you see? His head. The clouds never cover the head. His head pokes through, beacuse the clouds let him; they don't wrap him up. They let him keep his head up high, free, with nothing to hide him or bind him. You can't own a human being. You can't lose what you don't own. Suppose you did own him. Could you really love somebody who was absolutely nobody without you? You really want somebody like that? Somebody who falls apart when you walk out the door? You don't, do you? And neither does he. You're turning over your whole life to him. Your whole life, girl. And if it means so little to you that you can just give it away, hand it to him, then why should it mean any more to him? He can't value you more than you value yourself.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候，麻烦会进入我们的生活，我们无法避免。但它们存在是有原因的。只有当我们克服了它们时，我们才能理解它们为什么存在。”
quote_en:
“There are moments when troubles enter our lives and we can do nothing to avoid them.But they are there for a reason. Only when we have overcome them will we understand why they were there.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “自由在于大胆。”
quote_en:
“Freedom lies in being bold.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当心智力，因为它知道的太多，它什么都不知道，让你倒挂在地上，当你的心从嘴里掉出来时，你会说知识。”
quote_en:
“Watch out for intellect,because it knows so much it knows nothingand leaves you hanging upside down,mouthing knowledge as your heartfalls out of your mouth.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 有一天，阿提克斯对杰姆说：“我宁愿你朝后院的锡罐开枪，但我知道你会去抓鸟。如果你能打中蓝鸦，就把它们射光，但记住杀死一只知更鸟是罪恶。”这是我唯一一次听到阿提克斯说做某事是罪恶，我问莫迪小姐这件事。“你爸爸说得对，”她说。为什么杀死一只知更鸟是一种罪恶。”
quote_en:
“Atticus said to Jem one day, "I’d rather you shot at tin cans in the backyard, but I know you’ll go after birds. Shoot all the blue jays you want, if you can hit ‘em, but remember it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird." That was the only time I ever heard Atticus say it was a sin to do something, and I asked Miss Maudie about it. "Your father’s right," she said. "Mockingbirds don’t do one thing except make music for us to enjoy. They don’t eat up people’s gardens, don’t nest in corn cribs, they don’t do one thing but sing their hearts out for us. That’s why it’s a sin to kill a mockingbird.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “生在死前，强在弱，行在终点。”
quote_en:
“Life before Death.Strength before Weakness.Journey before Destination.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “ليس هناك كتابا أقرأه و لا أستفيد منه شيئا جديدا ، فحتى الكتاب التافه أستفيد من قراءته ، أني تعلمت شيئا جديدا هو ما هي التفاهة ؟ و كيف يكتب الكتاب التافهون ؟ و فيم يفكرون ؟”
quote_en:
“ليس هناك كتابا أقرأه و لا أستفيد منه شيئا جديدا ، فحتى الكتاب التافه أستفيد من قراءته ، أني تعلمت شيئا جديدا هو ما هي التفاهة ؟ و كيف يكتب الكتاب التافهون ؟ و فيم يفكرون ؟”
    
  ―

“You’ll get over it…” It’s the clichés that cause the trouble. To lose someone you love is to alter your life for ever. You don’t get over it because ‘it” is the person you loved. The pain stops, there are new people, but the gap never closes. How could it? The particularness of someone who mattered enough to grieve over is not made anodyne by death. This hole in my heart is in the shape of you and no-one else can fit it. Why would I want them to?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们不需要魔法来改变我们的世界。我们已经拥有了我们内心所需的所有力量。”
quote_en:
“We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all of the power we need inside ourselves already.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “最糟糕的哭泣不是每个人都能看到的那种——在街角嚎啕大哭，撕扯衣服。不，最糟糕的是当你的灵魂哭泣时，无论你做了什么，都无法安慰它。一部分枯萎了，成为了你灵魂中幸存下来的一部分的疤痕。对于像我和Echo这样的人来说，我们的灵魂中包含的疤痕组织比生命还多。”
quote_en:
“The worst type of crying wasn't the kind everyone could see--the wailing on street corners, the tearing at clothes. No, the worst kind happened when your soul wept and no matter what you did, there was no way to comfort it. A section withered and became a scar on the part of your soul that survived. For people like me and Echo, our souls contained more scar tissue than life.”
    
  ―

“He who knows all the answers has not been asked all the questions.”
    
  ―

“I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “只有你能控制自己的未来。”
quote_en:
“Only you can control your future.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “还有更糟糕的游戏要玩。”
quote_en:
“There are much worse games to play.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当沉重而突然的考验降临在我们身上时，当逆境取代了繁荣时，当朋友抛弃我们时，当我们周围的麻烦越来越大时，母亲是我们最真诚的朋友，她仍然会紧紧抓住我们，用她善良的训诫和忠告努力驱散黑暗的乌云，让和平回到我们的心中。”
quote_en:
“A mother is the truest friend we have, when trials heavy and sudden fall upon us; when adversity takes the place of prosperity; when friends desert us; when trouble thickens around us, still will she cling to us, and endeavor by her kind precepts and counsels to dissipate the clouds of darkness, and cause peace to return to our hearts.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个有好想法的人永远不会丑陋。你可以有一个摇摇晃晃的鼻子、弯曲的嘴、双下巴和突出的牙齿，但如果你有好想法，它们会像阳光一样从你的脸上照出来，你会永远看起来很可爱。”
quote_en:
“A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当然，罗得的妻子被告知不要回头看那些人和他们的家。但她确实回头看了，我爱她，因为这太人性化了。所以她变成了一根盐柱。事情就是这样。”
quote_en:
“And Lot's wife, of course, was told not to look back where all those people and their homes had been. But she did look back, and I love her for that, because it was so human. So she was turned into a pillar of salt. So it goes.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我今年上学了。和我在一起的一个男孩。他教会了我最重要的事情……穿上衣服。”
quote_en:
“I got schooled this year.A boy that I'm  in  with.And he taught me the most important thing of ...To put the On .”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你想找东西，没有什么比看更棒的了。如果你看，你通常会找到一些东西，但并不总是你想要的东西。”
quote_en:
“There is nothing like looking, if you want to find something. You certainly usually find something, if you look, but it is not always quite the something you were after.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我看到我的生活和它的秘密色彩时，我觉得自己快要哭了。”
quote_en:
“When I look at my life and its secret colours, I feel like bursting into tears.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我做好事时，我感觉很好。当我做坏事时，我觉得很糟糕。这就是我的信仰。”
quote_en:
“When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你考虑星星这样的事情时，我们的事情似乎并不重要，是吗？”
quote_en:
“When you consider things like the stars, our affairs don't seem to matter very much, do they?”
    
  ―

“Tiger got to hunt, bird got to fly;Man got to sit and wonder 'why, why, why?'Tiger got to sleep, bird got to land;Man got to tell himself he understand.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你不能等待灵感。你必须和俱乐部一起去追求它。”
quote_en:
“You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “做有益的事，说勇敢的话，思考美好的事：这对一个人的一生来说就足够了。”
quote_en:
“To do the useful thing, to say the courageous thing, to contemplate the beautiful thing: that is enough for one man's life.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我睡了多久？”她低声说。他没有回答。“我睡多久了？”她又问，注意到他的脸颊有点红。“你也睡了？”“直到你开始在我肩上流口水。”
quote_en:
“How long was I asleep?" she whispered. He didn't respond. "How long was I asleep?" she asked again, and noticed a hint of red in his cheeks. "You were asleep, too?" "Until you began drooling on my shoulder.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不跟陌生人出去，”我说。“我做得很好。我五点钟来接你。”
quote_en:
“I don't go out with strangers," I said."Good thing I do. I'll pick you up at five.”
    
  ―

“Never miss a good chance to shut up.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我认为，抓住星星总比慌乱地坐着好，因为你知道你无法触及它们。”
quote_en:
“It is better, I think, to grab at the stars than to sit flustered because you know you cannot reach them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你的假设是你观察世界的窗口。每隔一段时间把它们擦掉，否则光线就不会进来。”
quote_en:
“Your assumptions are your windows on the world. Scrub them off every once in a while, or the light won't come in.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我决定，只要我要下地狱，我最好彻底地去做。”
quote_en:
“I decided as long as I'm going to hell, I might as well do it thoroughly.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在这个世界上，按照世界的意见生活是容易的；在孤独中，按照我们自己的意见生活也是容易的；但伟大的人是那些在人群中以完美的甜蜜保持孤独独立的人。”
quote_en:
“It is easy in the world to live after the world's opinion; it is easy in solitude to live after our own; but the great man is he who in the midst of the crowd keeps with perfect sweetness the independence of solitude.”
    
  ―

“If you have the words, there's always a chance that you'll find the way.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候，爱意味着当你想紧紧抓住的时候放手。”
quote_en:
“Sometimes love means letting go when you want to hold on tighter.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “要高兴。要善良。要勇敢。”
quote_en:
“Be glad. Be good. Be brave.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “它就停在这里。和你在一起。和我们在一起。”
quote_en:
“It stops here. With me and you. It ends with us.”
    
  ―

“A well-composed book is a magic carpet on which we are wafted to a world that we cannot enter in any other way.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这是新的一年。新的开始。事情会改变的。”
quote_en:
“This is a new year. A new beginning. And things will change.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “很多人会走进你的生活，但只有真正的朋友会在你的心中留下足迹”
quote_en:
“Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart”
    
  ―

“If someone were to harm my family or a friend or somebody I love, I would eat them. I might end up in jail for 500 years, but I would eat them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “过去从来不是你认为你离开的地方。”
quote_en:
“The past is never where you think you left it.”
    
  ―

“Behind this mask there is more than just flesh. Beneath this mask there is an idea... and ideas are bulletproof.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你为爱情而绊倒时，很容易站起来。但当你坠入爱河时，就不可能再站起来了。”
quote_en:
“When you trip over love, it is easy to get up. But when you fall in love, it is impossible to stand again.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们越能把注意力集中在我们周围宇宙的奇迹和现实上，我们对毁灭的品味就越低。”
quote_en:
“The more clearly we can focus our attention on the wonders and realities of the universe about us, the less taste we shall have for destruction.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “所有有思想的人都是无神论者。”
quote_en:
“All thinking men are atheists.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “恋人不会在某个地方见面。他们一直在一起。”
quote_en:
“Lovers don't finally meet somewhere. They're in each other all along.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当梦想没有实现时，它们总是会破碎的。但最痛苦的往往是那些简单的梦想，因为它们看起来如此个人化、合理、可实现。你总是离得足够近，可以触摸，但永远离得不够近，足以让你心碎。”
quote_en:
“Dreams are always crushing when they don't come true. But it's the simple dreams that are often the most painful because they seem so personal, so reasonable, so attainable. You're always close enough to touch, but never quite close enough to hold and it's enough to break your heart.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “文学是一种通过文本传播的疾病，通常在儿童时期感染。”
quote_en:
“Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood.”
    
  ―

“Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当人们说不可能时，他们通常意味着不可能。”
quote_en:
“When people say impossible, they usually mean improbable.”
    
  ―

“When someone you love dies, and you're not expecting it, you don't lose her all at once; you lose her in pieces over a long time—the way the mail stops coming, and her scent fades from the pillows and even from the clothes in her closet and drawers. Gradually, you accumulate the parts of her that are gone. Just when the day comes—when there's a particular missing part that overwhelms you with the feeling that she's gone, forever—there comes another day, and another specifically missing part.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我意识到的是，不是你拿走了什么，而是你留下了什么。”
quote_en:
“The thing I realize is, that it's not what you take, it's what you leave.”
    
  ―

“Usually we walk around constantly believing ourselves. "I'm okay" we say. "I'm alright". But sometimes the truth arrives on you and you can't get it off. That's when you realize that sometimes it isn't even an answer--it's a question. Even now, I wonder how much of my life is convinced.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 人们有时会说人的“兽性”残忍，但这对动物来说是非常不公正和冒犯的，没有任何动物能像人一样残忍，如此巧妙，如此艺术地残忍
quote_en:
“People speak sometimes about the "bestial" cruelty of man, but that is terribly unjust and offensive to beasts, no animal could ever be so cruel as a man, so artfully, so artistically cruel.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “最好的出路总是通过。”
quote_en:
“The best way out is always through.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我的生活有一个出色的演员阵容，但我无法理解情节。”
quote_en:
“My life has a superb cast, but I cannot figure out the plot.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我是一片森林，是一片漆黑的树木之夜：但谁不怕我的黑暗，谁就会在我的柏树下发现满是玫瑰的河岸。”
quote_en:
“I am a forest, and a night of dark trees: but he who is not afraid of my darkness, will find banks full of roses under my cypresses.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “他是那个把自己涂成黑色并击败世界的疯子。她是个没有文字的偷书贼。不过，相信我，文字正在路上，当它们到达时，Liesel会像云朵一样把它们握在手里，像雨一样把它们拧出来。”
quote_en:
“He was the crazy one who had painted himself black and defeated the world.She was the book thief without the words.Trust me, though, the words were on their way, and when they arrived, Liesel would hold them in her hands like the clouds, and she would wring them out like rain.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你没事吧？”他问。“没有被怪物吃掉吗？”“一点也没有。”我向他展示了我仍然有双臂和双腿，泰森高兴地鼓掌。“耶！”他说。“现在我们可以吃花生酱三明治，骑鱼小马！我们可以打怪物，看Annabeth，让事情变得很顺利！”我希望他不是同时说这一切，但我绝对告诉他，今年夏天我们会玩得很开心。”
quote_en:
“You are okay?" he asked. "Not eaten by monsters?""Not even a little bit." I showed him that I still had both arms and both legs, and Tyson clapped happily."Yay!" he said. "Now we can eat peanut butter sandwiches and ride fish ponies! We can fight monsters and see Annabeth and make things go BOOM!"I hoped he didn't mean all at the same time, but I told him absolutely, we'd have a lot of fun this summer.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “成年人永远不会自己理解任何事情，孩子们总是没完没了地向他们解释事情，这很烦人。”
quote_en:
“Grown-ups never understand anything by themselves, and it is tiresome for children to be always and forever explaining things to them”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我活得越久，我就越发现，对承受愤怒的人来说，携带愤怒是最令人衰弱的。”
quote_en:
“The longer I live, the more I observe that carrying around anger is the most debilitating to the person who bears it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我开始明白，生活中甜蜜、简单的事情才是真正的。”
quote_en:
“I am beginning to learn that it is the sweet, simple things of life which are the real ones after all.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “博览群书的人不太可能是邪恶的。”
quote_en:
“Well-read people are less likely to be evil.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “女权主义是一种激进的观念，认为女性是人。”
quote_en:
“Feminism is the radical notion that women are human beings.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果我读了一本书，它让我的全身都冷得没有火能温暖我，我知道这就是诗。”
quote_en:
“If I read a book and it makes my whole body so cold no fire can ever warm me, I know that is poetry.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “正确的东西并不总是受欢迎的，受欢迎的东西也不总是正确的。”
quote_en:
“What is right is not always popular and what is popular is not always right.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “说出所有发明家中最伟大的。意外。”
quote_en:
“Name the greatest of all inventors. Accident.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你这样生活，在一个微妙的世界里，有庇护，你相信自己在生活。然后你读了一本书……或者你去旅行……你发现你不是在生活，你在冬眠。冬眠的症状很容易被察觉：第一，不安。第二个症状（冬眠变得危险，可能会恶化为死亡）：缺乏快乐。仅此而已。它看起来像一种无害的疾病。单调、无聊、死亡。数百万人在不知不觉中这样生活（或这样死去）。他们在办公室工作。他们开着车。他们和家人野餐。他们抚养孩子。然后进行一些休克治疗，一个人、一本书、这首歌唤醒了他们，把他们从死亡中拯救出来。有些人永远不会醒来。”
quote_en:
“You live like this, sheltered, in a delicate world, and you believe you are living. Then you read a book… or you take a trip… and you discover that you are not living, that you are hibernating. The symptoms of hibernating are easily detectable: first, restlessness. The second symptom (when hibernating becomes dangerous and might degenerate into death): absence of pleasure. That is all. It appears like an innocuous illness. Monotony, boredom, death. Millions live like this (or die like this) without knowing it. They work in offices. They drive a car. They picnic with their families. They raise children. And then some shock treatment takes place, a person, a book, a song, and it awakens them and saves them from death. Some never awaken.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “开始的方法是停止说话，开始行动。”
quote_en:
“The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing. ”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “也许这个世界是另一个星球的地狱。”
quote_en:
“Maybe this world is another planet’s hell.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “简，安静点；不要像一只疯狂的野鸟那样挣扎，它在绝望中撕裂自己的羽毛。”“我不是鸟；也没有网能困住我；我是一个自由的人，有独立的意志；我现在努力离开你。”
quote_en:
“Jane, be still; don't struggle so like a wild, frantic bird, that is rending its own plumage in its desperation.""I am no bird; and no net ensnares me; I am a free human being, with an independent will; which I now exert to leave you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “那是四月里一个明亮而寒冷的日子，时钟敲了十三下。”
quote_en:
“It was a bright cold day in April, and the clocks were striking thirteen.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “对星星的渴望是雄心勃勃的。对心灵的渴望是明智的。”
quote_en:
“The desire to reach for the stars is ambitious. The desire to reach hearts is wise.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要用武力或严厉的方式训练孩子学习；而是用能让他们开心的东西来引导他们学习，这样你就能更好地准确地发现每个人天才的独特倾向。”
quote_en:
“Do not train a child to learn by force or harshness; but direct them to it by what amuses their minds, so that you may be better able to discover with accuracy the peculiar bent of the genius of each.”
    
  ―

“I don't mind making jokes, but I don't want to look like one.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我喜欢这个地方，愿意在这里浪费时间。”
quote_en:
“I like this place and could willingly waste my time in it.”
    
  ―

“A man is but the product of his thoughts. What he thinks, he becomes.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要把幸福放在一边。不要等到将来才幸福。幸福的最佳时刻永远是现在。”
quote_en:
“Do not set aside your happiness. Do not wait to be happy in the future. The best time to be happy is always now.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们梦想给自己希望。停止梦想——好吧，这就像说你永远无法改变你的命运。”
quote_en:
“We dream to give ourselves hope. To stop dreaming - well, that’s like saying you can never change your fate.”
    
  ―

“Five exclamation marks, the sure sign of an insane mind.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当他们问我想成为什么样的人时，我说我不知道。”“哦，你当然知道，”摄影师说。“她想，”周·赛风趣地说，“成为一切。”
quote_en:
“When they asked me what I wanted to be I said I didn’t know."Oh, sure you know," the photographer said."She wants," said Jay Cee wittily, "to be everything.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “相信你的无限潜力。你唯一的局限性是你给自己设定的。”
quote_en:
“Believe in your infinite potential. Your only limitations are those you set upon yourself.”
    
  ―

“I think there should be a rule that everyone in the world should get a standing ovation at least once in their lives.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我的另一个信念是：和我同龄的其他人都是成年人，而我只是乔装打扮。”
quote_en:
“Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “奢侈品对我来说不是必需品，但美丽和美好的东西才是。”
quote_en:
“Luxury is not a necessity to me, but beautiful and good things are.”
    
  ―

“All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.”
    
  ―

“In one aspect, yes, I believe in ghosts, but we create them. We haunt ourselves.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果书籍可以拥有更多，给予更多，更多，展示更多，他们仍然需要读者为他们带来声音、气味、光线以及书籍中无法提供的所有其他东西。这本书需要你。”
quote_en:
“If books could have more, give more, be more, show more, they would still need readers who bring to them sound and smell and light and all the rest that can’t be in books.	The book needs you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我在坐过山车，只会往上走，我的朋友。”
quote_en:
“I’m on a roller coaster that only goes up, my friend.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果他用他渺小的身体的所有力量去爱，他不可能在八十年内像我一样在一天内爱那么多。”
quote_en:
“If he loved with all the powers of his puny being, he couldn't love as much in eighty years as I could in a day.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “因为在某种程度上，了解一个人的图书馆就是了解他的思想。”
quote_en:
“For to know a man's library is, in some measure, to know his mind.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有善行不受惩罚。”
quote_en:
“No good deed goes unpunished.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “恶魔痘，哦，恶魔痘。它是怎么得来的？一个人必须去城里最糟糕的地方，直到非常累。恶魔痘，噢，恶魔痘，我一直都有——不是痘，你们这些愚蠢的家伙，我是说这首歌——因为我是对的，你们是错的！”“威尔！”夏洛特在喧闹声中喊道，“你疯了吗？把那只婴儿项圈关掉！杰姆——”杰姆站起来，用手捂住威尔的嘴。“你保证安静吗？”他对着朋友的耳朵嘶嘶地说。威尔点了点头，蓝眼睛闪闪发光。泰莎盯着看他很惊讶；他们都是。她见过威尔很多事情——有趣、痛苦、屈尊、愤怒、怜悯——但以前从来没有头晕过。杰姆让他走了。“好吧，那么。”威尔滑到地板上，背靠扶手椅，举起双臂。“你们家都出了鬼痘！”他宣布，打了个呵欠。“哦，天哪，好几周的痘笑话，”杰姆说。“我们现在就要开始了。”
quote_en:
“Demon pox, oh demon poxJust how is it acquired?One must go down to the bad part of townUntil one is very tired.Demon pox, oh demon pox, I had it all along—Not the pox, you foolish blocks,I mean this very song—For I was right, and you were wrong!""Will!" Charlotte shouted over the noise, "Have you LOST YOUR MIND? CEASE THAT INFERNAL RACKET! Jem—" Jem, rising to his feet, clapped his hands over Will's mouth. "Do you promise to be quiet?" he hissed into his friend's ear.Will nodded, blue eyes blazing. Tessa was staring at him in amazement; they all were. She had seen Will many things—amused, bitter, condescending, angry, pitying—but never giddy before.Jem let him go. "All right, then."Will slid to the floor, his back against the armchair, and threw up his arms. "A demon pox on all your houses!" he announced, and yawned."Oh, God, weeks of pox jokes," said Jem. "We're in for it now.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想这就是说再见的感觉——就像从悬崖边跳下来。最糟糕的是做出这样的选择。一旦你在空中，除了放手，你什么也做不了。”
quote_en:
“I guess that's what saying good-bye is always like--like jumping off an edge. The worst part is making the choice to do it. Once you're in the air, there's nothing you can do but let go.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “上帝保佑！”21点喊道。“是酒贩子！D先生恼怒地叹了口气。“下一个叫我‘酒贩子’的人，或者马，最终会进一瓶梅洛！”
quote_en:
“God alert!" Blackjack yelled. "It's the wine dude!Mr. D sighed in exasperation. "The next person, or horse, who calls me the 'wine dude' will end up in a bottle of Merlot!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我心里有一只蓝鸟想出去，但我对他太强硬了，我说，呆在里面，我不会让任何人看到你的。”
quote_en:
“There's a bluebird in my heart that wants to get outbut I'm too tough for him,I say, stay in there, I'm not going to let anybody see you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “文学是奢侈品，小说是必需品。”
quote_en:
“Literature is a luxury; fiction is a necessity.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “好吧，她对我的示好没有反应，”他观察到的比他感觉到的更明亮，“所以她一定已经死了。”“或者她是一个有品味和理智的女人。”
quote_en:
“Well, she's not responding to my advances," he observed more brightly than he felt, "so she must be dead." "Or she's a woman of good taste and sense.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “好的性爱就像好的桥梁。如果你没有一个好的伴侣，你最好有一只好的手。”
quote_en:
“Good sex is like good bridge. If you don't have a good partner, you'd better have a good hand.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不是生命的长度，而是深度。”
quote_en:
“It is not the length of life, but the depth.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “真爱的道路从来都不平坦；但是，要么是血缘不同，啊，十字架！太高了，无法被迷住。要么是岁月错位，啊，尽管如此！太老了，无法与年轻人订婚。要么是朋友的选择，啊，地狱！用别人的眼光来选择爱情。”
quote_en:
“The course of true love never did run smooth; But, either it was different in blood,O cross! too high to be enthrall’d to low. Or else misgraffed in respect of years, O spite! too old to be engag’d to young. Or else it stood upon the choice of friends,O hell! to choose love by another’s eye.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “什么是直的？一条线可以是直的，也可以是街道，但人心，哦，不，它是弯曲的，就像一条穿过山脉的路。”
quote_en:
“What is straight? A line can be straight, or a street, but the human heart, oh, no, it's curved like a road through mountains.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “爱就像一棵树：它自己生长，深深扎根于我们的存在中，并在一颗破败的心上继续蓬勃发展。一个无法解释的事实是，它越盲目，就越顽强。它永远不会比完全不合理的时候更强大。”
quote_en:
“Love is like a tree: it grows by itself, roots itself deeply in our being and continues to flourish over a heart in ruin. The inexplicable fact is that the blinder it is, the more tenacious it is. It is never stronger than when it is completely unreasonable.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “第12区：在那里你可以安全地饿死。”
quote_en:
“District 12: Where you can starve to death in safety.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你给马格纳斯发短信说‘我觉得你疯了’，我就杀了你。”“马格纳斯是谁？”马克斯问。“他是个术士，”亚历克说。“一个性感的、性感的术士，”伊莎贝尔告诉马克斯，无视亚历克愤怒的表情。“但术士很坏，”马克斯困惑地抗议道。“没错，”伊莎贝尔说
quote_en:
“If you're texting Magnus to say 'I think u r kewl,' I'm going to kill you.""Who's Magnus?" Max inquired."He's a warlock," said Alec."A sexy, sexy warlock," Isabelle told Max, ignoring Alec's look of total fury."But warlocks are bad," protested Max, looking baffled."Exactly," said Isabelle.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不知道什么更糟糕：不知道自己是什么，不快乐，或者成为你一直想成为的人，感到孤独。”
quote_en:
“I don’t know what’s worse: to not know what you are and be happy, or to become what you’ve always wanted to be, and feel alone.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “孩子们从你身上学到的比你教的更多。”
quote_en:
“Children learn more from what you are than what you teach.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “性是自然的一部分。我顺从自然。”
quote_en:
“Sex is part of nature. I go along with nature.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “对未来的真正慷慨在于把一切都奉献给现在。”
quote_en:
“Real generosity towards the future lies in giving all to the present.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我如何爱你？让我细数。我爱你的深度、广度和高度，我的灵魂都能触及”
quote_en:
“How do I love thee? Let me count the ways.I love thee to the depth and breadth and heightMy soul can reach”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “死亡是如此可怕的结局，而生命充满了可能性。”
quote_en:
“Death is so terribly final, while life is full of possibilities.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我知道你想念我一定很伤心，但请留言，我会尽力减轻你的痛苦”
quote_en:
“I know how devastated you must be to miss me, but leave a message, and I'll try to ease your agony”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有你在我怀里，我的灵魂感到空虚。我发现自己在人群中寻找你的脸——我知道这是不可能的，但我无法控制自己。”
quote_en:
“Without you in my arms, I feel an emptiness in my soul. I find myself searching the crowds for your face - I know it's an impossibility, but I cannot help myself.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有食物的头脑会吞噬自己。”
quote_en:
“The unfed mind devours itself.”
    
  ―

“Unfortunately, the clock is ticking, the hours are going by. The past increases, the future recedes. Possibilities decreasing, regrets mounting.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个人应该永远喝醉。这才是最重要的……但喝什么呢？喝葡萄酒、诗歌或美德，由你选择。但要喝醉。”
quote_en:
“One should always be drunk. That's all that matters...But with what? With wine, with poetry, or with virtue, as you chose. But get drunk.”
    
  ―

“What draws people to be friends is that they see the same truth. They share it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “他允许自己被自己的信念所动摇，即人类不是在母亲生下他们的那一天一劳永逸地出生的，而是生活迫使他们一次又一次地生下自己。”
quote_en:
“He allowed himself to be swayed by his conviction that human beings are not born once and for all on the day their mothers give birth to them, but that life obliges them over and over again to give birth to themselves.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你注定要成为的人就是你决定成为的人。”
quote_en:
“The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be.”
    
  ―

“Life is a mirror: if you frown at it, it frowns back; if you smile, it returns the greeting.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “移动一座山的人首先会带走一些小石头。”
quote_en:
“The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “现在她没有什么可失去的了，她自由了。”
quote_en:
“Now that she had nothing to lose, she was free.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当然，动力不是永久的。但是，洗澡也不是；但这是你应该定期做的事情。”
quote_en:
“Of course motivation is not permanent. But then, neither is bathing; but it is something you should do on a regular basis.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个国家的伟大和道德进步可以通过对待动物的方式来判断。”
quote_en:
“The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “想象力就像一块肌肉。我发现我写得越多，它就越大。”
quote_en:
“Imagination is like a muscle. I found out that the more I wrote, the bigger it got.”
    
  ―

“Talking to a drunk person was like talking to an extremely happy, severely brain-damaged three-year-old.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “她是一个悲伤的天才，沉浸在悲伤中，把它的无数条线分开，欣赏它微妙的细微差别。她是一块棱镜，通过它，悲伤可以被分成无限的光谱。”
quote_en:
“She was a genius of sadness, immersing herself in it, separating its numerous strands, appreciating its subtle nuances. She was a prism through which sadness could be divided into its infinite spectrum.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “只要有足够的勇气，你就可以没有名声。”
quote_en:
“With enough courage, you can do without a reputation.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “无论你读了多少圣言，无论你说了多少圣语，如果你不按照它们行事，它们对你有什么好处？”
quote_en:
“However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我患有女孩邻家症，那家伙和你是朋友，仅此而已。”
quote_en:
“I suffer from girlnextdooritis where the guy is friends with you and that's it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “作家的角色不是说我们都能说的话，而是说我们不能说的话。”
quote_en:
“The role of a writer is not to say what we can all say, but what we are unable to say.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “阳光拍打着大地，月光亲吻着大海：如果你不亲吻我，这些亲吻有什么价值？”
quote_en:
“The sunlight claps the earth, and the moonbeams kiss the sea: what are all these kissings worth, if thou kiss not me?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “音乐是……比所有智慧和哲学都更高的启示”
quote_en:
“Music is ... A higher revelation than all Wisdom & Philosophy”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “回家对我大喊大叫。回家和我打架。如果你必须的话，回家让我心碎。”
quote_en:
“Come home and shout at me. Come home and fight with me. Come home and break my heart, if you must.”
    
  ―

“If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “只要她想到一个男人，就没有人反对女人思考。”
quote_en:
“As long as she thinks of a man, nobody objects to a woman thinking.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有什么比一个明显的事实更具欺骗性了。”
quote_en:
“There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在你的生活中，会有几次，你所有的直觉都会告诉你做一些事情，一些违背逻辑、打乱你的计划、在别人看来可能很疯狂的事情。当这种情况发生时，你就去做。听从你的直觉，忽略其他一切。忽略逻辑，忽略可能性，忽略复杂性，然后去做。”
quote_en:
“There will be a few times in your life when all your instincts will tell you to do something, something that defies logic, upsets your plans, and may seem crazy to others. When that happens, you do it. Listen to your instincts and ignore everything else. Ignore logic, ignore the odds, ignore the complications, and just go for it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “女人想让爱情成为小说。男人想让爱情变成短篇小说。”
quote_en:
“Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我爱你，就像在阴影和灵魂之间秘密地爱着某些黑暗的东西一样。”
quote_en:
“I love you as certain dark things are loved, secretly, between the shadow and the soul.”
    
  ―

“You believe in a book that has talking animals, wizards, witches, demons, sticks turning into snakes, burning bushes, food falling from the sky, people walking on water, and all sorts of magical, absurd and primitive stories, and you say that we are the ones that need help?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “生活中没有人能得到一切。你决定你的优先事项，你做出选择。我很久以前就决定，我吃的任何蛋糕都会被吃掉。”
quote_en:
“Nobody gets everything in this life. You decide your priorities and you make your choices. I'd decided long ago that any cake I had would be eaten.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们醒着的时候做梦，睡觉的时候走路。”
quote_en:
“We dream in our waking moments, and walk in our sleep.”
    
  ―

“The things we love destroy us every time, lad. Remember that.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我很高兴。这通常看起来很疯狂。”
quote_en:
“I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “死很容易。但你必须为生活而奋斗。”
quote_en:
“To die, it's easy. But you have to struggle for life.”
    
  ―

“Some things in life are out of your control. You can make it a party or a tragedy.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “那就生火吧！”哈利哽咽着说。“是的……当然……但这里没有木头！”……“你疯了！”罗恩吼道。“你到底是不是女巫！”
quote_en:
“So light a fire!" Harry choked. "Yes...of course...but there's no wood!" ... "HAVE YOU GONE MAD!" Ron bellowed. "ARE YOU A WITCH OR NOT!”
    
  ―

“Too many of us are hung up on what we don't have, can't have, or won't ever have. We spend too much energy being down, when we could use that same energy – if not less of it – doing, or at least trying to do, some of the things we really want to do.”
    
  ―

“Freedom (n.): To ask nothing. To expect nothing. To depend on nothing.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你留下来，我会做任何你想做的事。我会退出乐队，和你一起去纽约。但如果你需要我离开，我也会这样做。我和丽兹谈过，她说也许回到旧生活会太痛苦，也许你更容易抹去我们。这很糟糕，但我会这么做。如果我今天不失去你，我可能会像那样失去你。我会让你走。如果你留下。”
quote_en:
“If you stay, I'll do whatever you want. I'll quit the band, go with you to New York. But if you need me to go away, I'll do that, too. I was talking to Liz and she said maybe coming back to your old life would be too painful, that maybe it'd be easier for you to erase us. And that would suck, but I'd do it. I can lose you like that if I don't lose you today. I'll let you go. If you stay.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你可以说对不起，”哈利直截了当地建议道。“怎么，被另一群金丝雀袭击了？”罗恩喃喃自语道。“你为什么要模仿她？”“她嘲笑我的胡子！”“我也是，这是我见过的最愚蠢的事情。”
quote_en:
“You could say sorry," suggested Harry bluntly. "What, and get attacked by another flock of canaries?" muttered Ron."What did you have to imitate her for?""She laughed at my mustache!""So did I, it was the stupidest thing I've ever seen.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我决定最好大喊大叫。沉默才是真正的反人类罪。”
quote_en:
“I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “格斯：“它尝起来像……”我：“食物。”格斯：“是的，没错。它尝起来就像食物，准备得很好。但它没有味道，我该怎么委婉地说呢……”
quote_en:
“Gus: "It tastes like..."Me: "Food."Gus: "Yes, precisely. It tastes like food, excellently prepared. But it does not taste, how do I put this delicately...?"Me: "It does not taste like God Himself cooked heaven into a series of five dishes which were then served to you accompanied by several luminous balls of fermented, bubbly plasma while actual and literal flower petals floated down around your canal-side dinner table."Gus: "Nicely phrased."Gus's father: "Our children are weird."My dad: "Nicely phrased.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你赢了，你不需要解释……如果你输了，你就不应该在那里解释！”
quote_en:
“If you win, you need not have to explain...If you lose, you should not be there to explain!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果我学到了一件事，那就是：我们都希望一切都好。我们甚至不希望太棒、太棒或太出色。我们很乐意接受好，因为大多数时候，好就足够了。”
quote_en:
“If there's one thing I've learned, it's this: We all want everything to be okay. We don't even wish so much for fantastic or marvelous or outstanding. We will happily settle for okay, because most of the time, okay is enough.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “群山在召唤，我必须走了。”
quote_en:
“The mountains are calling and I must go.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “但是，除非一个人能够深刻而诚实地说，‘我之所以成为今天的我，是因为我昨天做出的选择’，否则这个人不能说‘我选择了其他方式’。”
quote_en:
“But until a person can say deeply and honestly, "I am what I am today because of the choices I made yesterday," that person cannot say, "I choose otherwise.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “和你在一起从来没有感觉不对。这是我做得对的一件事。你是我做对的一事。”
quote_en:
“Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “没有什么比单恋更能让花生酱失去味道了。”
quote_en:
“Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love.”
    
  ―

“Listen with curiosity. Speak with honesty. Act with integrity. The greatest problem with communication is we don’t listen to understand. We listen to reply. When we listen with curiosity, we don’t listen with the intent to reply. We listen for what’s behind the words.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: 一个女孩打电话问：“死了很痛吗？”“好吧，亲爱的，”我告诉她，“是的，但活着更痛。”
quote_en:
“A girl calls and asks, "Does it hurt very much to die?""Well, sweetheart," I tell her, "yes, but it hurts a lot more to keep living.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “最可怕的贫穷是孤独和不被爱的感觉。”
quote_en:
“The most terrible poverty is loneliness, and the feeling of being unloved.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你所相信的，将成为你的世界。”
quote_en:
“That which you believe becomes your world.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你读一本书时，你会把别人的想法掌握在手中。”
quote_en:
“When you read a book, you hold another's mind in your hands.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我永远不会忘记一张脸，但就你而言，我很乐意破例。”
quote_en:
“I never forget a face, but in your case I'll be glad to make an exception.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我受伤了，正在康复，但我的每一块心都属于你。”
quote_en:
“I am broken and healing, but every piece of my heart belong to you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “因为你，我永远完蛋了。”
quote_en:
“By you, I am forever undone.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “一个概念是一块砖。它可以用来建造一个理性的法院。也可以扔到窗外。”
quote_en:
“A concept is a brick. It can be used to build a courthouse of reason. Or it can be thrown through the window.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “威尔卷起袖子。”“我们可能得把门关上——”“或者，”杰姆说，伸手拧了拧把手，“不行。”门开了，一片漆黑。“现在，这简直是懒惰，”威尔说
quote_en:
“Will rolled up his sleeves. "We'll probably have to knock down the door--" "Or," said Jem, reaching out and giving the knob a twist, "not." The door swung open onto a rectangle of darkness. "Now, that's simply laziness," said Will.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你试过和她说话吗？”“没有。我们一直在反复打她的脸。什么？你觉得这行不通吗？”
quote_en:
“Have you tried talking to her?" "No. We've been punching her in the face repeatedly. What? You don't think that will work?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “大多数人过着平静的绝望生活。所谓的辞职是确认的绝望。从绝望的城市，你进入绝望的国家，必须用貂皮和麝鼠的勇气来安慰自己。即使在人类所谓的游戏和娱乐中，也隐藏着一种刻板但无意识的绝望。它们没有游戏，因为这是在工作之后。但不做绝望的事情是智慧的一个特征。”
quote_en:
“The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation. What is called resignation is confirmed desperation. From the desperate city you go into the desperate country, and have to console yourself with the bravery of minks and muskrats. A stereotyped but unconscious despair is concealed even under what are called the games and amusements of mankind. There is no play in them, for this comes after work. But it is a characteristic of wisdom not to do desperate things..”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你得到了任何人得到的东西——你得到了一生。”
quote_en:
“You get what anybody gets - you get a lifetime.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你是一名学生，除非你读到了书中的好部分，否则你应该一直睡个好觉，然后你应该熬夜，让你的功课半途而废，这个短语的意思是‘不及格’。”
quote_en:
“If you are a student you should always get a good nights sleep unless you have come to the good part of your book, and then you should stay up all night and let your schoolwork fall by the wayside, a phrase which means 'flunk'.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “任何人来到你身边，都会变得更好、更快乐。做上帝仁慈的活生生的表达：你脸上的仁慈，你眼中的仁慈，微笑中的仁慈。”
quote_en:
“Let no one ever come to you without leaving better and happier. Be the living expression of God's kindness: kindness in your face, kindness in your eyes, kindness in your smile.”
    
  ―

“Crows remember human faces. They remember the people who feed them, who are kind to them. And the people who wrong them too. They don’t forget. They tell each other who to look after and who to watch out for.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “永远不要让任何人让你觉得自己很普通。”
quote_en:
“Never let anyone make you feel ordinary.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “短篇小说完全是另一回事——短篇小说就像一个陌生人在黑暗中快速亲吻。”
quote_en:
“A short story is a different thing altogether – a short story is like a quick kiss in the dark from a stranger.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想现在我应该对失去有足够的了解，意识到你永远不会真正停止想念一个人，你只是学会了在他们缺席的巨大漏洞周围生活。”
quote_en:
“I guess by now I should know enough about loss to realize that you never really stop missing someone-you just learn to live around the huge gaping hole of their absence.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “为什么美丽的歌曲会让你悲伤？”“因为它们不是真的。”“从来没有？”“没有什么是美丽和真实的。”
quote_en:
“Why do beautiful songs make you sad?' 'Because they aren't true.' 'Never?' 'Nothing is beautiful and true.”
    
  ―

“After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “主啊，这些凡人真是愚蠢至极！”
quote_en:
“Lord, what fools these mortals be!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “成年人总是问小孩子长大后想做什么，因为他们在寻找想法。”
quote_en:
“Adults are always asking little kids what they want to be when they grow up ’cause they’re looking for ideas.”
    
  ―

“There is no such thing as a "broken family." Family is family, and is not determined by marriage certificates, divorce papers, and adoption documents. Families are made in the heart. The only time family becomes null is when those ties in the heart are cut. If you cut those ties, those people are not your family. If you make those ties, those people are your family. And if you hate those ties, those people will still be your family because whatever you hate will always be with you.”
    
  ―

“But I believe in true love, you know? I don't believe that everybody gets to keep their eyes or not get sick or whatever, but everybody should have true love, and it should last at least as long as your life does.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “永远做自己的一流版本，而不是别人的二流版本。”
quote_en:
“Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “幽默是疯狂的理智。”
quote_en:
“Humor is reason gone mad.”
    
  ―

“Sometimes, the best way to help someone is just to be near them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这就是一切的开始。一切都从今天开始。”
quote_en:
“This is where it all begins. Everything starts here, today.”
    
  ―

“To survive, you must tell stories.”
    
  ―

“She looked at nice young men as if she could smell their stupidity.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在这个世界上，我总是一个陌生人，我不懂它的语言，它不懂我的沉默”
quote_en:
“In the world I amAlways a strangerI do not understand its languageIt does not understand my silence”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你进入急诊室时，他们要求你做的第一件事就是用1到10的等级来评估你的疼痛，然后他们决定使用哪种药物以及使用的速度。多年来，我被问过几百次这个问题，我记得有一次很早的时候，我喘不过气来，感觉我的胸部着火了，火焰舔着我的肋骨内侧，想办法把我烧掉，我的父母带我去了急诊室。护士问我疼痛的原因，我甚至不能说话，所以我举起了九个手指。后来，在他们给了我一些东西后，护士进来了，她有点抚摸我。她给我量了血压，然后说：“你知道我怎么知道你是个斗士吗？你打了个九打十。”但这并不完全正确。我称之为九，因为我省下了十。就在这里，伟大而可怕的十，当我静静地独自躺在床上盯着天花板时，一次又一次地拍打着我，海浪把我扔到岩石上，然后把我拉回大海，这样他们就可以把我再次发射到悬崖的锯齿状表面，让我脸朝上漂浮在水面上，没有划船。”
quote_en:
“When you go into the ER, one of the first things they ask you to do is rate your pain on a scale of one to ten, and from there they decide which drugs to use and how quickly to use them. I'd been asked this question hundreds of times over the years, and I remember once early on when I couldn't get my breath and it felt like my chest was on fire, flames licking the inside of my ribs fighting for a way to burn out of my body, my parents took me to the ER. nurse asked me about the pain, and I couldn't even speak, so I held up nine fingers.Later, after they'd given me something, the nurse came in and she was kind of stroking my head while she took my blood pressure and said, "You know how I know you're a fighter? You called a ten a nine."But that wasn't quite right. I called it a nine because I was saving my ten. And here it was, the great and terrible ten, slamming me again and again as I lay still and alone in my bed staring at the ceiling, the waves tossing me against the rocks then pulling me back out to sea so they could launch me again into the jagged face of the cliff, leaving me floating faceup on the water, undrowned.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我的宗教很简单。我的宗教是善良。”
quote_en:
“My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时你会输掉一场战斗。但恶作剧总是赢得战争”
quote_en:
“Sometimes you lose a battle. But mischief always wins the war”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “在这个世界上，没有人是无用的，谁减轻了别人的负担。”
quote_en:
“No one is useless in this world who lightens the burdens of another.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我很容易相信别人的宗教是愚蠢的，这让我怀疑自己的宗教也是愚蠢的。”
quote_en:
“The easy confidence with which I know another man's religion is folly teaches me to suspect that my own is also.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “……东西会坏，有时会被修复，在大多数情况下，你会意识到，无论什么东西被损坏，生活都会重新安排，以弥补你的损失，有时甚至会非常美妙。”
quote_en:
“...things get broken, and sometimes they get repaired, and in most cases, you realize that no matter what gets damaged, life rearranges itself to compensate for your loss, sometimes wonderfully.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “把你的梦想像风筝一样抛向太空，你不知道它会带来什么，新的生活、新的朋友、新的爱情、新的国家。”
quote_en:
“Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “但是希伯来语单词timshel——‘你可以’——给了我们一个选择。它可能是世界上最重要的单词。它说路是敞开的。这把它直接抛到了一个人身上。因为如果‘你可能’——‘你可能不’也是真的。”
quote_en:
“But the Hebrew word, the word timshel—‘Thou mayest’— that gives a choice. It might be the most important word in the world. That says the way is open. That throws it right back on a man. For if ‘Thou mayest’—it is also true that ‘Thou mayest not.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “与其找个坏借口，不如不找借口。”
quote_en:
“It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “因为，”她说，“当你害怕的时候，你仍然会勇敢地去做。”
quote_en:
“Because,' she said, 'when you're scared but you still do it anyway,  brave.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “那么，我们让读者自己回答这个问题：谁是更幸福的人，谁冒着生命的风暴生活过，谁安全地呆在岸上，只是存在过？”
quote_en:
“So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “只有你才能拥有星星，因为其他人没有……我将生活在其中一颗星星上。在其中一颗星上，我会笑。所以，当你晚上仰望天空时，就好像所有的星星都在笑……只有你才能有会笑的星星。”
quote_en:
“You - you alone will have the stars as no one else has them...In one of the stars I shall be living. In one of them I shall be laughing. And so it will be as if all the stars were laughing, when you look at the sky at night...You - only you - will have stars that can laugh.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “藏语有句谚语，‘悲剧应该被用作力量的源泉。’无论遇到什么样的困难，经历多么痛苦，如果我们失去希望，那才是我们真正的灾难。”
quote_en:
“There is a saying in Tibetan, 'Tragedy should be utilized as a source of strength.'No matter what sort of difficulties, how painful experience is, if we lose our hope, that's our real disaster.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “真正的朋友在精神上永远在一起。”
quote_en:
“True friends are always together in spirit.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “阅读就像思考、祈祷、与朋友交谈、表达自己的想法、倾听他人的想法、听音乐、欣赏风景、在海滩上散步。”
quote_en:
“Reading is like thinking, like praying, like talking to a friend, like expressing your ideas, like listening to other people's ideas, like listening to music, like looking at the view, like taking a walk on the beach.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “人往往会成为他认为自己是什么样的人。如果我一直对自己说我不能做某件事，我可能会最终真的无法做到。相反，如果我相信我能做到，即使一开始我可能没有能力，我也一定会获得做这件事的能力。”
quote_en:
“Man often becomes what he believes himself to be. If I keep on saying to myself that I cannot do a certain thing, it is possible that I may end by really becoming incapable of doing it. On the contrary, if I have the belief that I can do it, I shall surely acquire the capacity to do it even if I may not have it at the beginning.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们不需要一张是非清单，一张做与不做的表格：我们需要书籍、时间和沉默。沉默很快就会被遗忘，但会永远持续下去。”
quote_en:
“We don’t need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don’ts: we need books, time, and silence.  is soon forgotten, but  lasts forever.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我希望每个人都能见到你。你是我最喜欢的人。”
quote_en:
“I want everyone to meet you. You're my favorite person of all time.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你永远不知道生活是什么样的，直到你经历过它。”
quote_en:
“You never know what life is like, until you have lived it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们不记得日子，我们记得时刻。”
quote_en:
“We do not remember days, we remember moments.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “幸福不是没有问题，而是处理问题的能力。”
quote_en:
“Happiness is not the absence of problems, it's the ability to deal with them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “问你想要什么，并准备好得到它！”
quote_en:
“Ask for what you want and be prepared to get it!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: Darkling瘫倒在椅子上。“好吧，”他疲惫地耸耸肩说。“让我成为你的恶棍。”
quote_en:
“The Darkling slumped back in his chair. “Fine,” he said with a weary shrug. “Make me your villain.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我希望你能找到一个你离不开的人。真的。我希望你永远不必知道没有他们的生活是什么感觉。”
quote_en:
“I hope you find someone you can't live without.I really do. And I hope you never have to know what it's like to have to try and live without them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我觉得有人给我的肺里注入了新的空气。我不是艾博。我不是无畏。我是发散者。”
quote_en:
“I feel like someone breathed new air into my lungs. I am not Abnegation. I am not Dauntless. I am Divergent.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我总是很开心，”萨莎说。“有时候我只是忘了。”
quote_en:
“I'm always happy," Sasha said. "Sometimes I just forget.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不是天使，”我断言，“我至死都不会成为天使：我会做我自己。罗切斯特先生，你既不能期望也不能要求我做任何天上的事——因为你不会得到它，就像我不会从你那里得到它一样：这是我完全没有预料到的。”
quote_en:
“I am not an angel,' I asserted; 'and I will not be one till I die: I will be myself. Mr. Rochester, you must neither expect nor exact anything celestial of me - for you will not get it, any more than I shall get it of you: which I do not at all anticipate.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “道德只是我们对自己不喜欢的人采取的态度。”
quote_en:
“Morality is simply the attitude we adopt towards people we personally dislike.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我所爱的心灵一定有狂野的地方。”
quote_en:
“The mind I love must have wild places.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “世界上每一个怪人都在我的波长上。”
quote_en:
“Every weirdo in the world is on my wavelength.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “生活真的很简单，但我们坚持要让它变得复杂。”
quote_en:
“Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你开车离开人们，他们在平原上退去，直到你看到他们的斑点散开时，你会有什么感觉？-这是一个太大的世界在向我们招手，这是再见。但我们期待着天空下的下一次疯狂冒险。”
quote_en:
“What is that feeling when you're driving away from people and they recede on the plain till you see their specks dispersing? - it's the too-huge world vaulting us, and it's good-bye. But we lean forward to the next crazy venture beneath the skies.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “也许有很多值得为之献身的原因，但对我来说，当然，没有一个值得为之杀戮。”
quote_en:
“There are perhaps many causes worth dying for, but to me, certainly, there are none worth killing for.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “并非所有面临的事情都可以改变，但在面对之前，什么都不能改变。”
quote_en:
“Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “其他人已经看到了什么，并问为什么。我已经看到了可能的情况，并问了为什么不。”
quote_en:
“Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not. ”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想，只有那些什么都不做的人才不会犯错。”
quote_en:
“It's only those who do nothing that make no mistakes, I suppose.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “用一个行为给一颗心带来快乐，胜过一千个低头祈祷的人。”
quote_en:
“To give pleasure to a single heart by a single act is better than a thousand heads bowing in prayer.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “诗歌是翻译中丢失的东西。”
quote_en:
“Poetry is what gets lost in translation.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们都是天生的性生物，感谢上帝，但遗憾的是，这么多人鄙视和践踏这种天赋。”
quote_en:
“We are all born sexual creatures,thank God, but it's a pity so many people despise and crush this natural gift.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “与女人的爱相比，什么是荣誉？什么是责任，不让新生的儿子在你怀里的感觉……或者记住兄弟的微笑？风和言语。风和言语！我们只是人类，众神为爱塑造了我们。这是我们的伟大荣耀，也是我们的巨大悲剧。”
quote_en:
“What is honor compared to a woman's love? What is duty against the feel of a newborn son in your arms . . . or the memory of a brother's smile? Wind and words. Wind and words. We are only human, and the gods have fashioned us for love. That is our great glory, and our great tragedy.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我很好的时候，我很好，但当我不好的时候我会更好。”
quote_en:
“When I'm good, I'm very good, but when I'm bad, I'm better. ”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你可能会讲一个故事，它占据了某人的灵魂，成为他们的血液、自我和目的。这个故事会感动他们，驱使他们，谁知道他们会因为你的话而这样做。这是你的角色，你的天赋。”
quote_en:
“You may tell a tale that takes up residence in someone's soul, becomes their blood and self and purpose. That tale will move them and drive them and who knows that they might do because of it, because of your words. That is your role, your gift.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “可怕的是假装二流是一流的。当你需要爱的时候，假装你不需要爱；或者当你很清楚自己有能力做得更好的时候，你喜欢你的工作。”
quote_en:
“What's terrible is to pretend that second-rate is first-rate. To pretend that you don't need love when you do; or you like your work when you know quite well you're capable of better.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当我们还是孩子的时候，我们很少考虑未来。这种天真让我们像很少有成年人那样自由地享受生活。我们担心未来的那一天，就是我们把童年抛在脑后的一天。”
quote_en:
“When we are children we seldom think of the future. This innocence leaves us free to enjoy ourselves as few adults can. The day we fret about the future is the day we leave our childhood behind.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果我对自己不好，我怎么能指望别人对我好呢？”
quote_en:
“If I am not good to myself, how can I expect anyone else to be good to me?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “睡吧，那些小小的死亡碎片——我多么讨厌它们。”
quote_en:
“Sleep, those little slices of death — how I loathe them.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “学习规则，打破规则，制定新规则，打破新规则。”
quote_en:
“Learn the rules, break the rules, make up new rules, break the new rules.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “理想情况下，在每个孩子的整个学校生活中，应该反复对他们说这样的话：‘你们正在接受灌输。我们还没有形成一个不是灌输的教育体系。我们很抱歉，但这是我们所能做的最好的。你们在这里所受的教育是当前偏见和这种特定文化选择的混合体。只要稍微看一眼历史，就会发现这些东西是多么的无常。你们所受的是那些能够适应前辈所建立的思想体系的人。这是一个自我延续的体系。你们中比其他人更强大、更具个性的人将被鼓励离开。并找到教育自己的方法——教育自己的判断。那些留下来的人必须永远记住，他们正在被塑造和塑造，以适应这个特定社会的狭隘和特殊需求。”
quote_en:
“Ideally, what should be said to every child, repeatedly, throughout his or her school life is something like this: 'You are in the process of being indoctrinated. We have not yet evolved a system of education that is not a system of indoctrination. We are sorry, but it is the best we can do. What you are being taught here is an amalgam of current prejudice and the choices of this particular culture. The slightest look at history will show how impermanent these must be. You are being taught by people who have been able to accommodate themselves to a regime of thought laid down by their predecessors. It is a self-perpetuating system. Those of you who are more robust and individual than others will be encouraged to leave and find ways of educating yourself — educating your own judgements. Those that stay must remember, always, and all the time, that they are being moulded and patterned to fit into the narrow and particular needs of this particular society.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “无可指责的信徒的命运是多么幸福啊！世界遗忘了，被世界遗忘了。一尘不染的心灵永恒的阳光！每一个祈祷都被接受了，每一个愿望都被放弃了。”
quote_en:
“How happy is the blameless vestal’s lot!The world forgetting, by the world forgot.Eternal sunshine of the spotless mind!Each pray’r accepted, and each wish resign’d”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果你想快乐，就要快乐。”
quote_en:
“If you want to be happy, be.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这就是女孩的特点。每次她们做漂亮的事，即使她们没什么好看的，或者即使她们有点愚蠢，你都会爱上她们，然后你永远不知道自己到底在哪里。女孩。天哪。她们会让你发疯的。她们真的会。”
quote_en:
“That's the thing about girls. Every time they do something pretty, even if they're not much to look at, or even if they're sort of stupid, you fall in love with them, and then you never know where the hell you are. Girls. Jesus Christ. They can drive you crazy. They really can.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我想了又想，我已经无数次地认为自己失去了幸福，但从来没有一次进入幸福。”
quote_en:
“I think and think and think, I‘ve thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “所以这是真的，当一切尘埃落定时，悲伤是我们为爱付出的代价。”
quote_en:
“So it’s true, when all is said and done, grief is the price we pay for love.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “别跟我打架了！”他说，试图拉住自己的手臂。他自己也处于危险的境地，跨过栏杆，试图靠得足够远，抓住我，真正抓住我。“放开我！”我喊道。但他太强壮了，设法把我大部分都拖过栏杆，这样我就不会再完全有摔倒的危险了。看，事情是这样的。在我放手之前的那一刻，我真的在考虑我的死亡。我接受了它。然而，我也知道迪米特里可能会做这样的事。他就是那么快，那么好。这就是为什么我他手里拿着我的木桩，那只手是自由的。我看着他的眼睛。“我会永远爱你的。“然后，我把木桩刺进了他的胸膛。这并不像我想象的那么精确，也不像他躲避的那样熟练。我努力把木桩打得足够深，不确定我是否能从这个角度做到这一点。然后，他的挣扎停止了。他的眼睛盯着我，惊呆了，嘴唇张开，几乎露出了笑容，尽管那是一个可怕而痛苦的笑容。”这就是我应该说的……”他喘着气说。这是他的最后一句话”
quote_en:
“Stop fighting me!" he said, trying to pull on the arm he held.He was in a precarious position himself, straddling the rail as he tried to lean over far enough to get me and actually hold onto me.“Let go of me!” I yelled back.But he was too strong and managed to haul most of me over the rail, enough so that I wasn’t in total danger of falling again.See, here’s the thing. In that moment before I let go, I really had been contemplating my death. I’d come to terms with it and accepted it. I also, however, had known Dimitri might do something exactly like this. He was just that fast and that good. That was why I was holding my stake in the hand that was dangling free.I looked him in the eye. "I will always love you."Then I plunged the stake into his chest.It wasn’t as precise a blow as I would have liked, not with the skilled way he was dodging. I struggled to get the stake in deep enough to his heart, unsure if I could do it from this angle. Then, his struggles stopped. His eyes stared at me, stunned, and his lips parted, almost into a smile, albeit a grisly and pained one."That’s what I was supposed to say. . .” he gasped out.Those were his last words.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时因为爱而失去平衡是平衡生活的一部分。”
quote_en:
“To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balancedlife.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “生活没有遥控器……起来自己改变吧！”
quote_en:
“Life has no remote....get up and change it yourself!”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “所有成就的起点都是欲望。要时刻牢记这一点。欲望弱，结果弱，就像小火生小火一样。”
quote_en:
“The starting point of all achievement is DESIRE. Keep this constantly in mind. Weak desire brings weak results, just as a small fire makes a small amount of heat.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “恐怕有时候你也会玩孤独的游戏。你赢不了的游戏，因为你会和你比赛。”
quote_en:
“I'm afraid that sometimes you'll play lonely games too. Games you can't win 'cause you'll play against you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我要把这桶水倒在地狱的火焰上，然后我要用这把火炬烧掉天堂的大门，这样人们就不会因为缺少天堂或害怕地狱而爱上帝，而是因为他是上帝。”
quote_en:
“I am going to take this bucket of water and pour it on the flames of hell, and then I am going to use this torch to burn down the gates of paradise so that people will not love God for want of heaven or fear of hell, but because He is God.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “她屋顶上闪闪发光的月亮，以及藏在她墙后的一千个灿烂的太阳，都数不清。”
quote_en:
“One could not count the moons that shimmer on her roofs,Or the thousand splendid suns that hide behind her walls.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “不要把你的爱浪费在一个不重视它的人身上。”
quote_en:
“Don't waste your love on somebody, who doesn't value it.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “哦，我们现在玩得很好？我们先喝茶好吗？泡一壶热吻我的屁股好吗？”
quote_en:
“Oh, we're playing nice now? Shall we have tea first? Brew up a nice pot of kiss-my-ass?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “诗歌是当没有其他东西可以时发生的事情。”
quote_en:
“Poetry is what happens when nothing else can.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你害怕什么，女士？”（阿拉贡）问。“一个笼子，”（欧温）说。“呆在监狱里，直到使用和年老接受它们，所有做大事的机会都已经超出了回忆或欲望。”
quote_en:
“What do you fear, lady?" [Aragorn] asked. "A cage," [Éowyn] said. "To stay behind bars, until use and old age accept them, and all chance of doing great deeds is gone beyond recall or desire.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “激情会让人停止吃饭、睡觉、工作，感到平静。很多人都很害怕，因为当激情出现时，它会摧毁沿途发现的所有旧事物。没有人希望自己的生活陷入混乱。这就是为什么很多人能够控制住这种威胁，并以某种方式维持一座已经腐烂的房子或建筑。他们是被取代者的工程师。其他人的想法恰恰相反：他们毫不犹豫地投降，希望在激情中找到解决所有问题的办法。他们让对方为自己的幸福负责，并责怪他们可能的不幸福。他们要么因为发生了不可思议的事情而感到高兴，要么因为意外的事情刚刚毁掉而感到沮丧。一切。克制激情还是盲目屈服于激情——这两种态度中哪一种破坏性最小？我不知道。”
quote_en:
“Passion makes a person stop eating, sleeping, working, feeling at peace. A lot of people are frightened because, when it appears, it demolishes all the old things it finds in its path. No one wants their life thrown into chaos. That is why a lot of people keep that threat under control, and are somehow capable of sustaining a house or a structure that is already rotten. They are the engineers of the superseded. Other people think exactly the opposite: they surrender themselves without a second thought, hoping to find in passion the solutions to all their problems. They make the other person responsible for their happiness and blame them for their possible unhappiness. They are either euphoric because something marvelous has happened or depressed because something unexpected has just ruined everything. Keeping passion at bay or surrendering blindly to it - which of these two attitudes is the least destructive? I don't know.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “历史并不总是重演。有时它只是大喊，‘你不记得我告诉过你什么吗？’然后让我们用棍子飞吧。”
quote_en:
“History does not always repeat itself. Sometimes it just yells, 'Can't you remember anything I told you?' and lets fly with a club.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “伙计，当你失去笑声时，你就失去了立足点。”
quote_en:
“Man, when you lose your laugh you lose your footing.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们按照梦想生活——独自一人……”
quote_en:
“We live as we dream--alone....”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “敢于过自己梦想的生活。勇往直前，让梦想成真。”
quote_en:
“Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself. Go forward and make your dreams come true.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “毫无理由地帮助别人，不期望得到任何回报。”
quote_en:
“Help others without any reason and give without the expectation of receiving anything in return.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “愿你的足迹弯曲、蜿蜒、孤独、危险，通往最令人惊叹的景色。”
quote_en:
“May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “怎么了？”我问。“你告诉我，”他说。“你就是那个准备和阿德里安亲热的人。”“这是一个实验，”我说。“这是我治疗的一部分。”你到底在接受什么治疗？”
quote_en:
“What's up?" I asked.You tell me," he said. "You were the one about ready to start making out with Adrian."It was an experiment," I said. "It was part of my therapy."What the hell kind of therapy are you in?”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “永远不要把朋友抛在身后。朋友是我们度过此生的唯一依靠，也是我们下一辈子唯一希望看到的东西。”
quote_en:
“Never leave a friend behind. Friends are all we have to get us through this life--and they are the only things from this world that we could hope to see in the next.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “可悲的事实是，真相是可悲的。”
quote_en:
“The sad truth is the truth is sad.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “和平不能靠武力来维持；它只能通过理解来实现。”
quote_en:
“Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “无论何时你思考、相信或知道，你都是很多其他人：但当你感受到的那一刻，你只是你自己。”
quote_en:
“Whenever you think or you believe or you know, you're a lot of other people: but the moment you feel, you're nobody-but-yourself.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “然后我感到很难过，因为我意识到，一旦人们在某些方面崩溃了，他们就永远无法修复，这是年轻时没有人告诉你的事情，随着年龄的增长，当你看到生活中的人一个接一个地崩溃时，你总是会感到惊讶。你想知道什么时候会轮到你，或者它是否已经发生了。”
quote_en:
“And then I felt sad because I realized that once people are broken in certain ways, they can't ever be fixed, and this is something nobody ever tells you when you are young and it never fails to surprise you as you grow older as you see the people in your life break one by one. You wonder when your turn is going to be, or if it's already happened.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我不想仅仅为了结婚而结婚。我想不出还有什么比和一个我无法交谈的人共度余生更孤独的了，或者更糟糕的是，和一个不能沉默的人在一起。”
quote_en:
“I don't want to be married just to be married. I can't think of anything lonelier than spending the rest of my life with someone I can't talk to, or worse, someone I can't be silent with.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “想象力就是一切。它是对生活即将到来的吸引力的预览。”
quote_en:
“Imagination is everything. It is the preview of life's coming attractions.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你介于梦想和奇迹之间。”
quote_en:
“You're something between a dream and a miracle.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “自杀的想法是一种极大的安慰：通过自杀，人们可以度过许多黑暗的夜晚。”
quote_en:
“The thought of suicide is a great consolation: by means of it one gets through many a dark night.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “人们在生命中的任何时候都有能力做他们梦想的事情。”
quote_en:
“People are capable, at any time in their lives, of doing what they dream of.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “听着，没有战争能结束所有的战争。”
quote_en:
“Listen up - there's no war that will end all wars.”
    
  ―

“I just want you to know that you’re very special… and the only reason I’m telling you is that I don’t know if anyone else ever has.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当东西断裂时，并不是真正的断裂阻止了它们再次结合在一起。这是因为有一小块东西丢失了——即使它们想结合，剩下的两端也无法结合。整个形状都发生了变化。”
quote_en:
“When things break, it's not the actual breaking that prevents them from getting back together again. It's because a little piece gets lost - the two remaining ends couldn't fit together even if they wanted to. The whole shape has changed.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “有时候，要想真正了解自己的立场，需要经历一次艰难的跌倒”
quote_en:
“Sometimes it takes a good fall to really know where you stand”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果每个人都管好自己的事，世界就会比现在快得多。”
quote_en:
“If everybody minded their own business, the world would go around a great deal faster than it does.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我去宗教不是为了让自己快乐。我一直都知道一瓶波特酒就能做到这一点。如果你想让宗教让你感到真正舒适，我当然不推荐基督教。”
quote_en:
“I didn’t go to religion to make me happy. I always knew a bottle of Port would do that. If you want a religion to make you feel really comfortable, I certainly don’t recommend Christianity.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “如果明智的人以无礼的方式做出愚蠢的事情，那么愚蠢的事情就不再愚蠢了。”
quote_en:
“Silly things do cease to be silly if they are done by sensible people in an impudent way.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “当你无法拥有爱时，性是你的慰藉”
quote_en:
“sex is the consolation you have when you can't have love”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这个世界上最不快乐的人，是那些最关心别人想法的人。”
quote_en:
“The unhappiest people in this world, are those who care the most about what other people think.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “这就是我们所说的爱。当你被爱时，你可以在创造中做任何事情。当你受到爱时，根本不需要了解发生了什么，因为一切都发生在你内心。”
quote_en:
“This is what we call love. When you are loved, you can do anything in creation. When you are loved, there's no need at all to understand what's happening, because everything happens within you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “我们应该在来世见面，我们应该在空中见面，我和你。”
quote_en:
“We should meet in another life, we should meet in air, me and you.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “别让麻瓜把你打倒了。”
quote_en:
“Don't let the muggles get you down.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “爱让你的灵魂从藏身之处爬出来。”
quote_en:
“Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “你拥有奢侈之旅所需的一切，这就是你的生活。”
quote_en:
“You have everything needed for the extravagant journey that is your life.”
    
  ―

quote_zh: “成为墓地里最富有的人对我来说并不重要。晚上睡觉时说我们做了一些很棒的事情……这对我来说很重要。”
quote_en:
“Being the richest man in the cemetery doesn't matter to me. Going to bed at night saying we've done something wonderful... that's what matters to me.”
    
  ―
